text:
Really good as far as classes go

Hits everything by combining cardio and strength

Half of the class is spent on the treadmill on an incline, the other half is spent on the floor using equipment like medicine balls along w body weight exercises. 

The class tailors itself to your needs. There are options for intense workouts and beginners alike.

My wife and I were In town visiting family and friends over the Christmas holiday season.  We each purchased a 7 day pass.  The staff is friendly and the gym is in excellent condition (very clean - new equipment).  The owner/manager takes a lot of pride in the facility and it shows - highly recommend.

I dropped in for a whole week. Great mix of highly skilled athletes and beginners. The coaches were experts and were hospitable. The gym was clean, spacious, organized, and had all of the peripheral-but-not-necessary equipment you want in a gym.

I was in St. Louis for a week and had the opportunity to work out twice at this facility, once at 4:15 p.m. and once at 7 a.m.. The trainers were excellent, and they kept on us to maintain good form and push ourselves--they definitely were not phoning it in! 

This is one of the biggest CrossFit's you'll find, with a long, two-sided rack, two huge classrooms, a nice electronic system for tracking your weights and showing who's in the class, and a large stock of equipment. They offer a variety of classes at different times. It's clean, and the parking is easy. Go! You will not be disappointed.
Dropped in for class while visiting from CA. Such a welcoming crew and fantastic facility. Will be back!
Visited this gym as a drop-in. Great facility (huge!), easy to get set up as a visitor, good coaching and crowd. Will come back the next time I'm in town!

Was visiting from out of town & dropped in on a 9:30 class. Everyone was super welcoming and the workout was challenging. Definitely not used to those workouts with the added humidity. Large space with lots of fans for some much needed airflow. Was able to purchase a cool shirt too! Thanks for the warm welcome Crossfit St. Louis!

Looking for a workout like nothing you've done before? To push yourself to limits you didn't know you could achieve? That's CrossFit! It's Olympic lifting, it's gymnastics, it's crazy stuff that I had never done before and now I'm hooked. It's not a gym in the traditional meaning, it's coach led classes. 

This place is great. I shopped around and went to many of the other St. Louis CrossFit boxes and fell in love with the staff, the support, and the people here. The location is brand spanking new, it's super clean and organized, and the people are so helpful and supportive. It's like I found a family of people who push each other to do their best. Cheesy, but totally true. 

There are free intro classes on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 7:30pm or call and see if they can do a free private session (that's what they did for me). It's not cheap, but it's worth every penny.

Went here for my 26th birthday with a group of 8. It was all of our first times rock climbing. The two instructors were very patient with us and even made a few jokes. We all had an amazing time. It's conveniently located down the street from Victory Brewery. We would all definitely go back!

The old facility was nice and the location was GREAT.  Personally, I don't care much for socializing at the gym.  Everyone was very good about respecting my privacy, but I also got the impression that it was a very warm and friendly environment.  I like this over the aggressive tones that I sometimes get from other gyms (maybe I'm paranoid).  In the fall of 2013, Boost announced a move and MASSIVE facility upgrade.  I saw the plans and new that this was going to be very nice.  I immediately renewed my contract for the next 2 years to lock in my rate.  I moved to the new facility and have been enjoying watching everything come together as I work out.

Sadly, I was informed in early March 2014 that my job would be sending me out of town for the next 10-12 months.  I remembered checking out the Boost reviews and DREADED trying to close my contract.  Technically, I am not changing addresses (I'll be living out of hotels) and I know that it is not permanent.  I read the agreement and I did not feel like I had good argument other than it was a special situation.  I started the cancellation process online and tried to make sure that my situation was understood. I wanted to make sure that I was polite and understanding in the fairness of the situation for both parties.

The GOOD:  Joey and Jon took great care of me.  As soon as I got them all of the facts and had a face-to-face, the problem was solved.  I am not happy to be leaving MY GYM, but I am happy that they made the situation much easier.

The BAD:  It was a bit difficult to get ahold of Joey to start (I did not start by putting in my 30day online notice).  Obviously, it was during their huge renovation AND during the spring membership/renewal rush.  The day that I had my face-to-face, I watched him take back-to-back appointments for a good 90 minutes during my workout before I approached him. It is a small business going through a busy time, no big deal.

Conclusion:  This place is great and the other reviews support that (unless you plan on dropping your contract).  I feel like I would have been writing a very different review if I hadn't been polite.  I had a contract with Boost that I had to break.  I pleaded my case and asked for understanding.  Because of that, I am leaving on good terms and can't wait to tour the finished facility when I come back!

I absolutely love this gym.  The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and a true joy to work with & be around (from the initial tour, to billing, to everyday questions, you name it.)  They offer a wide array of group classes with fun instructors, to which none of the classes are ever 100% full, which I love because I get my own space and don't feel "stared at."  The cardio area is large with a nice selection of equipment; I've never had to wait on a machine either, which is a huge plus for me.  I'm not one to really socialize while working out unless I specifically come with someone to workout with... that said, on the floor, everyone really respects the space of those around them but doesn't make the environment feel cold or unwelcoming.

I absolutely love how on Monday evenings and Saturday mornings a local farmers market sets up in the lobby with luscious greens, farm fresh eggs and fresh seasonal fruit/veggies.  Talk about encouragement and a friendly reminder to be healthy from within, too!  They also have a health-conscious chef delivering homemade soups, fresh juices and other meals in their cafe to take with you (which comes in handy those nights I'm working out late or I'm on the go with no time to cook.)  I have to give them huge props in this area on standing out as their own entity in the vicinity.

Overall, the environment is great, the facility is clean and I would highly recommend this gym over any other one in our area.  My only suggestion to the club would be for the child care: to segregate the children by age groups (i.e. separating the older children from the younger toddlers/babies.)  Oh, and let me add... the pool is salt water :)

Can't say enough good things about Phil and his shop.    I've been there multiple times for shoe fittings and always leave with a smile on my face.   Service is always excellent and most importantly I leave with the feeling that my business is truly valued.   Prices are standard across the board (same you'd pay anywhere, even online) but the service is what keeps me coming back and telling all of my friends/family.   

Also, one of the few non-crossfit gyms in the city with bumpers and actual lifting platforms.   Unsure if there are real weightlifters that train here, but he has proper gear to do so.

I'm a member here and I've never liked any gyms, at ALL, until I found this one. First of all, you don't have to sign a contract. YES! Second, it's only $40 a month. Granted, it's not a very big gym, but it has everything I need to get my work on. It's on the third floor of a glass building, so you can work on the machines while looking out on Philly's beautiful skyline. 

The owner, Phil, is a really talented, smart guy and is there to help you in whatever way he can. Not only does he sell shoes (the right shoes for YOUR special feet), but he offers full-body stretches, training sessions ($20 per half hour, $40 per hour), and grocery lists/meal ideas to help you get your body where you want it.

Free parking in a lot across the street, unless there's a big event going on in the Piazza.

The equipment is in great shape, the place is always unbelievably clean.  It's smaller than most gyms, but never crowded.  And the price is fair, considering weekend hours are short.  Doesn't have all the bells and whistles of a larger gym - but has what I need (cardio and weights).  Glad to have it in the neighborhood.

The Training Station is by far the best gym I have ever belonged to.  As a resident of a Tower property (the investment group that owns the building the gym is in) my membership is only $20/month.  Anyone can join for $40/month and there's no contract.

This gym is absolutely spotless.  Each machine has it's own spray sanitizer as well as a towel. The cardio machines are all new and fully compatible with ipods/iphones.  There are also plenty of other weight machines and free weights.  Phil, the owner, is very nice and always willing to give you pointers or answer any questions.  Plus, there are buttons scattered about by all of the cardio machines.  After running for awhile it is quite satisfying to hit the button and hear "That was easy!".

Clean, simple, well set up, quiet(ish) and never too crowded.  It is not a gym where people pump in front of mirrors and try to get dates.  It is a gym where serious people go to get in shape or maintain.  You have everything from people who are a little heavy and trying to lose to people who look like they spend much of their life working out.  

The view is awesome.  The owner, Phil, is almost as awesome as the view.  I love the fact you don't need to have a contract.  My wife decided to stop going and avail herself to our home gym and her cancellation was easy. Phil ended the contract and simply told her "you are still always welcomed back."  Classy.

Everything you need is here, free weights, machines, tons of cardio machines, shoes, drinks, trainers and more.  I have just never had such a great vibe at a gym.  And nor have I ever seen one where everything looks new and spotless.

Great equipment (generally Rogue or other top brands), to include a nice variety (battle ropes, lifting platform, bumper plates, bands, TRX, kettlebells, etc.).  The owner is super nice.  Only caveat, would love to see heavier kettlebells.

I have been a member of Key 2 Fitness for over a year.  I like the smaller gym atmosphere because I feel like I'm going to meet friends when I go workout.  The gym is very clean and the equipment is new.  I am super picky about machines and Key has quality machines and free weights.  The trainers are all very friendly and mellow, which adds to the inviting environment.  My only complaint is that I wish there were more stairmills (there is currently only one), but there are other cardio machines to use when the stairmill is occupied.  This gym has clean restrooms/showers and a great overall atmosphere.
Favorite gym in town! LOVE the Rogue weights they have!

First, its a small gym. However, there is rarley more then a few people there and a lot of the time, you have the whole place to yourself. 24-hour access via key card.There are big screen TVs with the remotes at your fingertips. There is also a stereo system you can plug any mp3 player into. All the members are really cool as well as the owner who also worksout there. They keep the showers and bathrooms very clean. Member rates are very flexible and reasonable. Head down there and get one week free to see if its for you.

There is no question, this is the best gym in town! The staff is kind, the facility is clean, and the ambiance is great. They offer complimentary wifi! The gym is located in a building with a second floor loft, where the first floor is for cardio and intense weight lifting and the second is more for relaxing workouts. They offer fitness classes and personal trainers. Al around, I love this place especially because it is open 24 hours. I recommend all to stop on by and give this place a try!

excellent find, thanks, Yelp! !  This venue is within walking distance of my hotel and open 24 hours. I purchased a day pass online and was granted access via a keycode. The venue is one of the cleanest gyms ever encountered, the late night team member was non-stop tending to gym tasks. The gym is completely equipped for my workouts (cardio, core, some lifting). If Key2Fitness opens a branch in my hometown I would not hesitate to join.

I love this gym! Key 2 Fitness is sparkling clean, just the perfect amount of space for a small gym. There is always plenty of space for everyone. The vibe is good! Everyone takes care of the machines, for the most part cleans up after themselves and you always see friendly faces to make you feel welcomed. I can do my thing and get out feeling well taken care of at Key 2 Fitness. I think they are doing an amazing job trying to serve their members, I have no complaints and I really love going to this gym! Thank you!
Great gym with semi dated equipment but lots of open area to be able to get your workout in. Free weights and great balcony area with a cardio rower and standard treadmill gear.
Great place for gym membership. Centrally located on State St near the 101 with convenient parking. Open 24/7. Fellow gym goers have all been super friendly and respectful.

A gym where everybody is putting in work and giving it their all regardless of their fitness level. I train at Key with Kelly and I don't have a full time membership there, but if I had time to be in the gym without a trainer, I would want to join. It is always clean and organized, the trainers are all friendly and so are most of the people. The showers are convenient and my things are always 100% safe in the cubbies. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 is because sometimes things can get crowded if it is a peak hour and because everyone is serious about training machines or racks can be used by one person for 30 min at a time. However, it is available 24 hours/day so maybe just go when it's not so crowded!

Most people skip 5 star ratings because the reviews can come off fake, scripted, or asked by the owners to write a good review...although I genuinely believe what separates Key2Fitness from most businesses in general is the customer service. I've been a member as of April 2011, and the owner, Brian, has been consistent with upgrading his business, keeping the place very tidy, and is always sincerely kind and friendly the minute you see him. The gym isn't a large boutique-style gym, but  it is pretty good size, including a second floor loft area with more equipment and room. 

Even though I'm a poor college student, there are rates for everyone and not very high rates either. I'm usually on the look out to upgrades because Brian seems to stay on top of growing his business with new equipment, expansion of floor space, different kinds of group classes, etc.

Great gym! Clean, amazing trainers, good location, great equipment...

Personally, I workout with Wes and I can't say enough good things about him but I've seen other ones in action and they all seem great!

Absolutely love this gym!

Having spent a lot of time both training and working in gyms, I can say with complete confidence that Key 2 Fitness is by far the best gym in Santa Barbara!  Key 2 Fitness is the real MVP: cleanliness, quality of equipment, friendly members, 24/7 access...this gym has it all!  

The best part of the gym by far is the cleanliness.  I have visited this gym as early as 5am and as late as 2am and everywhere in between and every single time it is immaculate.  Other members actually wipe down the equipment after each use.  The bathrooms and showers are continually clean and dry.  

The variety of equipment is also impressive, from free weights, TRX and traditional squat racks/bench presses/machines.  I've never seen this place packed, and everyone is always respectful and friendly when using equipment.

If you want a full access gym without the intimidation or insane enrollment prices, come to Key 2 Fitness.  I cannot recommend it any higher.
Clean professional always enjoyable to visit a world-class place to exercise! They have great Internet clean bathrooms hot towels never crowded wouldn't think of going anywhere else!

best gym in town. i get to workout and not feel rushed whenever i work on the squat racks. I have a trainer named Shadoe (yes I am for real) and he's one of the best trainers, along with other awesome trainers that the gym offers. Very clean, very organized and it feels like your own home gym. 10/10!

Love this gym!

In Santa Barbara for work and had a 90 minute window to fit in a workout.  
Discovered Key 2 Fitness on Yelp and had a fantastic workout!

Day passes are cheap and on the honor system...you just walk in and start working out!  No droll sales pitch to sit through.
The facility is great.  Excellent selection of equipment and it's all very clean and fully functional.  They have everything you need, whether you're a serious lifter or a soccer mom.  

Space is bright and well ventilated with plenty of areas where you can do your own thing.  Instaed of locker rooms, there are spacious full bathrooms, complete with showers, towels and products.

Fantastic place for out-of-towners needing a workout, and would probalby be my regular gym if I were a local.

Came here on a trial day pass because I live in Los Angeles.  This gym has the necessities.  Really nice staff. Some equipment is dated, but hey... it's still just as heavy so Shut up!  Sorry. 

Had a great workout here while waiting for my sister who was at a wedding I wasn't invited to.
LOVE IT! Matt and Arnold are great and pushed me to exceed my goals and to work harder! I've been going for a while, but just started going consistently the past 3 months and I can see the results!

GREAT training.  The boot camps are fun and a great way to get back into shape.  With music, a group setting, and an instructor who motivates you, you'll feel the energy flowing right away! Just give them a week, you'll enjoy it!

I am just finishing my six week challenge, and I cannot begin to describe what an amazing experience I had here.  I have tried many diets before and failed.  This is not a diet - it truly is a transformation!!  It is an amazing difference not to do this alone.  My friend did this challenge last month, and I told her "I'll just do it along with you" what a laugh!  This is just something that can't be duplicated - the support, the instruction, you are shown how to do the exercises so you're not just guessing.  The fellow challengers are so supportive, the facebook support group with quick answers to your questions - it is just the whole package.  This an experience like no other!!  I have actually lost 20 pounds in 2 weeks and that is something I would have never thought possible before!!  I'm wearing all different clothes, and feel awesome!!  These trainers just get you through this and a lot of fun and energy.  I recommend this to anyone!!  Just do it!!!

Great team that is focus on Your Health and fitness    I have been going off and on for little over a year in the group setting.  Every day the workout is different and the trainer is encouraging.  They don not just focused on your training but your overall fitness.    Good equipment and communication.   Watch for their challenges to lose 20lbs in 6 weeks.    It is hard, but achievable.  I recently started personal sessions to fit better with my schedule and the results are showing.     Thanks Arnold for keeping me on track!

Steer clear of this place or prepare to be injured and robbed! Psychosomatic Fitness left me injured within days of signing a huge contract and then simply kept my payment in full. It's been over a year, I no longer live in Tucson, and the owners have made no effort to settle up with me. Simply put, their trainers program workouts that can lead to injury, easily and quickly, and then practice the poorest of business ethics when something goes wrong. In my case, I was asked to run sprint repeats at 100% effort in the gym's back parking lot. This ridiculous programming left me with a torn quad and a heel injury. Despite the gym's "See results or your money back!" guarantee, I was told "no refund is due." I lost months while I recovered in addition to $500 in prepaid class credits. I can't imagine having a worse experience with a gym and I wouldn't wish it on anyone.

Psychosomatic fitness has been my gym for three years.  They have met and exceeded every expectation I hold for a fitness center.  Each workout was fresh and creative - never boring or repetitive.  The instructors are enthusiastic and encouraging from 5 AM till 7 PM (particularly Eric, Arnold, and Brad).   The instructors give excellent form critiques - which is quite the task considering the diversity of athletic experience among their clientele.  The workouts are designed to challenge anyone who walks through the door, and they certainly challenged me!  I was never disappointed or left wanting more.  There is emphasis on core, scapular stabilizers, and glutes - which as a physical therapist, I appreciate SO much.  I cannot recommend this gym enough.  It has helped keep me strong, healthy, and happy for the last three years.  It's something special...a real gem!

I have been going to Psychosomatic Fitness since January. I don't have any experience to compare to. I just needed to change things, and with the help of Matt, Arnold, Josh and sometimes Brad I'm getting there. Initially I started with a 3week trial package and I then signed up for more permanent membership. Since there are always membership drives for the group classes I've signed up for, the classes can vary in size from 5-16 people. Psychosomatic Fitness offers classes as early as 5 am and as late as 6:30pm during the week and two sessions on Saturday morning at 8 and 9am. They are closed Sunday.
It's not at all easy but overall if you are willing to do the work, they provide the tools to help you reach your goals. No two sessions are the same, it is always a mix up of various things. 
I started out with a right foot injury and a left knee strain. So when it's time for certain sets, like box jumps, which pretty quickly hurt my knee, I tell them I need an alternative and they find alternatives to make sure I'm working what I need to without hurting myself. As hard as some sessions have been, I haven't injured myself and I've had success in losing weight and getting into better shape.

Hey club fitness. When Jim doesn't show up to instruct yoga. And we ask you if he's called in or even coming and you tell us you will try and get ahold of him and let us know, LET US KNOW! Instead of just sitting in the room doing nothing. Thanks.
Dirty equipment and locker rooms. The toilets seriously look like no one has ever cleaned them. The equipment is always broken. Way too crowded
This is definitely one of the nicer Club fitnesses (that doesn't tell you much tho ). But, it was very difficult to cancel my membership when I moved. Look out for extra charges.

The cancellation process has taken 4 months and over $80.

Canceling a Club Fitness account requires a MAILED cancellation form and 30 days notice.
Use certified mail and make sure you get a confirmation! I mailed in my cancellation in July, and I've just been charged for September. I called Customer Service and apparently it was "lost" in the mail and they cannot do anything. Now I have to mail in another cancellation letter and will be charged for October too.

After years of visiting what feels like every Club Fitness in the St. Louis region, I can confidently say that the Affton gym is the best of the lot. It's well-lit, has new machines, clean locker rooms, and great group classes. Everyone that I have interacted with has been friendly and helpful, from the front dest staff to the janitorial team. 

This gym is 24 hours, and the parking outside is well-lit, so you can feel safe walking in at all hours. I have not worked with any of their personal trainers, but the zumba and spinning instructors are helpful and encouraging. 

A few tips to get the most of your experience:
I don't recommend going on Mondays and Tuesdays between 5-8pm because that is when it seems to be the most crowded. I've never had trouble getting an elliptical/cardio equipment, but parking and waiting for free weights during this time can be frustrating. 

My only qualm is that many users do not wipe down the machines after use. This does not seem to be an issue with cardio equipment where there are sanitary stations at the ends of rows. However, this is not the fault of Club Fitness and I couldn't knock off a star. Just be sure to wipe down your machines before and after use to be safe!

I've been going to gyms for almost 35 years (Gold, World, 24 hour fitness, etc...).  I'd put club fitness toward the top for various reasons.
1) Many locations
2) Most are fairly large with much variety
3) Clean
4) decent equipment

I did the $379 for two years. How can you beat the price. Less than $200 a year. There are even many other choices that are cheaper. 

If you workout on a regular basis its an easy decision to join.

I've been a member here since the location opened. I must say I actually enjoy coming here! It is spacious, full of friendly people, and has all the amenities you could ever need. I mostly go for the group fitness classes, in particular Zumba and Yoga. The GF studio is twice the size of any of the other Club Fitness locations. If they ever got a barre inspired class going here I would be the happiest camper!!!

Go check out this branch of Planet Fitness.  The first thing you will encounter is the amazingly friendly staff.  They are always willing to help and guide you along hour path to fitness.   Extremely clean facility with new equipment, bright roomy dressing rooms and hot showers. It's difficult at the best of times to keep motivated to exercise, but with being able to go to this facility it makes it a little easier.   Shout out to Jessica and Eddie. They always give a sincere hello and have a great day.

I love our YMCA. lots of classes to take and child care available. Indoor and outdoor pools. 
The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because they don't offer afternoon classes for those who exercise on their lunch breaks.
Very friendly staff.  2 hours of free child care with family membership.  Lots of family activities.

I've been a member here since the start of the New Year--yes, I'm one of those people.  Resolutions!  Parking is pretty tight, but you always find a spot.  Despite it being busy, I've never had a problem getting the equipment I want no matter the time.  A lot of the classes do fill up though, so if you plan on attending give yourself a 5 min cushion. I wouldn't expect to stroll in late after the music has started and get a spot.  Love the open courts for pick up bball and volleyball.  I haven't tried out the pool yet, but I'm looking forward to it.  So many nice perks and add ons that make the Y worth the little extra per month compared to a franchise gym.  They offer corporate and family discounts- be sure to check out your options!

We've been members of the Y for several years now and primarily visit this branch. In my experience, the group ex classes (which are my favorite way to work out) are superior to other Y branches. The instructors are qualitfied, spirited and FUN! They have a great mix of classes, from dance-focused to strength and toning. 

The facility has highs and lows. 

The highs: 
-clean
-well stocked with towels
-REALLY like that it's on one floor
-classes are offered ALL the time
-awesome childwatch
-equipment is updated often and it very high quality
-generally nice staff
-indoor pool, which is great for the kiddos in the winter
-you can visit any Indy Y with your membership

The lows:
-terrible locker rooms, feels like a high school gym locker room. eek!
-no sauna
-a small play area structure (when compared to other branches)
-children's classes (gymnastics, music, etc) OFTEN get cancelled due to enrollment--i think the ratio has to be 6 enrolled for 1 teacher, which i find to be very high. 
-Lifeguards: some are very tuned-in when watching the kid's pool, but others are clearly there for social hour, lots of talking in groups with backs turned to the pool and wearing shoes (SHOES!) when in the guard chair. I mean, yes, please swiftly swim to my drowning child in high tops!

All in all, it's a good facility that offers a lot of options for working out or playing with the family. Compared to other cities, the Indy Y's are about as low cost as you can get--membership fees fluctuate depending on the city in which they are located. It's good bang for your buck.

This is a fantastic YMCA location. 

We are members and have a one year old daughter. The child care here is just so fantastic to have available. You can leave your child with the staff for up to two hours. This is longer than we ever have, but it's great to be able to get in a full fitness class and not feel rushed. 

The staff is supportive and friendly. We haven't had any negative interactions and really feel that the people here are involved because they value the mission of the YMCA. 

The facility has a large indoor pool, another large indoor splash pool, an outdoors pool and splash park. It has a cycling room, and a very large indoor gym area. Of course it has a weight room. There's also an indoor play place that's great for waiting for your significant other with the baby. Lastly, there's a Subway indoors! We don't typically eat at Subway, but I have to say that after a day of work and a lin workout, sometimes it's a nice option to be able to sit with my wife and baby and have a quick sandwich to save time cooking. 

I highly recommend this Y. 

Last tip! If you are pressed financially, make sure to check and see if you are eligible for financial aid. Be prepared to bring your pay stub.

I absolutely adore the Fishers YMCA! Always incredibly clean, and the staff is super friendly. 

They have enough equipment that I've never had to do the stare off while waiting for weights or a treadmill, and we all know how awkward the stare off can be. 

Overall a great place with an awesome variety of classes.

3.5- (begin singing village people song if you haven't already)

In an effort to bring sexy back (again), the wife and I signed up to join the Y a few weeks ago.  They had a special no membership fee weekend, so we cashed in.

From what I am told, this is the newest Y (read best) in the Indy area.  The facility is pretty big.  It's got 3 pools, indoor and outdoor bball courts, a subway onsite, and of course weights and cardio galore.  The coolest thing about the Y in my opinion is their weight machines.  A Y trainer will sit down with you, create a workout with the machines, and you can track your progress electronically.  It tells you what weight and spec you should be setting the machine, how much you've lifted, how many times you've lifted, etc...  And it's all included in the basic membership.

They also have classes such as BOSU, spinning,  Zumba, pilates, yoga, etc...  I think the pilates and yoga might cost extra, but again, the rest is included in the membership.

I've only balled there once, and they were playing "prison rules" so I'm going to have to leave my country club game at home.

Overall- Compared to most workout places, the membership fee is pretty reasonable.  Check it out, winter is just around the corner folks!

Chuck Norris rating- Beard of Fury!

Love this center!! There is everything you need can I be healthy and active right in one place including a subway to workout then eat week!  Plenty of machine to choose from with classes and pools to experience as well Programs for all ages young to old and plenty of staff to help with any of your needa

Great gym. It is huge. They even have a mini water park in the summer. Brought my 2 year old for swim lessons. Emily is a great instructor. I only gave it a 4 instead of a 5 because it's a little older and some of the staff could be friendlier. Other than that I would recommend.

Awesome, supportive staff and great programming for the whole family. I've been using the BikeHub, Baxter and Jordan Y lately and have found them all top-knotch for folks of every fitness level. So approachable. :)
Nice gym, but the day price is definetly not worth it. There are many gyms with similar traits that are for cheaper.

this was by far one of the saddest 24 hour fitnesses I've been to.  their equipment is pretty old, and they don't have any weights in the 2.5 lb increment.. actually, i lie, they had one set of 7.5 weights.  some of their cardio equipment could use some upgrades as well, the stair masters didn't work so smoothly, and made weird noises.  it looks like they had a pool, but i didn't check it out.   i think i'd be bored  coming to this gym on a regular basis due to the lack of variety... i'm glad i was just visiting.

Cheap! $25 bucks a month with no contract or joiners fee.
Lots of machines and open 24 hours. Has a convenient parking lot so you aren't walking around in a shady neighborhood at night to get back to your car.I don't need anything else.
Wait....they do need a new scale in the women's locker room.  
 
It's nothing like the spa like gym I used to belong to but considering I pay 1/3 the price and don't have a contract and the hours are better, I'm not going to complain.

Thanks to my pass, I can attend any Active or Sport, so this one is included! If you read my other review, you know I haven't been doing the gym thing for quite a while, except the park and at home (Insanity Anyone?). 

I joined a gym for consistency, my place isn't big, and often I have to much stuff in too little of space, so home workouts are harder, then I heard about a couple of stabbings at Virginia Lake that were not on the news including a lady who was killed, kind of killed my park vibe. 

Especially knowing 2 people followed this lady and child, who cashed her check at the Peppermill to the park, and did the deed, again not on the news. I meet a guy working out there, who was there when 15 cop cars and the fire department was fishing her body out of the lake, so yeah, not feeling the park anymore. 

I like this location in some ways better than the other because first it is TRULY 24 hours. I think this gym is an excellent gym, and offers an in-door hot tub, that is probably 102 to 103, so yeah I could go hotter, but solid enough to appeal to everyone. I don't know why there are so many low reviews, not sure what it used to be, but I find the staff, very nice and helpful. Actually I find that at both locations, I am in the service business, and you know when someone cares, and someone is passing the time, and always seen the former and not the latter. 

Other things I like about this gym is this climbing gizmo, it's the hardest cardio and muscle thing I have ever done, so far I think I am up to 200 feet, not sure how to read the numbers, but it's EXHAUSTING both muscles and wind, so I LIKEY! 

All the equipment is in order, and they have MANY machines, although a couple of the tread mills making noise, probably need an adjustment or something. My only reason for the 4 stars is some of the equipment isn't as primed as it could be, display might be off a bit, the seat on the bicycle is hard to adjust, not big deal stuff, but after training at the other location you notice small stuff. My biggest 4 star reason though is having to change the channel on the TV from downstairs, when you are training upstairs. 

I frequently have been doing the TV thing at 24 Hour, it gets my mind off sweating, breathing, and thinking all those dumb thoughts you get about how you need to stop, it burns, I need to quit, etc. It keeps my mind on my goal, whether it's a mile, 1/2 mile, a time commitment, etc. that I create when I get on a machine. The TV keeps my mind from dwelling on things I would rather not think about, so yeah, it's kind of important to me, and it's not convenient to go downstairs stick a remote upwards, change the channel, then go back upstairs to train. So fix this Sky Valley Drive location, and YOU ARE 5 STARS all the WAY!

The sauna is disgusting. I have repeatedly asked red shirted staff to look at the green fuzzy smelly stuff under the bench and please ask their manager to look to the cleaning staff. I was rudely and or abruptly dismissed by smug 20 something's. I was told it's not their job, it's not the cleaning crews job, the bench doesn't come up (lie I checked and gagged when I saw what was under there). Come on u piss poor excuse for a staff handle the obvious situation. And management I am sorry if u only pay these people peanuts but there is a huge difference in the personality of customer facing front of the house and back of the house guy. Figure it out or abstain from selecting new hires. You have a shining example tall black guy, he should be in charge of all future hires. And For Christ sake your maintenance guy is friendlier than the red shirts what's that about.

Dark, dingy, depressing interior 
in desperate need of renovation. Weight machines are outdated and not smooth functioning. I don't recommend you waste your money here.

Has everything you need to get a great workout but there are too many simple improvements that need to be made. There's always a constant stench next to the  30-45lb dumbbells. There is a severe lack of clips for olympic weights. Most of the pegs for pulley machines are detached. There are leaks in the ceiling when it rains. Not too much for air circulation. Only half of the bolted down benches are in front of mirrors. And the benches that are bolted down are pretty basic none of them are fully adjustable. The rest of the machines are all pretty old but work fine for the most part, some could use some lubricant.

I'm new to this gym and I came from a much nicer low key one. Anyways besides the fact that the gym isn't too nice I thought I'd stick with it and give it a chance. Well if you like to drive your car to the gym then make sure there's absolutely nothing to take.  My car was broken into last night and while about 10 different people walked by, half of them said that their car has been broken into here. Okay so why doesn't the gym do anything about this? I asked to see the security cameras and the girl and the front desk said she doesn't have access to them. She also started giggling when I started to cry because of how frustrated I was. I'm going in today and canceling because I don't feel comfortable with homeless people hanging out around the entrance and getting my window busted out.

Staff: There are a few here that are friendly and outgoing. I have never had a bad experience but this staff can learn a little something from the Neil road location about calling people by name and giving a good greeting. They'd also probably generate a little more revenue for the gym if they mentioned specials, merchandise sales, offered samples and walked the floor.

Equipment: Eh...corporate needs to find some budget to re-do this gym like they did for Neil road. The equipment is good enough to get the job done and they have enough functional floor space to get a good work out in but it's not the latest equipment and there's usually 1-2 pieces that aren't working at any given time.  They could use an updated look here as well. 

Negative: no kids club. They got rid of this recently. It's not something I used every day but it was handy and a great selling point when I needed it. 

With so many gyms in this area, they need to find their niche again. It's an OK gym and the location is convenient but it's lacking something. If I were looking for a gym in Reno now I might not choose them but I've been a member for so long that I don't really feel like moving. I guess I haven't lost faith in this gym yet. I think they just need to get on the radar with corporate, get some funding for an updated look and maybe market themselves a little better via social media and some stronger sales people.

I think this gym is perfect. It does get very packed but it's the only gym in northwest and the employees are very friendly. The classes and instructors is a good change if u get bored of he same thing at the gym. The Showers are a little scary and can be alot cleaner but it's a public shower.. Think about It....Shower at home!  Other 24 hours are larger but this is an active gym.

I've been going to this gym for two months.  People are pleasant, it is well equipped.  But, can be maintained better.   Tiles falling off the walls in the locker room, toilet areas not cleaned often enough.  Mold in the shower.  Management should manage and make sure that the whole experience, including the locker room is good.

After talking to the GM, who responded immediately, I was assured that my concerns would be immediately addressed.  Great responsiveness by Jessica.

Kind of a dodgy 24 hour fitness if you ask me. Sure, they have the weights and cardio equipment that I need, but the precor trainers are often in poor repair--jerking all over the place--and the treadmills are often in poor repair. If something breaks, its broken for ages and half the time its poorly repaired when it does come back. Not good. And I'm not sure who thought the huge glass windows were a good idea. If you go there when the sun is coming up like I often do you're likely to be blinded while using some of the weight machines. Not good. 

As several folks have pointed out, the locker rooms are pretty vile. I avoid them at all costs. Still, its open 24 hours and its close to home, so given the limited fitness options on the northwest side of town, I keep going.

We live across the street from this 24 hour fitness which is really convenient. The only problem is it gets soooo busy between 4-7pm which sucks because there is no machines open. So going at a less busy time is important.

not as bad as I read in the reviews. I don't think it smells too bad. the equipment is kind of old but they do have a lot of weights and machines. I also like being able to watch the downstairs while being upstairs. plenty of parking. plus, you get a good view of 80E from the top floor which kind of distracts you during a cardio workout.

This location has a good selection of equipment, but NO AIR CONDITIONING! 
Big glass windows let in plenty of sunlight...and lots of heat! For 9 out of the last 10 summers, the air conditioning has not worked at all, even when it's 105 degrees outside. 
Local staff has no ability to fix anything, and "Customer Service" at the corporate level is non-existent. You can't even get through to talk to anyone, they refuse to let you contact management, and they are totally unresponsive. This is just a big corporation run by bean counters trying to cut costs at all costs. They don't care about their members at all. Unless you like it really, really HOT when you work out, find another gym.

I have a hate love relationship with this gym. Let's start with the likes since it'll be quick. I like how close it is to my house, I also like that it is open 24 hours a day. Now for my dislikes: The cardio equipment is horrible, very cheap bottom line stuff, it is also broken most of the time. Next are the 15-20 buckets sprawled out all over the gym floor used for catching drips falling from the leaking roof. No one wants to see buckets full of nasty water, or get dripped on when they are working out. The workout equipment is in great disarray as well, many of it broken for months at a time. People spend hundreds of dollars a year to use this gym and they can't fix their roof or equipment. Where does all the gym membership fees go? Clearly not back into the gym. I personally would not recommend this gym to anyone who lives nearby a fitness connection or frankly any other gym.

Can you say, bare minimum?

I actually got a Yelp account because I felt like I had to say something about this gym. I'll keep it to the point though.

- Staff is pretty apathetic, not even sure they know they are on the clock half the time.
Restrooms often dirty and/or out of materials.
- Leaky ceiling- all over.
- Broken equipment that hasn't been replaced in over a year, despite multiple requests (TREADMILLS).
- Management never reorganizes weights, which I could understand if they looked even remotely busy, but most of the time they are on their phones or talking to people they know at the gym.

Pretty pleased I don't have to go here anymore since a nice new gym opened near me.

It's a shame, it has potential to be a fine gym, but it seems that either the local management doesn't care or doesn't have the power to do anything.

I've only been to this facility once. It could be bigger, but it's not. layout is a little funky but it works. Yes, Yes, Yes... all 24/hr fitness have their ups and downs, but why I'm giving this place 4stars is for the people that come here to work out. why?!?! EVERYONE HERE RERACK THEIR WEIGHTS!!!!!!

Thank you 24hr fitness members of RENO!

On the plus side, this is a big facility with a layout that is well designed.  On the negative side, we walked in this morning with two staff members at the desk who could not be bothered with a hello or good morning.  The equipment is so old that the buttons on the bikes aren't even visible any more.  Only 2 recumbent bikes downstairs and the upstairs bikes are really old and in poor shape.  It's better to get in a workout than not so we will still be grateful that 24 hour has a facility in Northwest RENO but wish they made the investment in some upgraded equipment.  It's pretty out dated.

My complaint is  regarding both an employee as well as club maintenance. I have been a member since 2009 and have consistently paid for training sessions with Don Holly (who's absolutely wonderful and the ONLY reason I've kept my training sessions and membership). I've never been thrilled with the way that the club is maintained but it's been acceptable in the past. Last summer the a/c system went out (I think 3/4 were down or something like that). Weeks went by and they weren't fixed. Winter came and I think that they still haven't fixed them but I'm not sure. The new manager (Gerrell) came on board and decided to start changing "the rules". My trainer and I use the large medicine balls and slam them. That's what they are made for. The manager decided that we shouldn't do this on the gym floor and that this should be done in the small functional training/stretching room in the back. Seriously!? There are people back there foam rolling, etc. and we're slamming a ball right next to their head? Strike one against Gerrell. Next (a few days later), I go into the gym and the entire gym is out of toilet paper! Not for one day, but two days in a row! That should be a health violation! Strike two. Lastly, we use one of the weight benches to do bench pushes with a 25-35# weight and then carry the weight up and down the stairs. He watched us do these the other day and then yesterday I came in to work out and both of these benches had been bolted to the floor! When I went to question it, he said that we shouldn't be using the bench for that! Really!?? Then maybe invest in a sled that we can push but this is a normal gym activity! 
I wouldn't recommend this place!!

10 to 15 years ago when I first started coming here, I thought the gym was one of the best ever.  Nowadays, with the passing of time and technology, this gym is rather average to slightly below average.  You can still get a great workout here however.  And, I'll concede per prior reviews that it's still a meat market.  Always has been.  But what red-blooded American guy is gonna complain about working out with a bunch of strippers & hot chicks?  I usually train here on my mini vacations and day trips into Reno.  There's also the location out on Neil Rd., but I usually find myself closer to this location on Sky Mt. Dr.  Also, the Neil Rd. location isn't open 'round the clock like this one is.  Most of the late-night desk agents are mindless robots.  The dimly lit parking lot can get a 'lil creepy at night, so single females should be alert to this.  At minimal, the bathrooms are probably gonna have to be remodeled soon as they have "earth cracks" running through the floor.

Most of the time I am happy going to 24 Hr Fitness.  They seriously need a maintenance crew though.  In the summer, the air conditioner breaks and it can get stiffling hot in the exercise room.  In the winter, the roof leaks and there are buckets all over, A couple of times a year, the speakers break and classes sometimes are cancelled.  
I go for the Zumba.  The Zumba classes at both North and South are loads of fun - I really like the instructors.  Aida is full of energy and enthusiasm.  Keeps you going and burning lots of calories.  Emma works you and you know you've gotten a good workout after having a class with her.  Elvia gives you a real "feel good" feeling after taking Zumba with her.
Staff are always friendly at North and South and greet you and always tell you to have a nice day when leaving.  The gyms are always pretty full with people using the weights.  Bathrooms and showers are clean.  24 hour South has a pool and both places have jacuzzis.  Machines are well maintained and up to date.
I've been with 24 hour fitness since the early 2000's.  Rates are reasonable.  You get the most out of what you pay if you go.
5/13/17  I'm upgrading my review to reflect the great workout I got today at both 24 hour fitness North and South with Emma and Aida.  What a team!  I believe the instructors really make the classes and are responsible for members to keep coming back to the classes.  Zumba is my favorite class.  Today the music was lively, easy to keep a beat and definitely sweat producing.  24 hour fitness, focus on your good instructors and I guarantee you'll have members breaking down the doors to come and experience the classes you have to offer!  Great workout - I feel great!

This 24 hour fitness is a bit special, because this is the only 24hr fitness that still use all those older looking weights, you know how new weights are all covered by plastic and rubber, and the weights this gym use are all iron.... so your hands smell after using them, and the weight plates slips easily off the bar if you don't use the clipper due to the hole in the weight plates aren't covered in plastic/rubber.   I love the lightning in the gym at night, it's like a club or something, super dark mixed with blue light and pink light and red light and it feels very private, i feel like girls can go there at night with no makeup lol.  
I don't use the pool or the steam room in this location so i can't comment on that. But the locker room is huge and clean.  Cardio machines were a bit sticky a few time i visited, so remember to wipe down before and after you use it. 
Oh also no one is ever at the frontdesk after midnight. 
This location opens 24/7 unlike the one in the South.

The worst gym EVER! 

Sadly I'm a member there b'c of it's locations, one a block from my work & the other not far from home. However their customer service is TERRIBLE! 
The locker rooms are often dirty & out of toilet paper. 

And if something goes wrong with your billing ... they harass you with automated phone calls so far I have received calls 5 times a day for a few days and then 3 times a day for over 20 days. They are always recordings ... never a real person! If you have any choice in the matter, find a different gym. You will be infinitely happier. 

To 24 hr ... you are just a number in their revenue each month.

Usually its pretty nice at this location but recently 3 of their air conditioning units were broken. It had to of been 100 degrees in there on these hot days plus all the people working out. There was no reassurance that it would get fixed soon. I just felt like they should have found a way to keep everyone happy.

I've been a member at this gym for over 12 years and the only reason I stay is because it's cheap and convenient. The size is decent and the equipment selection is pretty good but depending on the time of day you go, it can be really crowded, especially right after New Years when the "Resolutioners" take over. There's a fair share of obnoxious meatheads and girls prancing around in booty shorts. I like their classes, but some (especially spinning) are so full you have to pay to even make it on the list. Overall, it gets the job done for a good price, but I'm sure there are nicer gyms in town.

It's a gym. An old gym in much need of updating. 

Pros: Spin bikes, open upstairs glass room of bikes, weights steppers, mats. Vertical Climbing Machine: plenty of cardio and weight equipment. Beverage vending machine. Steam room and ample lockers, 2ndary personal training room

Meh: a lot of old equipment, just very worn or outdated. People love text messaging on machines, scale in women's locker room doesn't work, feel dirty sometimes, leaks when it rains, weird location for trx workouts

Cons: no training turf for drills, size can accommodate drill training but this is a huge active I suppose 

Overall it's a very functional limited frills gym. Enough equipment to do almost anything you need training wise
Has everything you need. Just a little outdated equipment. At least all the dumbbells are in their designated areas.

The main reason I go to this gym is because it's open 24 hours. That's it. 

The employees are all friendly, but I would never ask them for any work out advice. Some (if not most) just seem like they're front desk receptionists. I know they have some personal trainers, but I don't know if I trust them either. They usually just carry around a clip board marking tallies on a paper. I feel as if their programs aren't specialized for that person, which is not what I would want from a program/trainer. But I would never know because these personalized training sessions are crazy expensive! They're multiple sessions for hundreds of dollars. On top of that, day employees usually just talk to each other/other people. They don't really greet people or even sit at the front counter. Night employees are better. They're usually reading a book (which is fine with me), but they're always at the front desk greeting and saying goodbye to every person that enters/leaves the gym.

The facility has a certain musk to it, and that's not good. It's like there is barely any circulation/ventilation in the whole gym. The lockers in the bathroom are flimsy, with some lockers broken. There is a sauna and a steam room, so that's a plus. And the workout studio upstairs is better kept than the rest of the gym. Lights are bright, equipment is cleaner and there are large fans. 

The equipment is all really old and outdated. Dumbbells look and feel like they haven't been cleaned or sanitized in forever. There are only THREE squat racks. And that's a problem if you come during busier times (5-8pm). Free weights/plates are usually just lying around. I mean that's poor gym etiquette for the people going, but employees should at least make an attempt to re-rack weights that have been lying on the floor for over 2 hours. Other than that, the machines work except for some of the cardio equipment upstairs. I feel as if the cardio equipment has been "temporarily out of service" for months now. 

Overall, I pay way too much to go to this gym. It's $30 a month. Upside though is that I can go to any 24 hour fitness. Just go to the one in South Reno.

In comparison to other 24 hour locations this one falls in the middle. The machines are plentiful enough and most are operational which is a plus. Staff is friendly and I do notice at least one of the staff members make a rounds here and again to check on the establishment.

The building at peak still leaves enough machines available to where you may end up waiting on a bench but if so not too long. Improvements can certainly be made here though all in all it's a solid gym, and there is virtually no excuse to stay away from the House of Iron.

More than a year later, and STILL NO AIR CONDITIONING. Over 100 degree weather makes it unbearable on the workout floor. Complaining does no good since the corporate bean counters refuse to repair the A/C which breaks down EVERY summer.

I have never felt comfortable in this gym.  Upon entering, you are greeted by the smell of a mildew.  The front desk staff never have an answer to any question I've ever had.  They tell me to call the 1-800 number.  Yeah, that sounds like a solution.  

The layout of the gym is akward.  The machines are old.  When a machine or piece of equipment breaks, it is taken away, and not replaced.  It's a shame that 24 Hr Fitness does not invest more into updating the equipment and keeping the gym cleaner. The location, just off of the 80W-McCarran exit, is good.  The place just needs A LOT of work -- newer machines, more knowledgable staff, and better cleaning.

I have to lower my rating of this gym from 2 stars to 1. The front desk staff is terrible. They have gotten progressively worse over the past year that I have been going to this gym. As another reviewer stated, I feel as if I am interrupting their social hour when I check in to work out. Occasionally I will receive a greeting depending on which staff member is working. Other times good luck finding a staff member, let alone a greeting. Then there are the days when the staff is so busy having their own personal conversations that they don't even know you're there. The other day the staff was having so much fun at the front desk that I could hear them yelling and hollering from across the gym. I thought I was at a bar watching a football game. 
    The maintenance has gotten slightly better than it was previously. Don't bother going on a hot day. This gym refuses to run their air-conditioning. If you happen to bother to ask about it, you will be directed to a "manager" and then told that the AC is broken and that they are not sure when it will be fixed. So be prepared to workout in a 90+ degree gym.
   I wish this 24 hour fitness would take lessons from their south Reno counterpart. If you don't have to go to this gym, then don't. There are many nicer and cheaper gyms in Reno that will actually make you feel welcome, are clean, and have newer well maintained equipment.
Check out other gyms in the area before joining this "not" healthy club! Not a clean place to exercise with equipment that are old and don't work right!

This place is a joke! 

I have been a member there since 2007, and have seen it deteriorate before my eyes...rapidly of late. Several machines are "Out of Order" and falling apart. I realized this week that NINE were down on the same day! I came back today, two of those were "fixed" but two others were down...including the drinking fountain. I used one of the "repaired" stair climbers, and halfway through my workout the steps gave way, going from level 7 to 20 and literally throwing me off the machine.  

I have paid over $3,000 as a member, every month paying my dues, living up to my agreement. They have not fulfilled their side of the agreement by providing adequate equipment. I have complained to them about the lack of upkeep, but nothing has changed.

DO NOT spend your money here!

It's 24 hour fitness, so you can't expect that much.  This location is fairly well maintained and has a nice atmosphere for exercising.  The steam room usually works and so do most of the machines.  They have a large selection of cardio equipment also.  Staff is always friendly.  The South Reno branch on Neil Road is awful.  I drive the extra several miles when I am visiting my family in South Reno to avoid the dirty squalor of the Neil Rd branch.

This gym is kept clean and Not super busy late at night like after 9pm.  They could do some building improvements for example the sauna is falling apart.  most of the equipment is older and often lots of out of service signs on the treadmills and ellipticals up stairs.

The location & design is amazing, but the machines are older & there is no towel service.  You have to purchase towels or bring your own to shower or wipe sweat off your face. I would prefer consistency between locations when I get a better membership to know I will always be provided a towel.
Shady company, dirty location. Bathrooms are gross, the hot tub smells of bleach or funk, nothing in between. Things break a lot.

This place has everything from hot yoga to aerial yoga to six zone (almost Like cross fit) to a swim up bar to the best food to a lazy river and cabana rentals to a running track. Absolutely in love. Will never find a better gym.

This is the best gym I have ever been a member. LA fitness, retro fitness, nothing can compare. You get what you pay for which is definitely why the amenities are out of this world here. Free Children's care while you workout, tons of included classes like Zumba and aerobics and the six zone which is my favorite. Saunas and high tech locker rooms with couches and TVs. A high end spa and salon in the building as well. The NAC uses the newest and fanciest workout equipment around and is always expanding. The outdoor pool is ridiculous and always a good time. Pick up basketball every Wednesday night and Saturday and Sunday morning. I'll see you on the court there!

Only flaw, which is a big one, is of course the price, which is very high. $100+ a month if over the age of 30 and over $250 for a family of 4.

There is plenty of parking however during the busy times you might be forced to park in NJ since that's the closest spot available.

The NAC has a very country club and elitist feel to it but everyone in there seems laid back for the most part. Lots of hardcore athletes.

This is a review for the outdoor pool complex. 
The parking lot fills up quickly. The family pools are full of kids and adults having fun. There is no deep water, diving boards, or lap swimming available. 
All restrooms and showers are near the entry. Entry to the adult pool area is through the restaurant and bar. Using the restroom requires navigating the restaurant/bar area each time. 
The adult pool is a figure eight shape with a spa halfway. One lap swimmer down to middle can monopolize movement for everyone else in the pool. Depth is surprisingly only 4'6". Beautiful chairs and lounges encircle the pool up to the edge. More lounges and cabanas are terraced beyond them. It gets cozy. Half of the seating and pool is shaded.
Sunday afternoon during football season is loud and creates a sports bar atmosphere. 
The smell of grilled meat is pervasive throughout the complex. 
Surprised to see some members not pick up after themselves and rinse their sandaled feet in the pool!
Their hours start early and end late. Their season extends from April to November. 
Mixed bag.

This athletic club is amazing and has every thing you would ever wish for!
There are floors of just things to do. You could stay here all day! The locker rooms are really nice also.
However, at $160 a month membership, that is a bit high. Though, you do get a lot! 
Also, had no issues with staff. Super friendly as far as those I talked to and that includes front desk!

Best gym ever .. Love the owner because he loves his members.. he is there mostly every day and literally works out with us .. not like most "corporations" when asking to see a Manager it is almost impossible... he genuinely cares. He has his team members walking the floor everywhere.ensuring everyone is content. This gun is great for families, teenagers, seniors.. you name it.  It has a therapy pool and trained,certified trainers everywhere. The showers are better then most home showers and amazingly clean. You will NEVET find a better gym .. guaranteed!

The good first:
So as far as the facility goes, there are a LOT of things offered here that you won't find at other gyms. This place is brimming with stuff to do in terms of exercise. There is an indoor pool open year-round, an outdoor pool open for 6 months out of the year, several different workout zones, a basketball court, classes that come with the membership including aqua exercise classes, Zumba, pilates, yoga, insanity, and more, even including some nutrition classes! There is even a café here. There is also a very updated section of the gym with advanced machines ("Technofit"). These machines store all your workout info on the cloud when you put your key in or sign into the cloud through their app. The women's locker room is also very clean and includes a sauna and a steam room. For this locker room, you do not need to bring a lock in; the lockers have keypad locks on them. The women's showers are very clean and complimentary soap, shampoo, conditioner, and razors are provided. Throughout the locker room are also hairdryers.

Admittedly, they also intentionally or unintentionally provide a LOT of motivation to work out! If you're in certain age groups, you might get a free heart rate monitor that shows your heart rate while you are working out on the little TV screens they have throughout the gym. This is definitely helpful when working out. And although it's not an expensive product, it is apparently "free" if you meet certain goals for 3 months, which gives you enough reason to want to go to the gym and meet the required goals!

The bad:
The prices are only good if you're within a certain age group. I am in the youngest age group so the prices are reasonable at $52-$62 monthly. As you get older, the prices get worse, and they are terrible for those in what I think is the 32-64 age bracket, at $141+ a month and a several hundred dollar enrollment fee on top of that. So I would definitely recommend this athletic center to people within the 10-24 age bracket if you're worried about costs (and let's be honest, who isn't?)

Secondly, the café food I thought was pretty good until a few hours after eating it. Yesterday I tried the power up skillet with quinoa, an egg, sausage, peppers, and mushrooms, and I was in severe gastrointestinal distress for the entire day, to the point where I almost went home from work. I used the bathroom 4-5 times and felt horrible in between each time. Today as well, I tried it again to confirm that it was definitely that food that caused it, and I kid you not, I am on the toilet writing this right now and have not been feeling well. This is an extremely rare occurrence for me and didn't happen on the days I didn't try the food, so I'm left to believe that it was the food that caused this. I won't be trying most of their food again. Perhaps a smoothie in the future but even that I can't be sure of as of right now, as my stomach kills me.

Next, anything outside of what's provided with the basic membership (which is plenty enough) is a waste of money or a luxury for those who can afford it. Most of the extras are incredibly expensive. For instance, I saw swimming lessons (not aquatic exercise) at $60 for a 50 minute class with several other people. Not even individual lessons! I myself don't even make $10+ every ten minutes, so I find it hard to pay that much to someone else, especially if the lessons are individual lessons.

And finally, they make it impossibly difficult to get out of their contract without spending a lot of money unless you become basically disabled during the contract period. But I guess that's anywhere, right?

TL;DR: This place is awesome at the 10-24 year-old rates, given all that it offers. Stick to the basics!
Pool is open and it is great. Nice to have a water park in Bucks County. A must join if you have kids.

I tried out the NAC for swim lessons for my toddler.  Long story short: Not good.  When I asked where to go to find the class, I got a snarky response.  The experience only went downhill from there.  We got to the pool and I was having trouble getting my son to agree to get in.  He'd come down a couple steps, but would go no further.  Since this was basically a class aimed at getting toddlers comfortable in the water, I expected that the instructor would help me out.  Instead she completely ignored us.  She gave out various objects to the other kids to help in the lesson, but completely left us out, not coming over to us or speaking to us once.  I endured this for 20 of the 30 minutes of class until I got fed up and just left.  This would be rude and unacceptable at any price point, but for nearly $20 per session, this was unforgivable.  I have contacted the aquatics director for a refund, but (surprise, surprise) I haven't heard back.

For a family like ours, there's nowhere we'd rather be than the NAC. We have 3 kids, and a Nanny, and we all use the club to its fullest extent.  My kids are 2, 4, and 8, and they are ALL enrolled in at least 2 classes at the NAC. Even on weekends when they don't have classes, my wife and I go to work out, and my kids are THRILLED to go to the kids club. The Kids Club staff is exceptional. 

My daughter takes dance, gymnastics, and Yoga (Yes, they have a Yoga class for kids!) and she loves it. On busy nights, we can eat in the Cafe after exercising. There are always healthy choices, and even some 'treats" for the kids. 

Now, working out - I do olympic lifts (dropping the weights making noises), and no one has a problem with it. There is ALWAYS a piece of cardio equipment available. There's space to jump rope. There's multiple spaces for what I call "functional training" - flipping tires/pushing & pulling sleds, etc. There is ALWAYS something new to try as well. TRX,  Spinning, cross-training, yoga, pilates (reformer and floor) all kinds of aerobics. Also leagues and clubs of all kinds if you want to play some kind of competitive sport. Lastly,  the club is always looking to improve, and constantly adding new services. 

I've even worked out with a couple personal trainers there, and they are rock solid. If you want someone who is knowledgeable and can bring you back from an injury, they have the right staff for that. If you are a conditioned athlete, and you want to do something new, or want to be pushed to your limits, those trainers are there too.

My perspective is that of someone who has worked extensively in health clubs, and I'm now a father of three, and I have to say ESPECIALLY if you are a family, you won't find a more comprehensive facility anywhere that I've ever lived.

The gym is amazing, me and my husband love it. But speaking about outdoor swimming area and the Escape bar, we are not so satisfied. How many times I found band-aids drifting in the swimming pool? A lot. How many times I noticed sand and plastic cup lids on the bottom? Too many. How many times I was filling in the form on their website to tell them about it? Three, to be honest. How many times anybody contacted me to say they're to fix the problem? None. The last straw here is the Escape bar. Stuff is great - they are quick, polite and helpful. The problem is in food. It's ridiculously expensive and absolutely wretched. I have tried salads, flatbreads, steaks and burgers there so I know what I'm talking about. They are really proud of their new chef but I'm not sure they have to be proud of their food, really. I had a flat steak a month ago and I ended up with terrible heartburn at the time. Some time later we were too lazy to cook dinner at home so we decided to try a couple of burgers here. I thought "nobody can ruin the burger" and I decided to give it a try (we both had their special "The Big NAC" burger). That evening I was suffering a heartburn again and I promised myself never ever in my life eat here. It's just not worth it! I can spend my $30 for a better dinner in a better place.

Great club. Nothing like it in Bucks County. The facility is always being upgraded with new equipment and expansions. They have a top notch personal training crew. Looking forward to the new pool facility.

The NAC is one of the best clubs in the northeast.  It is clean and has tons of programs that are included in the monthly membership fee.   There are literally 10 times the amount of available classes, compared to the average gym.  It is an impressive place, and priced very high to maintain that quality.  

The new outdoor pool complex is overly crowded and a little too small but it has become a nice place to spend the day.  The food is improved but it's still just passable.

I have been a member for over 20 years (yikes!) and can tell you that there is indeed no place like this in the Bucks/Northern Philadelphia Suburbs or even Princeton/Trenton NJ areas. If you cannot find something you enjoy doing here, you are not looking! Everything from classes for seniors to tots, two well equipped and state of the art fitness areas, indoor track and pool--and that's not even to mention the group exercise classes which now include "on demand" classes and outdoor pool area for the warmer months. I only wish that they had the extent of children's classes and services here when my girls were younger--would have saved a lot of driving to have us all in one spot! Yes, it gets crowded at  peak times and yes, the parking lot is huge and sometimes difficult to maneuver (frankly I see the biggest problem being parents circling the lot to pick up kids and not park--they don't look for pedestrians!). BUT, having also been an employee here, I can tell you that the staff from the top down cares about what goes on, takes comments to heart and are truly professional. Yes, they are human and might appear "curt" or uncaring,  but typically that is because they are busy attending to the many folks that come through the NAC each day.
You will not get a better "bang" for your buck anywhere--especially if you have children!
I can't wait for my "30 Year Member" Spot!!

In response to my original review, The NAC got in touch with me, refunded the class fees, and offered us free private lessons for a month.  I appreciated the effort they made and they paired us with an excellent instructor, Tracy, who helped my son get comfortable in the water.  While the initial experience was poor, The NAC (Linda, Brandi, and Tracy) made it right so I am revising my review.  We will definitely be back again for more lessons in the future as my son gets a little older.

Newtown is definitely much more than just a "gym". It's a huge facility that offers your typical gym equipment, basketball court(s), salon, group training, indoor track, outdoor pool area with spa/slides and employees who take food/drink orders while you're relaxing... it's endless.

You literally can find everything you need here from a cardio bunny to a bodybuilding to a powerlifter/weightlifter. 

I've only ever gone outside of rush hours so I've never seen the place particularly full, but it does get busy especially in the summer where all you will see are people at the poolside. 

The locker rooms are clean, service good, what's not to like?

Clean, professional, friendly, brand new equipment, lots of parking, fitness classes.... This is a great gym on the Main Line.  The facility is so clean and new it practically sparkles.  The trainers and owner are completely professional and very friendly and knowledgeable.  The new equipment is state of the art and fabulous-- I am loving the Lateral X machine and the Jacob's Ladder and I had never seen them before at my old gym.  There's lots of parking and the shopping center is safe and well-lit.  There are scheduled class options through the week, including spin, yoga and zumba.  There's also a really cool Wellbeats system that allows you to pull up a virtual class anytime of the day or night and take your own private class.  Personal training is also available and it's reasonable and the the trainers are top-notch.  So far, I am completely impressed with this facility and the people and equipment at the facility.  Thanks, Anytime Fitness Villanova!
They are a great find: convenient, clean, and professional. They were able to accommodate me on a extended guest pass. The owner and his staff were very friendly.

We stopped at the Villanova Anytime Fitness  and had an amazing experience! The owner Max greeted upon arrival, he was very friendly and helpful! He happily showed us how to use a few different things around the gym. The equipment, showers and the whole gym in general was meticulous! You can tell that Max and the rest of the staff really care about customer satisfaction. Highly recommend this specific anytime fitness to anyone looking to workout in a great environment!

This is a very small gym. They don't have many of the most common machines. I didn't even see a stairmaster in this facility, which was a disappointment. It did seem high-tech and pretty clean. The bathrooms are impressive, and large!
 Of course, location is what sells this one. It's in a great little plaza with a Starbucks and a yoga place, great spot for a gym. One member of a couple could do yoga while the other gets a workout on in this gym. I don't recommend for those that like intense workouts, you might not find a necessary machine.

Cannot say enough good things about this gym! When our current training program ended, we were in need of a new place to call home, and this is it! The owners and trainers are very friendly, helpful, and informative. The facility has new equipment, and is probably the cleanest gym I've ever been in. 

My favorite classes so far have been kickboxing and boxing conditioning, as they offer a solid cardio workout with emphasis on proper form. I leave exhausted and grinning ear to ear every time!

I'm about to start the Muay Thai classes, and expect they will be equally as instructive and fun. 

I'm very happy we found this gym, and can't wait to take my training to the next level here!

I absolutely love that this place is 24 hours and has a wide variety of equipment to use. I am a late nighter so I definitely appreciate a place in Oro Valley being open whenever I get the itch to go! However, over the last six to eight months it's gone down a little. I haven't been very pleased with the cleanliness of the place. The locker rooms and bathrooms aren't maintained during the day. The floors are gross, and I need to foam roll my leg prior to working out, but I hate having to touch the floor at all. They started putting flowers in the women's locker room... But uh... That doesn't clean the toilets or the floors. Also, there's a LOT of times where they are completely out of soap. Once, I advised someone at the front desk on a Friday night that it was empty... And they remained empty until Tuesday night. I just wish this was maintained during the day so that when I'm there, I can enjoy a clean facility.

I'm in love with the idea of the place but not the actual product. I love that it's 24 hours at a reasonable price but there is no classes offered and limited variety of equipment. The wifi rarely works. The staff is okay some very rude and some are kind. But very few offer any insight on fitness and don't look thrilled to be there. This gym is ideal for people that love ellipticals and machine workouts but other than that I can't wait till my contract is over so I can move on
