I love this PF gym!!  The staff is great - very friendly and helpful!  The gym is very clean overall when it comes to gyms.  After a recent visit to a different PF location, I realized what a great home location I have.  The price is beyond reasonable and the atmosphere is one where you want to get into your gym gear and hit the weights or get your cardio in.  The gym has been organized and set up well ... with lots of equipment available to choose from.  Locker rooms are very clean as with all the extras available to Black Card members.  It is nice to belong to a gym where the members also care about keeping everything nice - as you will find other members are always wiping down the equipment they use after they are done.  When I visited a different PF gym, I did not see this happening.  If you choose to join this PF you will find it is a great location to work on your fitness joins - and that the no judgement zone slogan lives well here!

The facility is nice. Lots of equipment and it has never been crowded.  What I don't understand is why they advertise the "personal training" when they have one, maybe 2, people to service the entire membership. Wife has been trying to get an appointment with trainer for almost 2 months. Once they scheduled her for the guy's day off.  When she finally did get to meet with him he wasn't ready with a plan for her and she had to reschedule again. There was another member scheduled with him for the same time. Don't know if he is incompetent or just overwhelmed.  Their claim to have training available is laughable but at least you're not paying for it.   They have 5 or 6 staff who's job seems to be standing in the reception area sitting and talking.  It's still worth the $ 10 for a monthly membership to use the machines but could be a lot better if the staff actually interacted and assisted the customers.

Another great session with Natali. I only trust her to help me stay fit and healthy during this pregnancy. She never pushes, rushes or pressures me. She's very mindful of my health and safety and that of my baby. She is a true professional.

Let me start off by saying I absolutely adore Natali! She has an amazing heart and a true passion for health and fitness. I came in feeling awful about my body and not in great physical shape. We decided that the 12 week transformation plan was the way for me to go.
When I first started I had people ask me at the gym not to do lunges because my knees would constantly give out. Now I can do a variety of lunges and my knees do not wobble at all! Leg day would always end with me walking like Bambi after the first exercise and I am so glad that is no longer the case. 
I had a few complications come up during my training and Natali was nothing but understanding. 
Without the weekly workout plans and food plan I know that I definitely would have never seen the results I have. After seeing my before and after results I cannot wait to start my next 12 week transformation in January!

My fiancé and I used Natali as our trainer to get ready for our wedding. We each lost at least twenty pounds and noticed great improvements in our health and lifestyle. Natali was great we loved working with her. She works hard for her clients and is super flexible, which was important since we both have hectic schedules. Her program came with a workout and diet program. These were both completely manageable. 

The difference between this workout program and everything is that it is individualized for you to get long term results, no quick fixes or fads, which I feel is super important.

Thanks for the great work Natali.

My brother and I met today at Vertical Ventures St Pete to climb.  First of all the faculty is beautiful and that is not why my review is so poor. All of the ropes in the gym were double wrapped, creating more drag in the rope, making a belay assist next to impossible. Even though I have had some return, my legs are not functioning enough to assist me in climbing, so I am still using all upper body. We kindly asked if we could change the rope to single wrap on the one route so I could have a few climbs on it  instead of being spent on the first one, then we would change it back to the original. The girl said no, then went to her manager and he said no. So I went to him, explained I'm an adaptive climber and our home gym accommodates me. He said he would call the owners. He came back, again telling me no they could not accommodate by letting me change the rope on ONE route. So I spent money to climb one route in this playground because I'm using my upper body alone. Gotta love being punished for being paralyzed. Very thankful that every Inner Peaks Climbing Center location accommodates the adaptive climbers.
Nice and clean, open, airy and good customer service.  Still new to the gym, looking forward to classes and tanning.

I'd been looking for a gym that offered all the basic amenities AND classes for a reasonable price that was close to home. IFF fits the bill. The equipment is new and it's a reasonably clean facility. It's a good value close to home.

I'm new to the area and have tried a few gyms but this is by far my favorite. This gym is a great deal and open 24/7. It's very clean, with friendly and not pushy staff, it's never too crowded, and it's such an easy place to get in and out. They offer group exercise classes-- the only one I've tried is zumba with Chaya but she and the class are AMAZING. I've been to many Zumba classes and this is one that will leave you feeling like you had a great workout and will leave you smiling. She is the best! Her class has become the highlight of my Tuesday nights for sure! Thank you Idaho fitness factory!

Brett Denton and his crew have put together thoughtful and complete workouts as well as nutritional plans and challenges. I've been going for years and miss it when I travel! But there are also band workouts for times like that--and there are also videos, a Facebook page for members, personal consultations, and other services available.

Awesome gym. 

I just joined about a week ago, and I've visited for workouts about four times. The gym is spacious, clean, and everything I've used is in great working order. 

The staff member I met with was friendly and knowledgeable. He gave me a tour, explained the differences between the two tiers of membership, and was not pushy at all. 

I've visited after work around 6pm. And while the many others were at the gym, it's such a big space with so many machines, that it didn't feel crowded. 

There are tons of cardio machines and weight machines in the middle of the gym. On the sides are some specialty workout areas with circuit workouts setup. They use a traffic light system to tell you when you switch to the next machine. It's really fun!

Locker rooms are clean, huge, and have tons of lockers. (Being your own lock)

I opted for the black card at $22 a month so I could bring a guest and use the special spa area with tanning and massage machines. 

Highly recommended. A great place to get your fitness on!!

Love the newest location near the Treasure Chest Casino. Great open floor plan with large windows for natural light. The staff are very helpful, some are very young but hopefully with the right training they will become better employees. Everyone has to start somewhere right?

Since its brand new, the equipment down to the shower stalls are modern and appealing. I have an appointment with a trainer this week and he is going to help me set personal goals with a workout plan. I did the same thing at Elmwood's gym and it helped me learn how to use the machines I needed most and focus on a routine. 
The large space and numerous machines can be overwhelming especially when you don't know how they function. They offer a free tour but its basically an overview of the space. There are 'pocket' rooms for stretching and specific step by step processes for those machines to get a 30 min workout for example. 
I hate gyms but at $22/month (including tax) and an eating habit of a true New Orleanian foodie, I I have no choice but to join. For $22 a month you can bring a guest every visit so its basically a membership for my daughter and I. The only downside is only the member can use the extra amenities like the massage chairs.   They do advertise to the average person, not the competitive gym junkie so hopefully I will fit right in. (the gym and my pants)

Very happy with my new gym so far!  It is very clean and new.  The space is large and even though they have tons of equipment, you don't feel like your on top of other people or competing for equipment (I have not been there at peak times yet). For $20 a month, you can get their top membership, which gets you in the door at any other Planet Fitness nationwide, as well as use of their Black Card perks.  Those perks include unlimited hydro massage, unlimited massage chair use, red light therapy, and tanning.  The locker room is big and clean and it seems like their is plenty of locker space as well.  I also like the two rooms that are setup for timed circuits.  They have a 30 minute circuit that alternated between a cardio exercise and a strength exercise.  There is also a 12 minute abs circuit room.

Love Retro Concord! Staff is amazingly sweet and helpful. They're also very knowledgable and able to recommend products tailored to your needs when asked. Any type of machine you could want and plenty of them - I've never had a problem getting a machine I wanted at the time I wanted it. Equipment is always clean and functional. Lockers in the locker room are always available. Theater room is a nice touch. The gym also offers tanning and classes - full service! Fantastic and reasonable personal training program as well.

Have been at the Concord location in Delaware since March 2017. I love it. I go to train not to hang out or socialize. My trainer Kim is excellent! CK is a nice guy and the rest of the staff are dedicated to helping you reach your goals.

I don't know why they are saying they are closed- I am here right now and the gym is packed! Might want to edit their times?! I've been a member of this gym for a couple of months now and I really enjoy it. Always clean, never a lack of machines or weights or anything available. This location specifically has a variety of people who come in here of all different fitness levels and I really enjoy that. No one needs to feel left out and if you are anything like me you gain motivation from those that are rocking it in the fitness department. The staff is friendly and always greets you when coming in. I don't see what their is to complain about- it's a gym and it does the trick of helping me lose weight and get my body into the shape I want (oh and the membership price is good too!)

Thanks retro!

LOVED this gym while I was a member. Fair pricing for membership. Had a great trainer who set up a great plan that helped me lose a lot of weight. Tony, the owner, is a really nice guy. I've met a lot of nice people that work out there. The gym moved to another location on North Ln and I heard it's a bit smaller but still has a wide variety of equipment. I haven't renewed so I can't review the new facility.

Hell yes, Tony!
In the last few months the place has really stepped up with it with keeping the place tidy and the equipment in good shape.

They've added a now squat rack with a pull up bar that I will be using the hell out of. So, thanks to CHFC and their commitment to their members.

Since going here for almost two years now, basically nothing has changed. The equipment is still outdated and faded, the customers are still mostly normal people with a few bros in tanks walking around, and the staff (and therefore rules) are still non-existent at best. It's convenient, and that's about it.

I honestly wish they would just throw in the towel and let better management in to spiffy up the place and give it some actual lifeblood. As of right now, it's basically just a warehouse with equipment and a receptionist.

[UPDATE]

Since writing this review, the owner of CH&F has contacted me asking for feedback. He was open to listening to what I had to say and I appreciate this a lot from a business owner. I am hoping to see some positive changes in the coming months, at which point I'll post another update (hopefully better this time).
Nice facility, it's kept clean and has plenty of space to workout, they have a sauna and steam room as well....

Contrary to the other reviewer both myself and my boyfriend were very happy with our time as members of CHFC. The equipment was always clean, with the exception of the peak time of 5-7pm there was never a wait for cardio equipment (and even then the line was much less than other gyms), I never felt like I was in a meat market, and the trainers were always extremely helpful and nice.

We spent many hours with one trainer, Bob, who we miss a LOT. He got us to the gym almost daily, we enjoyed our workouts, saw definite shaping and toning differences (he was great about working around a fairly recent and severe knee injury of mine). We find ourselves saying frequently at our new gym (in CT) "We miss Bob."

There are some things that we would have liked to have (mainly a pool and 24-hour access) but we were very happy with them.
When we had to move out of the area they gave us no difficulty in getting out of our membership either.

Keeping my same stars, but just wanted to point out some updates.

1. Tony, the owner, read this review and asked if it was one experience that triggered my bad review. I appreciate this and respect his coming to me and wanting to find out how to make his business better.

2. I have think the new trainers are better than the previous ones. I have seen them working with clients to try new and more efficient exercises.

There are still things I'd like to see added or changed, but all-in-all I am there for the convenience factor.

Solid gym.  Has a good selection of equipment from the cardio (spin bikes, elliptical, treadmills) to the weights (free and machines).  The equipment could use a little upgrading, it's not super old but it's not the newest on the block.  For example, 2 of the treadmills incline feature doesn't work.  I got in on a promotional rate which is what I would pay.  The regular rate is too expensive for what you get. I would add a half star for the staff.  They're very professional and friendly.

We joined Conshohocken Health and Fitness about 3 years ago and have been very happy with the experience.  Prior to joining I was a member of Bally's and compared to them the equipment is great and the trainers are very knowledgeable.  Generally I like to run on the treadmill and do free weights and I have never had to wait more than 5 minutes to use the equipment.

The equipment seems to be well maintained and whenever a treadmill is out they generally have it back up and running within a week.  They have other facilities such as a steam room, sauna, and tanning both but I have never tried using them.

I haven't paid for any personal training but received one free session when I signed up and the trainer I worked with was very knowledgeable without pressuring me to sign up for training.  Having looked over the qualifications of the trainers it looks like they are all appropriately certified and experienced.  There is always at least one trainer on the floor of the gym and they have always been happy to help me out with a spot or provide advice if I am unsure about a piece of equipment.

We've done a few of the classes at CH&F and they have always been well taught but I would say that classes aren't the strong aspect of this gym.  If you want a lot of classes and great variety you might want to look elsewhere but for a clean, well-maintained, well-staffed gym this is the best we have found in the area.

If you go during the day (I work from home quite often and will go during lunch) you can have problems parking because the parking lot is shared with a number of businesses.  I've had a few times where I have left in frustration but generally I am able to find a spot.  In the evenings this isn't a problem.

As with all gyms you should read the fine-print before signing the contract.  They will automatically renew you at the month-to-month rate if you do not renew for a year or cancel two months in advance.  Unfortunately this seems to be the standard way of doing business in this industry (at least in my experience).  However, the owner is very understanding and if you do run in to a situation where you forgot to renew just go in and talk to him and you can usually work it out.  The price is definitely higher than some of the chain gyms (Ballys is now offering me one third of the price for a year) but I believe it is worth it to have a good gym and to support a local business.

I have very mixed feelings about this gym. Customer service and upgrades are severely lacking, but the tucked away location allows for low crowds of people.

The main reason I go to Conshy Health & Fitness is because it's walking distance from my workplace in the Spring Mill corporate center. If it weren't so damn convenient, you would definitely not find me here. Its customers seem like mostly normal people, with the occasional bro wandering in and doing shoulder shrugs in front of all the dumbbells.

Equipment: There's a good number of aerobic machines (treadmills, ellipticals, bikes), but the weights, benches, etc. are lacking. The dumbbells are old and rusted, there are only 2 flat benches, 1 incline, 1 decline, and only 2-3 bars to go around between the 4. Fortunately, this isn't usually a problem because the gym never gets too crowded (a definite benefit). The rest of the equipment is useable, but still could use upkeep.

Classes: I've never done the classes, but my roommate says they're fine. They do a crossfit class on Wednesdays in the morning, which is annoying for the rest of the gym since they use a bunch of different sections.

Training: Private training exists, albeit few and far between, but there are NO trainers who watch the floor, so there are no rules to follow and no one to spot you.

Staff: Staff seem generally nice, albeit bored most of the time. They aren't the friendliest and don't go out of their way to get to know people, but they aren't unfriendly either.

Locker Rooms: The locker rooms are nice (at least the men's is), and has a sauna and showers in it.

Price: I pay $34.99 monthly, and I think the yearly plans are a bit cheaper than that.

Overall
Pros:
-$35 a month is okay
-Almost never crowded
-Customers are relatively normal people
-Has a sports drink fridge (not included in the price, though)

Cons:
-No trainers on site except for private lessons
-NO rules to follow and so people use multiple machines, do what they want, etc.
-Equipment is older
-No real sports equipment or basketball court (there is one hoop, but it's outdated and in the class room)
-Doesn't seem to be a community built around the gym
-No workout towels or other amenities

Overall, if you're working in the area, it's a bad option, but it's convenient. It leaves a lot to be desired, but it's good for getting your workout done and getting out.
Not sure what the hell Nicholas is talking about. Its the same equipment but its in damn good shape - and doesn't NEED to be swapped out.

I've been a member for over five years. I typically go before work and on weekends. I've always had good success getting on equipment when I want, including cardio equipment with working headphone jacks to watch the dozen TV's. Equipment is in good shape. 

Great location in Conshy. Since it's behind a corporate park, there is plenty of parking. If you are looking for a place to workout in Conshohocken, check it out!

It's nice that this location has a bunch of equipment, but unfortunately the space is too small for everything. Plus the equipment is a bit dated. Everything appeared to be in decent shape but there are some cramped spots, especially if trying to use the squat rack right by the dumbbells. I was able to get a decent workout in while on the road, but there are better Anytime Fitness locations out there.

I  have been to every anytime fitness in the New Orleans area, and this gym is by far the  best gym"!, they have more equipment than the others, more staff and trainer, very friendly environment to work out, unlike the other gyms you don't have to wait on equipment use because of the wide selection. I definitely recomend this location

Best gym in the New Orleans metro area! 

One of the bigger locations in the area with tons of cardio and weight training machines. and their always adding new toys for you to take your workout regimen to the next level. 

The personal trainers are always on staff to motivate you with challenges to keep you on task like #MCM (Member Crush Mondays). the Fitness Leaderboard, weekly aerobics classes...are just a few ways they make working out fun and super interactive. 

If you're looking for a good push then JimJim's classes are the absolute best! Cardio Box Out and Rush Hour are two of my personal faves! Guaranteed to burn at least 600-800 calories...and work up a good sweat. 

The members here are the best as well...we're kinda like family...it makes working out fun. And you never feel intimidated cause someone is always around to push you through your sets and challenge you to do more! 

If your ever in the area you should definitely check it out...Ask for Johnnie, Ericka, Jim, Wuy, or Ricky and tell em KeeDeeWee sent you!

I have only visited one other location (see Canton review for more general review of franchise) and to me this location is MUCH better. That being said it is more of a 3.5 than a true 4.

This location is bigger (i would say 3 times), more diversity of cardio equipment (rowing machine yay!), a great industrial size fan, post workout snack bar, they sell supplements, and they have a lot more classes than Bullard.  At least 3 evening classes (5-8) and not the ones where you have to enroll like Canton.  They also have real lockers in the middle of the gym.  I did not check out the restroom/change/shower facilities.

The personal trainer who was manning the desk did greet me but that may have been because I came in with a member.  However, he did not take any of my information, offer a tour, or give me any information about either the facility or himself. I am not sure why this is a problem.  Personal trainers that are friends of mine are always trying to be friendly because everybody is a potential client.  It doesn't mean that you are Mr. Cheesy sales person but at least show some interest in my existence.  

Anywhoo. Because it is soooo freaking hot now they will get my money for the summer. Working outside is no longer an option and, with all the good food in this town, there is no way I can stay in my same wardrobe and not workout.

First, there has been a huge improvement since my last rating a few months ago. A lot of the machines are grouped by commonality instead of scattered throughout the gym. The majority of machines are in service and run smoothly.

Second, they have a nice supply of supplements that are well priced and below the competition. Their vending machine is well stocked and is no longer rejecting dollar bills for the smallest wrinkle(been there). Definitely worth a visit!

Update! Same exact dust bunnies everywhere, no more towel service.
Not vacuuming and cleaning daily is alarming. All sorts of bro fungus festering in here - you're going to get sick. Very sick. 

Alright settle in, kids - Iceman's gonna drop some real talk on you here:

First of all, this is a brand new facility that somehow manages to remain pretty filthy. Don't believe me, Axiom staff? Take a peek around your jungle gym station - pretty sure those dust bunnies have established a political structure and are launching a space program soon. 
You've had a broken faucet in the men's locker room for a month. Inexcusable. 
You have an uncovered towel drop in the locker room, which is not particularly sanitary but more so is just disgusting, especially when it's the first thing you see upon entering.
The one or two maintenance people you employ are friendly and industrious, but you need more of them. If you go to any quality fitness club in a major city, you will see staff cleaning not only the locker rooms, but the equipment itself at least once an hour. I have yet to see anyone cleaning equipment at this location. That is troubling.
It should not be the responsibility of the member to spray the equipment - people are lazy and just won't do it. If you want them to wipe down machines, replace the spray bottles with Clorox wipes. It's easier and you won't have soggy used rags soaking up bacteria all over your facility. 
Your water fountains are visibly harboring mold cultures and probably shouldn't be used until you figure out how to clean them. Inexcusable. 

Moving on... 

Front desk staff are the typical disinterested college types, normally seen texting and avoiding eye contact rather than even faking good customer service. 
I'm not sure if there is any in-club management - if there is, he/she/they are not visible which tells me that they don't really care. 

Next, can we please for the love of Goose's widow lose the '80s and '90s pop music??? You are the only gym not named Curves that still plays that crap. 
You want the truth in fitness? Your music blows. At least stock some headphones in your shop area for those who may experience suicidal tendencies from your playlist.

Next, why do you have multiple TRX stations, but no TRXs available for anyone to use? Are you that concerned of theft? Why not purchase a few of the handy dandy TRX ceiling mounts? 

Why do you have a "track" if one lane serves no purpose other than to house your kettlebells and rowing machines? Poor design as well, as the far lane isn't even really a whole lane because of the nearby windows. 

Which is a nice segue to the next point - lack of equipment as a result of poor layout and lack of space. 
Hex deadlift bar? Nope. 
ViPRs? Nope. 
Dual cable/pull-up station? Nope. (Side note, how can you have ONE cable station for an entire facility? That is absurd, especially during peak hours.)
Oh, but we've got curl bars up the wazoo! You can do curls all day here at Axiom. No waiting!
Again, the whole truth in fitness thing is a joke. Axiom was absolutely taken to the cleaners by whomever coined that tagline. 
The truth in fitness is that a decline bench serves no practical purpose and you have several machines that can cause serious injury as they promote dysfunctional movement and harmful torque - Smith machine, quad/hamstring extensions, etc. 
Imagine what you could have done with the space occupied by unnecessary equipment and your "Cardio Theater". Rather than have two people ride a stationary bike while watching Caddyshack, you could have installed more practical equipment and training space, which right now is virtually nonexistent. 

And how about a no cell phone policy? That's a no brainer in this day and age. It's one thing to keep your workout on your mobile device for reference, but there is absolutely no place for phone calls on the fitness floor or in the locker room. 
(Hey management, this would be a great opportunity for you to come out of your cave and establish a presence!)

As the Treasure Valley continues to grow, it's only a matter of time before a LifeTime Fitness or Equinox moves in and puts Axiom out to pasture. This is a convenient, low-cost option geared towards bros and people who like to listen to Garth Brooks and Mariah Carey while they work out. Poor atmosphere, poor customer service, poor layout. 

This is all a reflection on the corporate strategy, or lack thereof. The branding and marketing is illogical - there is no "truth in fitness" reflected in anything happening in this facility, and the hyped-up Perx program offers incentives to pizza parlors and tanning beds, which, last I checked, were not the cornerstones of a healthy lifestyle. 

As someone who has spent his entire life in front of a mirror flashing his pearly whites, the Iceman knows a thing or two about gyms. Without serious investments in marketing and operations, Axiom is headed for a rude awakening. Book it.

Iceman

I went in to talk about gaining a membership. It was a Saturday morning, and they didn't have enough membership representatives working so we had to wait 15 minutes. Then the guy we worked with struggled to communicate the policies and different options. We kept asking questions, and he said that he didn't know many of the answers. Finally, when we were able to see the actual fees, it was outrageous! $20 a month sounds great, but then you have to pay a $200 joining fee and an additional $40 within three months of signing. I asked him if he ever had specials on the joining fee, and he said he didn't know. He said that you could stretch out the $200 joining fee into smaller monthly payments. It's not when I have to pay it that's the problem, it's that the $200 joining fee is absolutely ridiculous in addition to another $40 within three months.  It was pretty packed when we were there, and he said that the kids club could have up to 40 kids in one room. That's insane! Also the hot tub is broken down when we were there. Needless to say, I walked out without a membership.

The gym and bathrooms are both very clean.  They have lots of equipment and floor area.  This location has a pool. 

I'm on a trial membership coz I just moved here.

Let's just call it what it is these people will mistreat you and mis bill you when it's time to leave.  Checking in is right up there with entering a Federal building you will be harassed every time and when the counter girl is busy guess what you can wait on her to check in because no ones getting in here for free!  The internet is trash running at a whopping 3mbp you can't stream music for crap.  Crunch fitness is less money and won't harass you coming and going plus the internet is around 35mbs which is video worthy.

I loved it when I first joined it, but I've been targeted by one of the management members. Today one of the front desk clerks asked me (a VIP member) for my ID and made up that it was a new rule, starting today. 
The facilities need better maintenance and cleaning, towels for cleaning the equipment shouldn't be re-used, because that's perfect to spread bacteria and viruses, so I usually use the scarce wipes located in a few spots around the gym. 
Swimming pool and hot tub need some maintenance, the paint is peeling off in several spots, which makes it unpleasant to the touch. 
It's definitely time to improve and update!

I have been working with Jake Gold (a trainer at Axiom @ The Village) for a little over a year.  I have been happy with with my results and I think the staff at The Village is exceptional.  And I do agree with one of the other reviews that said it gets crowed there sometimes, but the other members are so nice it ends up being an excuse to make a friend.  And my review may seem a little over the top but my doctor just told me that I will not need to take blood pressure meds because my exercise and diet reduced the need.  Axiom is great!

The location is great for me.  The facilities seem nice, in spite of the typical "bro" culture that you just can't escape from in big gyms.  My only issue is I've had nothing but terrible and rude interactions with the employees that work there. Just asking a simple question gets you eye rolls and comments like "it's a gym, it's pretty self-explanatory".  Alrighty then...sorry to be a bother.

Love this gym! I've been a member for 1 year now, coming on average 4 day a week and have been so impressed with the staff  (which seems to have very low turnover). 

Bathrooms are impeccably clean as well as the gym floor. And let's face it, we've all seen those gyms where you know nobody's put a broom anywhere in a long time. :-) this is not that gym.

 I spend a lot of time in the saltwater swimming pool which is cleaner than most. If if you're going to swim, this is one of the most beautiful pools in the area with three walls of windows that go Floor to ceiling.

 The gym never seems to be extremely busy to the point of standing around waiting for equipment all the time.

I really enjoy that they have supplements as well as a juice bar to go grab a protein shake in case I forget mine after a workout.
I love Axiom mostly because of their mystic spray tans they offer! I get unlimited each month at a really decent price. Glad they offer dark in the unlimited package as well!

Once upon a time this place was incredible. The reason for the lower stars now is the lack of cleanliness. The showers are missing grout which tells we we will have mold soon. I've brought it to the attention of the manager but seems to fall on deaf ears. Shelves in the shower and shower heads are leaking frivolously. Maintenance overall has gone down and is my reason for less stars on this update (2 1/2 years now)

Axiom fitness is a real breath of fresh air as far as the 24 hour-ish gyms go. Now I have been a member of the Anytime fitness and Planet Fitness, as well as Snap but this one just is a few steps above in quality and atmosphere. 

From the moment I walked in and was greeted by the staff I was impressed. They have membership people and trainers who also give new members evaluations/assessments for free and of course those at the front desk who great you with a smile each visit. The locker room has been a little less than clean on occasion and the counters are always covered with water and there are no towels, paper or otherwise available for wiping down. This could use some improvement. The facilities seem to be clean at all times and if a piece of equipment seems to be broken, it's only for a day or so before it's back in service.

I've had many memberships to gyms and have faced every single underhanded tactic they will use to screw your of money. Up to this point, axiom in the Village, has done nothing other than exceed my expectations. 

The equipment is new and in great condition. The space is large, and while crowded, I've never felt judged or out of place. 

I personally love the younger crowd that frequents this gym. It's fun and friendly place to work out and meet new like minded people. I wish the yoga room was free access with a membership, but it's not. Def a disadvantage there. 

Overall I love this gym and location.  Recommend it to everyone.

Best gym I have found in Idaho. Started with Idaho athletic club and all they do is screw you in every which way possible. Staff here is super friendly and there when you need them. Just like any other gym they have there challenges but this gym is super clean always kept nice and tidy. Showers were recently re done and the locker room doesn't smell horrible, the weights and machines and all up to date and nothing to old.  Pool is nice as well as the sauna and spa. 

I can see why you pay a little more here cause of the equipment and cleanness that this place offers. I come late in the evenings after work, it's rare that I have to wait for a machine or a bench to use.

The people are great. It is always very clean and the equipment is alway in good repair. I've never found anything to complain about  with the only exception being that the weight area is to small and sometimes in the morning it seems crowded. However they are expanding so I will be excited to see if they make more room for weights

*2/19/15*** yelp was read...bathrooms improved greatly! HOUSE MUSIC WAS TURNED UP EVEN LOUDER FOR SPITE. You can see what you're dealing with here- encouring others to join other clubs and comiserating with others how problematic management hasbeen on such a silly thing. Lose another star.
*UPDATE* 2/18/15Axiom at the villiage has really gone downhill since only 4 months. With the hearing loss due to WAY TOO LOUD HOUSE MUSIC...my eyesight has improved to see how filthy the ladies lockers and general locker room are. The toilets are often disgusting also to mention often OUT of toilet paper!! The gym management in charge won't hear you over his enormous ego....relagating all issues to "intolerace". I'm pulling a star from my review for these major oversights in good business.
10/30/14-Lots of gym for your money. Its very clean. Great equipment; never see a down machine- and I'm here nearly everyday. Childcare is state-of-the-art and attended with kind and lovely women. Massage spa in house big plus! Movie theater workout is the BOMB! The pool and hot tub is treated with a salt water solution; 'le love'!!! My  only compliant (and the reason two of my friends quit this gym and I can't get anyone else to join - hey I want my perks so I want to get joiners) but their house music is so loud I have to blow my ear buds out not to hear their awful music selection on the P.A. system. Or worse, I feel like I have to shout to a pal to chat during work outs. Not good for ear health. Maybe more people will complain and they'll turn down the nasty house music. There are more workout options; but the above is what I use.

It's been three years that I've had my membership here so I figured an update was needed. The gym still has a very "new" feeling to it. Lots of the equipment is updated and in good service. 

I lowered my rating from a 5-4 mostly due to cleanliness of the facility and the attitudes of the personnel training staff. This Axiom location does suffer from poor locker room cleanliness, but that could be an indication of the life cycle of an active gym. There are a lot of people who go through this location daily so the janitorial staff needs to be on top of things. 

They have recently renovated and expanded the main gym floor. Honestly it feels like an actual cohesive floor plan now. They've doubled the Astro turf and added more equipment all around. I definitely still recommend this gym, but I'd like to see more efforts from management on cleanliness and ensuring that their training staff treats all members equally.

Ive been a member for quite a while. The gym is fine, but I have been noticing it going down hill quickly. The place is filthy. The bathrooms are disgusting. The toilet paper and paper towels are always out, and you can actually see the mildew buildup on the bathroom counters... SO gross!! I would be willing to bet a lot of money that the bathrooms aren't even getting cleaned weekly, when it should be daily. Really really disgusting. There have been a lot of new members since the beginning of the year, and we've been noticing that none of the newbies wipe down their equipment or put their weights away, which is frustrating. Today I watched a female trainer "training" (improperly by the way) a client, and afterward they just left the barbell on the preacher curl bench and walked away... shouldn't she have been teaching this new gym goer the proper gym etiquette? 
If you go upstairs, the whole upstairs just stinks like mold and sweat. The whole place needs a serious deep cleaning. The new YMCA opens soon, and it will be interesting to see how well Axiom does.

Been coming here now 4-5 times a week for about 6 weeks now since moving into the area.... Had previously been going it alone at a gym, now I'd never consider going back! Every time I go to Ripped I have a great experience: enthusiastic and helpful instructors; excellent equipment and facilities; and, a motivating and fun atmosphere! All the trainers are great and I have to give kudos to the owner, Katie, who clearly takes pride in her business and in ensuring her clients have nothing less but an excellent experience!

I have been a member at Ripped since June 2016, averaging 4 classes a week. I love that after all of this time every class is still is a struggle. The instructors are great. Everyone is so personable and their drive and determination to see each person that walks through that door "kick butt" and push their limits is what keeps me coming back for more. I don't have enough good things to say about my Ripped fam, except thank you. You guys rock!

Love this place. Currently, my favorite place to be in Philadelphia ! Super fun and intense workout I'm so happy I joined. I feel so good, fresh and energetic when I walk out after class every morning (ofcourse during the class I am almost dead) but it has done wonders for me. I Love these guys!

I signed up for the all strength option because I am not a fan of running and wanted to try out the workout. That was a mistake. If you choose all strength, you repeat the same exercises twice in a row while the other participants switch between running and strength. I was exhausted, not in a good way, at the end and woke up the next morning with a pain in my neck and shoulder. I am now in physical therapy because of this pain (which did not go away and only got worse). I wish going in that I had known that there wouldn't be any variety and that I would be performing the same set of exercises twice through as I think that I may have modified them and may not have injured myself in the process.

I've been wanting to incorporate more strength training into my workouts and lift some heavier weights, and Ripped has been a great discovery for me!  As someone who hates running, I was apprehensive about being on a treadmill 50% of the time, but I actually kind of enjoy it!  Here are my highlights: 

Running
-Woodway treadmills - I'm no aficionado, but I do think they feel a little better to run on - easier on the joints
-TV screens - 3 options that tell you exactly what speed and incline to use.  I like this so that I don't have to try and listen for the instructor to tell me.  Bonus: it provides a timer so you know exactly how long you need to be crushing it at high speeds.  
-No one is looking at anyone else, because we're all focused on running through the streets of some CA city

Strength
-Everyone has their own bench with weights already underneath.  I love this because if I start an exercise and my weights are too heavy or light, it's an easy switch.  I don't have to go to the other side of the room to get additional weights
-The instructor demos the moves for you, so you can actually see how to do it.  The person at the desk will tell you which spot to go in, and if they see that you are new, they'll put you in a good spot to see the instructor.  

Other
-They have a few separate shower rooms to get ready in the morning, with what looks like plenty of amenities to get ready in the morning.  The shower rooms are separate from the locker area, so I'm curious to see what mornings are like, if there is a big hold up while people get dressed in the shower rooms before doing hair/makeup in the locker room.  
-Vibe - I like the club atmosphere and the music, it definitely gets me pumped up to workout.  I also really like that it doesn't feel competitive.  Everyone is focused on their own TV screens and not looking around.  You can push yourself as much as you like.  

Overall, great studio, and I'm looking forward to making it a regular part of my routine!

Most efficient workout in Center City! Better cardio than spin. Great for days it's too cold (or hot) to run outside. The weight portion of class will help you strengthen. Instructors are great, though the intervals go by too quickly for them to correct form (unless the class is small). The interval training helps a lot with outdoor running, increasing your VO2 Max.

These people are the REAL DEAL. I had the privilege of working with them for an entire summer and I couldn't be more grateful.

If you haven't met these two driven people yet (Charbel and Katie), you need to take the time to do so, because you WILL NOT regret it. Their business model and values are those of which that need to be replicated everywhere.

Their class style is a butt whooping you won't forget. They have 1 hour classes which consists of alternating between 15 minutes of weight training/body weight exercises and 15 minutes of cardio, and repeat! They have really fun energetic classes with great workout music and knowledgeable trainers. Try to go to Katie or Charbel's classes if you can as they are the geniuses behind this place and you are likely to get the full experience.

There are locker rooms to store your stuff, bathrooms and showers available as well. They have class times all day from 6am to 8pm so you're likely to find something that fits your schedule. They even do express workouts during lunch which are 45 mins.

You can try your first class free which is worth at least stopping in for. You most likely have not worked out like this before and will be in for a treat.

My favorite workout in Center City! A great workout that incorporates both cardio and strength training. It takes a bit to get used to running while watching a virtual screen, but it is very helpful to see the timed intervals and have options for speed modifications right in front of you rather than being told/yelled at you as in many other classes. Also, the amenities are fantastic! Free locker, (which they give you a key for so feels very secure), showers with towels provided, luxury body wash/shampoo/conditioner with essential oil base. Also, very thankful for the student discount rates!
Love it!  Great weightlifting gym in downtown STL.  I travel here from out of town and this is walking distance to the main hotels and the drop in fee is cheap!

This is a cool, 18000 sq. ft. gym located in a trendy loft neighborhood near downtown St. Louis.  It's in a converted loft building so there are multiple levels rather than one huge open space - kinda nice if you don't like that "feeling that everyone is watching you" while you lift those weights.

The equipment is all new since the place just opened within the past few months.  The locker room is spotless and carpeted.  Each locker has a digital keypad combo lock so you don't need to bring your own lock.  They offer towel service, too, so you don't need to bring your own towels.  The showers are individual and private and there is a steam room.  The entire locker room has the feel of an upscale residential bathroom - nice tile in the showers, shower curtains, and even bathmats in front of each shower.

Not sure what the membership fees are since I was just visiting St. Louis.  However, the daily guest fee is $10.  If you want a weekly pass, they sell one for around $32.

Love this place....

So I love this gym. The entire 2 years that I was a member I loved it because it fit my needs exactly. I have since cancelled my membership due to leaving for work nowadays at 530 am leaves me little time to actually go but I am hoping one of these days my work schedule changes and I can start going again. My favorite part would have to be the large amount of cardio equipment that was usually readily available and the usual staff I encountered was always incredibly friendly. When I made the decision that I needed to cancel I was a little nervous because I am insanely non confrontational but the process was smoother than I could have asked for. Within an hour of sending my email through the website I had an email back from the manager and I really respect that. I would have to say the only thing I wish was different about the place would be the hours. I have a long commute and having them open earlier (or later) would be very beneficial.

I am incredibly impressed with the fitness factory. I live downtown and work in the county and it is so nice to work out in the morning and then shower in a nice, clean shower before heading off to work. The machines and showers are never crowded and I am always able to get my workout/shower in and get to work in earth city by 8. I can not speak for the evening hours because my workout time is always in the am but the morning staff is evry friendly and the lady behind the desk is constantly folding new towels, cleaning, etc. I have tried quite a few gyms but have never felt as comfortable working out at one.

I have been a member of Fitness Factory for nearly three years.  I originally joined because I lived downtown, but I have since moved and am keeping my membership there because I'm so attached to the place. My favorite part about the gym is the group exercise classes - Katie (who is also a personal trainer) and Beth are my favorites. They always guarantee a mix-up in workouts and a total butt-kicking. 

The gym itself is very aesthetically pleasing - it's got a ton of windows and split levels. It's got an open loft feel with wood and exposed brick. The have cardio machines, weight machines and free weights on both floors. There are large TVs that you can see from almost all of the cardio machines, but there are also built-in TVs on some of the machines as well. 

The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. Generally, the members there are very fit and motivated. I believe they have recently changed management and I've seen an improvement in how quickly equipment gets fixed.

My only complaint really relates to the group exercise equipment - the mats are old and need to be replaced.  It would also be nice to get some new equipment that the gym doesn't already have, such as TRX, Bosu, or kettle bells. A kettle bell class would be excellent!

Overall, I love this place.  It's a great gym. If you're visiting St. Louis and want to get a workout in - definitely go here.

I hate working out, I really do.

Does Fitness Factory inspire me? No, but I don't think anything could.

Luckily for them, there isn't much competition on Wash Ave, but they do a generally good job.

I don't take any classes or personal training, but for what I need to do there is plenty of nice, newer  equipment and usually not a wait. The people working there are friendly and things are always being cleaned.

Seriously though, would it be that tough to get more little towels? There are always hundreds of big towels ready, but it's a treat if I get a small towel. For $50 a month that's not too much to ask.

Ah, the complexities of the health club. There are simply too many variables to know what you're getting when joining. I think the key to health club excellence lies within the value. In other words, the higher the price, the better machines and amenities it must offer. Cleanliness is a must! I'm already more germophobic than any sane person and health clubs are like a petri dish - except with extra petri! And finally, it's the peeps you end up working out with. A building full of douchebags wouldn't be so bad if they were wearing headbands, half-shirts and were sporting feathered hair like in 80's movies. All you'd have to do is rig a cake to fall on their head cake which is apparently embarrassing enough that everyone finally realizes what a jerk that dude is and then you get the girl and blah blah blah. Of course, novelty douchebags are a dying breed. Real douchebags can ruin a gym. So where does Fitness Factory fall?

I've joined low cost clubs and high cost clubs and both have their plusses and minuses. The Fitness Factory sits square in the area of mid-range coming in at around $50 a month. The question is, what do you get for that 50 bones?

First of all, you get decent machines. They aren't brand new, or top-of-the-line (at least the cardio machines aren't) but they aren't horrible. The weight areas are abundant so you can almost always find an area to use even when it's crowded, which it often is. Still, for the price, the machines are where Fitness Factory takes a hit value-wise. 

Sadly, the same goes for the amenities. There's gated parking around the corner which is nice, but also was recently closed for over a month for seemingly no good reason. It wasn't that big of a deal considering they just pointed you to the gated lot next store, but it was still annoying that no work was being done to our former parking spots. 

While they do provide you with lockers with built in coded security, the most annoying aspect of Fitness Factory is the towel situation. Yeah, sometimes they run out. Actually, a lot of times they run out. It happens pretty much every night around 6. My co-workers probably think it's sooo funny that I race out of the office to go work out. I'm way too proud to tell them that it's because of a towel. 

The one saving grace of the shortness of towels is that it probably means they are washing them. This is a plus on my mental cleanliness chart. Everything else seems fairly clean except for the treadmills which have some weird crud in the cup-holders. Come to think of it, that's pretty effing gross. The good news is that I've never had an instance where the building smelled bad. Even the locker rooms are well maintained! Well, I can't vouch for the girls room, but in all my years of bathroom research, I've concluded the cleanliness ratio on women's to men's rooms is 4 to 1. This means the women's room at the Fitness Factory is shiny in some way.

Other than it's location, the best thing about the Fitness Factory seems to be the people. Everyone that I've come across are more than helpful and the many people who member there are gracious. In other words the douchebag level is low. It's notable that this isn't a show off gym. Sure, there are some very fit people working out, but it's always without fanfare. No ridiculous grunting or unnecessary weight slamming. You'll also find many people out of shape there. The trainers have a seemingly good reputation and I've heard quite a few success stories. 

In the end what you have is a gym that's pretty average. Nothing too awesome and nothing too bad. Not that it needs to be. First and foremost, gyms are for working out and that's what everyone is doing there. Socializing is rare. If I can go in and get my workout done while remaining comfortable in my surroundings I'm happy. Just please hook me up with a towel.

I've been a member of Fitness Factory for about 3 months now and am overall pretty satisfied with the gym.  There are plenty of cardio machines that are each equiped with a device so you can hook up your earphones and listen to the 9 TVs that are in front of each grouping of cardio equipment (there 2 cardio theaters and a level of cardio machines that each have their own TVs).

There is a pretty good selection of weight equipment though it seems to be a bit crowded at times.

My one complaint about Fitness Factory is that they don't encourage people to clean off the machines after they use them.  There are just a few cleaning stations that have some moist towlettes that people can use but I rarely see anyone using them.  I would suggest that they reccomend that people wipe down the equipment after use and they make it easier for them to do so.

Overall, I have had a great experience with The Fitness Factory. I joined last October
after doing a walkthrough with one of the front desk staff members, whom was very friendly. I love that they offer classes with the membership cost and I they have tanning beds on-site. The facility is always clean, the staff is always helpful, and I have never experienced any issues with the machines. Great place to workout if you live, or are visiting downtown St. Louis!

Nice gym, friendly customer service. Reasonable guest pass for guest who are staying locally downtown in the hotel. Or you will pay $15 for a day. 4 stars because they are limited on the cable cross over. I had to wait a lot. They need additional equipment so people aren't waiting so long

This is a review from a visitor's viewpoint. I stayed at the Courtyard a few blocks from this gym. As such, the usual $16 guest pass was reduced to $10. The receptionist ( front desk employee? whatever) was very nice, the first afternoon I was there, and still nice at 5am the next morning when I went again.
  The gym is actually pretty big with a couple of floors of equipment. Free weights and some treadmills were on the first floor, and there were weight machines/treadmills on the second. The machines were clean, and there were complimentary towels for personal use, and black towels to wipe down the machine. Not many complaints save for not enough of the free-weight machines (cables, machines that you put plates onto to increase the weight. I'd certainly go there again

Love the light and open plan. Plenty of equipment so generally no wait.  The staff is usually very friendly and casual, providing a greeting on arrival and departure.  The locker rooms are always clean and the equipment is in good condition.  They have a two-colour towel system: white for personal wiping, black for equipment wiping.  I like this, even though I don't always see people following these directions, which are posted at all towel stations.  And the towel stations are located everywhere. Another plus.  You will never have to walk very far to get things to clean your equipment.  This is an improvement over other gyms that usually have one or two stations throughout the entire place.  Kudos to this place for making bacteria free equipment a priority.  I also see the staff regularly cleaning the equipment.  

The atmosphere here is very positive.  There are many many windows that look out on to a beautiful park. And the dark carpet with splashes of colour really helps make it a comfortable place to spend time.  They have beverages that you can purchase on your account as well as a dry cleaning service - a really nice touch for busy professionals.  

The one thing that could take them up to a five star rating is more attention to an odd billing issue.  I paid for a year in advance and have a credit card on file for beverage purchases, etc.  Yet they consistently mention that I don't have a bank account listed on my account for membership renewals.  This is a bit annoying.  If I paid for a year in advance, then the only time this should be addressed is when that year is ending.  They've finally stopped asking but occasionally a new person at the front desk will see the note pop up when I check in and will remind me that I need to have billing info on file.

Thanks to Dexter L. who previously reviewed Fitness Factory, I was able to work out on my trip to St. Louis. This gym was just blocks from my hotel. It's in a cute, albeit a bit unlively,  little neighborhood. A guest pass is $10 per day. I purchased two days. Sign up could not have been any easier. 

Good - towel service, electronic lockers, sufficient equipment, SUPER DUPER OUT OF THIS WORLD nice woman working at the front desk. If nothing else, go to this gym because niceness should be rewarded. 

Bad - loud music blaring over the speakers. I am used to the ultra quiet cardio room at LVAC. No televisions on individual cardio machines. They have cardio theatre but it's not the same as having your very own television. 

If I ever visit St.  Louis again, I would workout here again. Try it! I lost five pounds this week thanks to the Fitness Factory. I even ate lots of chocolate from Crown Candy Kitchen. Take that Weight Watchers!

As gyms go, I like the fitness factory.  It makes working out for people that live downtown (or near downtown) a lot easier.  The biggest perk is the parking.  You get to park over just one street and not search your purse for quarters.  There are always plenty of cardio machines open and lots of tvs.  Working out isn't the most fun activity, so if I can watch tv while I work out, I am a happier camper.

The ladies locker room is nice, though the locker area is a little small.  The shower facilities are clean and each one of them has a toilet in there as well, almost like a full bathroom.

There are a variety of muscle building weights and machines, so if you have a favorite brand, you're likely to find it here.

The front desk staff is always friendly and quick to lend you a compliment on your work ethic at the gym.  For me, this membership was a great investment!

great weightlifting gym, good variety of machines and weights, clean, nice staff. they could close at 11pm but hey - if you don;t get your butt to the gym by 9pm..
still - one of the better gyms I have seen so 5 stars!

In the past ten years I've lived in three different major cities. I've been to a lot of gyms. This is hands down, without a doubt the best gym I have ever been to. My membership is included in my lease as I live in one of the lofts on the next block. I'm moving out of state at the end of the month and man, I'm going to miss this. The environment is very inviting. They do have trainers in there but they do not harass you like a used car salesman. I have seen only one stair mill that was out of order but there are so many so no worries there. They have every machine imaginable. I went into the bathroom yesterday for the first time; I couldn't believe it. There's everything you can possibly need in there. Towels, NICE showers, hairdryer, hand sanitizer, lotion, qtips and mouthwash! Let me tell you the absolute BEST feature about this gym. THE TANNING BEDS! They actually WORK! Every gym I've ever been to that has "tanning" is such a waste of time. The bulbs are always old; pointless. I believe they have 3-4 beds. 2 or 3 lay down and a standup. They also offer classes. I will be trying one next week. If I owned a gym, this is exactly how I would do it.

The gym is great - plenty of equipment and about everything you would need for a good workout. The staff were friendly. Not much more you could ask for. From what I saw the equipment was well maintained. Glad this place was a block away from where I am staying during my short trip to St. Louis.

For some reason, I can't stand this place.  Let's not even get into the complexities of canceling your membership.

One problem here is hours.  They close VERY early on weekends, and close relatively early on the weeknights.  They open at the crack of dawn.  This isn't helpful to most people, like myself, who'd prefer to work out in the evenings.  They're obviously doing the typical downtown thing and trying to make workers happy, while giving residents a fairly intense screwjob.  I'm used to gyms with late night hours in major cities.

Here's some tips.  And this comes from a customer, not somebody who knows anything about running a gym:  for one, expand your hours.  It's not that hard.  Two, encourage people to take care of the machines.  In general, many St. Louisans tend to not understand communal situations like gyms where your mother isn't there to clean up after you.  I don't enjoy getting on a cardio machine and having to spend 5 minutes (while I'm already rushed due to the early closing time) wiping some douchebag's drool, spittle, and sweat off the machine.

They might not be the biggest, but they certainly are the best gym in the Saint Louis area. Perfect location across from Lucas Park and Main Library, nestled between Locust and Saint Charles at 13th St), you wont need a car to get here, if you live anywhere downtown. If you do have a car, plenty of free, secured parking comes with a membership. Very low-key vibe upon entry and guaranteed you will be greeted and treated as if you are a VIP. The entire staff is member-oriented and go out of their way to make you feel you are working out at home in your rec room...Cleanest gym of any I have been a member, offering racks with plenty of clean towels for both face and equipment along with spray and hand disinfectants. Carpeted floors are vacuumed every day, and bathroom, locker area, and showers are habitually clean. Excellent, extensive, diverse, and redundant (ie no 'weighting/) choice of free weights, cable equipment, machines, core to satisfy the most serious athlete to the novice. Cardio equipment is plentiful but standard; they offer a great view of the park and all the happy dogs, or 9 flat screens with your choice of channels. Excellent group exercise room  to take a standard menu of group classes. If you want personal training, Keith and Kevin are the best in Saint Louis and likely the entire state/Mid-West; just check out their bios, physiques, and overall knowledge; I dare you to ask them about nutrient timing or metabolic efficiency...Bottom line: great gym + great value + great staff + great vibe = great results...

The gym moved a few years ago to a former parking garage, making for a fun, funky environment.  

But there is still a very notable problem with housekeeping, as they have never replaced the two part time staffers whose sole occupation was to vacuum and clean up the place (which was a constant struggle, given the nature of young people who are members of the gym and have apparently only recently moved out of their parents' homes).  

Since my gym membership price has not gone down, I have to assume the McGowan brothers, who own several businesses in the area, are pocketing the difference, leaving me, as a paying member, to pick up after other paying members with lower housekeeping standards.  

The staff is very nice, but whenever there are two young people (or more) sitting at the front desk, my first thought is, "why isn't one of you vacuuming?"  The place rarely looks cleaned.

Of course, the young staff members are getting paid only minimum wage plus (one assumes) a free membership.  But if there are two of them behind the front desk at any time, other than during one of their furtive lunch breaks, I must insist that one of them be vacuuming.  There is no excuse for these fallen standards at Fitness Factory, since its franchise opened in St. Louis, and no reason why I should have to pick up after other members.

Do not take a membership here unless you are positive you really want it and will keep it for a long time. Similarly, do not take a free trial and give them credit card information unless you want to be charged. They are misleading about what you are signing. I did my free trial and did not take a membership, and now, a year later, they are threatening me with small claims court because I didn't fulfill my contract. I have heard several stories along these same lines. It's a nice gym and a good location, but all this business is sketchy. Not worth it.

Really enjoy working out here.

I, too, have been to multiple different places and do different exercise regimens often because I like variety. Although for me, Orange Theory seems like a place I could get used to without becoming bored. 

It is a high intensity interval training workout with a combination of cardio and weight training. Each class is 60 minutes, while an instructor guides and ultimately pushes you through this group workout. Half the workout is done on a treadmill and row machine, while the other half is done on the open floor that provides dumbbells, trx etc. It essentially becomes a circuit. However many rounds you can get through with the allotted time. What's important to know is that you are competing with the clock, not the people around you! If you don't finish your reps or even get to it at all, it's no worries..as long as you did your best that you could do. They may call out who ran the fastest mile or 2000 meter row, but not every class is like that.  

If you're new, you must show up 30 minutes before the class begins to fill out paperwork and to go over everything. They start your free trial off with a heart rate monitor that connects to the flat screens above with your name. It shows your progress and end results as to how many calories you burned, what your max push was during the workout, etc. This will explain the "orange theory" being that the orange level on the bar graph will determine the hardest you worked and gives you an idea where you should be or want to work up to.

You are not required to purchase a monitor there or wear one at all, but they are available at an extra cost and are a bit pricey..

So far, everyone has been helpful and genuine. I would recommend it, so if this sounds like something of interest to you..sign up for your free trial online!!

Awesome workout! 60 min Flys buy and you feel well worked by the end. The entire staff is cool and the trainers really know what they are doing. I would highly recommend if your looking to add cardio with high intensity training. You may want to still maintain a gym for weight training.

Such a great workout, and really friendly staff! The workout changes every day and the heart rate monitor helps you to push yourself further than you would in a regular workout. I burned over 800 calories, and the fact that every day is different means that I never reach a plateau, and never get bored!

I wish i could give more than 5 stars!  I LOVE orangetheory fitness SO much.   Let me add that i have a  VERY long history of dropping out of gyms.  I would enthusiastically  sign up and never see the inside of the place again.  My most recent foray was to a nearby upscale gym (Virtua) which cost almost 2 x what i pay at Orangetheory.  It was nice, but not very fun, motivating, or engaging.  I went and just mindlessly plodded along on the treadmill/elliptical/etc. without much purpose in my self-directed program.  Of course, i didn't get any results - mainly because i wasn't working very hard.  it was VERY easy to do just the minimum.  

At Orangetheory, it could not be more different.  Everyone moves a a pace that is challenging for them (which is different for everyone).  You have the benefits of a class (motivating to be around others who are obviously working hard), but it is a competition with ONLY yourself.  The heart rate monitors are super helpful in taking the mystery out of - how hard are you working?  Previously, i've been sweaty, panting and breathless, but i wasn't working hard like this.  And the results are definitely coming.  I could not even do a push up when i started!  Now, i can do several sets (after only a few short weeks - like 8 i think?)  

Lastly, i just want to mention how helpful, constructive and delightful everyone who works there is.  I have a nagging back injury which prevents certain movements for me, and my trainer, Anthony, could not be more helpful, patient or accommodating.  he always scales movements and provides alternatives.  he often corrects my form in a super helpful way.  it is so wonderfully helpful.  In addition, the staff of the gym, the front desk and the manager Rachel are extremely extremely helpful.  Always happy, it's obvious that everyone loves working there !!  They also could not be more helpful!  

It's a pleasure to come here to work out.  i would never ever imagine that those words would be uttered by me!!!
This place is a joke! Go if you don't know anything about fitness but if you're not an idiot, don't waste your time....
Great workouts but yet again another membership based set up that makes it difficult to cancel.  Why do companies do this?  It just makes me never want to go back.

I was looking for a place to workout where it wasn't as brutal as Crossfit but better than a regular gym. The trainers always have high energy so it keep me motivated to work harder. I've only been 3 times and I'm already starting to see results.

Not sure why this OT has such negative reviews- most of them have to do with billing/accounting which IMO shouldn't be taken into consideration when reviewing the workout. 

Anyway, with that being said, I love OT. Kelly is absolutely the best trainer- she genuinely wants to see you succeed and is so supportive. There are so many class times so you have no excuse for not being able to make it to a class. Yes it's pricier than a normal gym membership - I have the 8 classes a month for $99 package, but it's like having a gym membership and personal trainer all in one. For me, it's a much more effective workout than a gym because you're told exactly what to do, but can go at your own pace. 

I love OT and will continue to get my splat points!

Had a horrible experience with this company  My wife and I had to cancel account, for business reasons. 1st they make it sound like it's simple to cancel with no problems but that is not so
 if you cancel with Orange theory you will be charged one extra month automatically will come out your account. So when we'd suspend our account because our business and had our account on hold we would not aware that it was a  90 day hold right after, are account just got automatically charge without a courtesy call email any type of form of information let us know that they will go ahead and charge are account. I feel that a company should have the courtesy to communicate with their clients to let them know. The only time they're really calling us is to sell something to us. I'm truly unsatisfied with this company and I feel people should think twice before becoming a member with them.

I only joined OTF about two weeks ago but I am already obsessed! The workouts are challenging but exiting, each day it's something totally new. I love being held accountable by signing up in advance, I've worked out more in the past two weeks than I have all year long. The trainers are so nice and keep you motivated throughout the class. It's so worth it!

Best workout EVER! I work my schedule around getting in either Kelly or Jordan's class - they are so motivating & classes are fun even though I feel like I'm dying the entire time. I upgraded my membership to unlimited and it was the best decision ever. 

Coaches, staff, location, class size, & class schedules - all 5 stars! 

I have never had any issues with my billing, even when I upgraded my membership. No issues.

Today marked the end of my first month of rowing at RowZone. I could not be more happy with my experience thus far. At my first class, I met with the instructor, Laura, who spent time going over the ERG machine with me and showing me proper rowing form. She continued to check in with me throughout the class to see how I was doing and kept me motivated to keep pushing myself. 

While I have not taken classes from all of the instructors at RowZone, from my experience I can tell you that Laura is phenomenal. She structures her classes to be a mixture of rowing and strength training, with five 5-minute sets of rowing and a "break" of weight/resistance band training in between each set.

It's a tough workout, especially when Laura throws sprints into the mix, but that's why you're going, right? In one month I have lost 8 lbs and can notice considerably more muscle definition in my shoulders, arms and legs. In addition to great classes, the trainers are happy to share advice on other fitness topics from nutrition to exercises you can do at home. The online scheduler RowZone uses makes it easy to find classes that fit into your schedule, just be sure to be considerate and don't cancel at the last minute or fail to show up at all as there can sometimes be a wait list of other rowers who would like to get in the class.

One last point I'd like to make is the sense of community that RowZone fosters. While the quality of your workout is ultimately up to you, the support you receive from your peers is immensely valuable. When you feel like there's no way your legs can push you through those last 5 minutes of rowing, all you have to do is look to a neighbor for motivation to keep going.

RowZone is a full body workout that is highly effective and never boring. Cardio on the ERG, weights and AB exercises make it the most efficient 45 minute workout I have ever done. And, the instructors (Laura in particular) are all professional and motivational. It feels like personalized instruction!

3.5! I do really enjoy going to Rowzone, but I feel like the instructors vary.
Some instructors are really great and adjust you when your form is off. Some instructors just go through the class and don't really pay attention. I've definitely had times where I had a sore back the next day because my form was way off. I'm still getting use to the rowing technique and I wish that the instructor had paid attention. I know the classes can get full so it's hard, but I must have been doing it all wrong.
I like the mix of rowing a few minutes and then working out (like sit ups, push ups, and etc.) a few minutes. The arm blasts work outs are my favorite. 
Facility is clean. Everyone is easy going. It's a good workout.

What a great workout at RowZone! It's not just 45 minutes of sitting on a Row Machine but 45 minutes of non stop rowing intervals mixed with core and weight circuits. The staff is thorough, friendly and fun and you really get  personal attention and motivation. You'll walk away feeling that good kinda burn! I can't wait to hit up my next class!

I was sort of unsure how to rate this place. I had a similar experience to Sara P. 
I joined in October. Got a GREAT workout. It was really enjoyable and definitely challenging. In December, emails about fraud, theft, employees leaving started coming.  My husband and I had purchased, but didn't get to use yet, 10 classes each for $85.  The new owners wouldn't recognize the 10 classes, but we can each have $85 credit. I was told we had till the end of Feb to covert the credit to classes but the owner said I may want to wait, as she offers specials in February. 
I email this week about a deal they have for 5 classes for $47. I get an email back that I can't use the credits for special deals.  What???
I just want to use my credits, and walk away. It doesn't seem to me that this place is fixed at all.
There are plenty of places in Philadelphia where I can work out and not have to worry about all this drama.
The workout is a 4-5 star. The ethics is a 1.

The place is a smaller facility but I really get my workout in.

Depending on which instructor it is, the circuit training may vary but the music always keeps me going as well as the variety in circuits. 

They take walk-ins but I just sign up via Classpass.

Make sure to bring $1 since towels are not complimentary.

I try to work a RowZone class at least once a week. 

I highly suggest trying it out if you want to add variety to your workout regimen.

Plus the music is a great variety that will keep you pumped especially for those who enjoy hip hop.

Best workout for your entire body! Every instructor is amazing and they all push you in different ways, so tons of variety. Each instructor has their own unique style, music, etc so you can never get bored. This workout is no joke, you will sweat& workout every muscle in your body! As far as the studio goes, the location can not be beat. It's on the 2nd floor but no windows. But Trust me that does not matter because your eyes are glued on the instructor the entire class for direction, pace& power. I love how the studio is well lit, bright and clean. They maintain it impeccably. Whether you are out of shape or a gym junkie, this studio will certainly push you!

I've been going here for a few months and I have to say, I love it. I feel like I'm getting a better workout than other things I've tried and as far as workouts go, it's fun. Laura is by far the best - she mixes things up well by changing exercises often throughout and targeting different body parts on different days, plus she's encouraging without being annoying. I just wish they had more space in their morning classes!

I had my first rowing class EVER Saturday morning with Chris.  I was so nervous that I showed up half an hour early.  When I was buzzed in, I saw a bunch of very fit humans on machines getting yelled at while Ramstein blared in the background.  I almost turned and ran, but decided to stick it out (mainly cause no stores were open that early).  Chris came out upon completion of the previous class and took about 10 minutes to show me everything that I needed to know about the studio and the machines.
