State of the art equipment, overlooking PETCO, trainers who are World-Class Olympic and Professional athletes, clean, beautiful club.

Way too expensive and they don't offer single water aerobics classes to members of the community... you have to be a member of the club to use the pool. In an expensive city like Santa Barbara, this club would do well to offer water aerobics to everyone, not just club members. I had a foot surgery that has me on limited movement, and I need water aerobic classes. I'm taking my money and my business elsewhere.

I went to visit my daughter in Santa Barbara and she was excited to get me into her Zumba class.  The class was small about nine ladies of various ages.  This was my very first Zumba class (Jocy my yelp friend if you are reading this I see why you enjoy Zumba so much).  It was so much fun and being the new lady in the class I am convinced I looked hilarious but I was determined not to get discouraged, to keep up with the movements as best I could and to hold my head high.  Because it's not about being the best, it's about getting out there and moving, right! 

 I totally enjoyed myself, everyone was so friendly and supportive and the instructor Lauren was "AWESOME".  Her energy, personality and Zumba movements were incredible.   This Sunday morning Zumba class kicked my butt, it was fantastic!!

In addition to the Zumba class this gym was in great condition.  The guy checking us in was very nice, friendly and professional.  This gym has a lot to offer: Yoga classes, personal trainers, aquatics fitness, a refreshment café, and more.

I hate writing negative reviews but my experience with this gym definitely warrants one. 
First of all, the staff is extremely unfriendly, something I noticed right out of the gate. 
The sign up process took over an hour, which is pretty outrageous. At signup, the staff member who helped me informed me that there was a $100 early cancellation fee. 
I ended up cancelling within the first two months. I received a call from a different staff member who informed me that I would receive a bill for the cancellation fee. I never received a bill but my debit card was charged $100. 
If that wasn't bad enough, I received a second charge for $300 about two weeks later, which was drawn off of my debit card. 
I called to question the charges and the staff member I spoke with was extremely rude and informed me that the $300 charge was discounted from an early termination fee of $500. 
So all totaled up, I was charged over $500 for one month of a mediocre health club...
Aside from that, for over $130 per month, the facilities are not what you would think would warrant a monthly fee of that size.

Planet fitness, specifically the one on Murfreesboro Rd in franklin, is fantastic! Being a fitness junkie and having spent many years in every gym known to man, as well as being a personal trainer for about a decade, planet fitness is refreshing. I don't have the same need to go workout for 3 hours a day and stare in the mirror at my progress and compare myself to what I looked like a month ago, and to the other people around me. And Planet Fitness caters to that. It's so clean and well maintained. The staff is super friendly and i truly believe the laid back atmosphere that  encourages you to come do your own thing when it's convenient for you is because of the attitude generated by employees.  The locker rooms are great. Never had a complaint and I LOVE the black card member benefits!

Its pretty empty but the facility seems clean and its very new.  Everything was very simple to use and it was a convenient, quick experience.  The employee could have been friendlier, but there weren't any issues.

After a bad experience at another PF in town, I was very impressed with the customer service of this location. On my first day, I asked if I could buy a lock for the locker room. The guy at the counter goes, "Oh, we don't make you do that here. Let me show you...."  He takes me over to some lockers and shows me that all I have to do is put a combination of my choice in the lock and I'm good to go. No hassle. He saved me some money and the hassle of having to remember another combination. Thank you!!! He also answered some other newbie questions for me and couldn't have been more friendly. My experience with the other employees thus far have been nothing but stellar. They've been joyous, courteous and helpful. Thanks guys!
I workout here 5 days a week, and love it!  The staff is friendly,  the place is immaculate,  the equipment is in excellent shape.

I used a PF in Texas for years and the quality of the one in Franklin is above and beyond what I have experienced anywhere else. It's new, so it is very clean and shiny. I like the no judgement slogan of PF and they stick to it. I never feel awkward and I like that the staff is helpful and nice. It's a little cold in there, but I think that's just a gym thing. I like the bells of the black card, but I would even recommend it without the added amenities of the black card. It just feels clean and friendly all the time. It gets a little crowded in the afternoons early in the week. I haven't gone in the mornings, though. Parking is a breeze since it is in a shopping center of sorts and there is a large shared lot.
The staff has been so helpful! They have showed me how to work the machines, answered all my questions and been just wonderful
What a hard time trying to join. The guy who didn't want to help me, Daniel, made it an absolute horrible experience. I hope when I come back it will be a better experience.

I really enjoy this facility. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the locker room and workout areas are always very clean as well. The do a great job keeping everything looking good. All the machines and equipment are in great shape as well.

Ana at check in was not super pleasant. I don't keep physical checks, and I was dismissed pretty quickly since I didn't have one. I called my bank and got the information in a different way, and when I presented it, it was like I was the idiot. Not a great way to start with this new local business. "No shaming" was not in force at the check in desk today.

Don't go to planet fitness if you are from out of town and just want to buy a day pass. They wanted to charge 21.95 for one day. This is a rip-off. I travel often for work and buy day passes for 5 to 10 dollars. 

Then to showcase their business acumen, they recommend a gym down the street that charges $10 bucks. So they literally don't want your business and are sending paying clientele to their direct competition. Makes no sense.

By the time we finished our membership here, we had really appreciated the help from Julia. She was always ready to help with any challenges we had. The facility is adequate and clean. The desk staff changed over a lot in the couple of years as did the trainers. I think it is a good place to workout for the price.

My problem with this place besides it's way too crowded the last I heard it was pushing 1400 people a day but besides that it's just the music is just way too loud.  I come after 11  the music is blasting like you're in a club in New York City.  Everyone has their own earphones or headphones on there's no need to blast it nobody wants to hear the awful music please respect people have their own taste.  We want to go and work out they don't want to be subject to somebody else's music please keep it low so we can all choose what we want with our own devices and not be so disturbed by some deafening decibel horrible music.  This is almost 2022 we don't need music we all have our own readily available this is not the old days please get with the times.

So this is solely on the few staff members (ESPECIALLY THE ONE TRAINER Mackay and most of the female staff) that don't make any new comers or people who aren't from here feel welcomed! I'm from LA and I think people can tell I'm not from here but the stares and the looks of just judgements all the time! I thought planet fitness was suppose to be a judgement free zone. I'm a single mom, who also struggles from a history of hip dysplasia (I've had 3-5 hip surgeries on both hips and now have 5 screws in my right hip) and I'm just trying to get back into shape. I just don't understand if your a staff member why the need to make people feel more uncomfortable than they already feel. 

And today I passed by the trainer Mackay in the locker room and we almost ran into each other, what does this lady do, she takes one good look at me up and down doesn't say excuse me or anything and just walks pass me like I'm in her way and I need to move. The audacity that even a trainer can just disregard someone who literally is just trying to come to gym to escape from feeling insecure. 

I'm just so appalled and have never felt so discouraged to go to a gym. Before having my son I use to be a member at 24 hour and GOLDS GYM in LA and I have never felt this way ever in those gyms than I do at this  particular "JUDGMENT FREE ZONE" Planet Fitness.
Pretty good gym for sure. The atmosphere is welcoming and it is very clean. Three stars for two reasons; no bench press and no squat rack. Good starter gym!
Eh it's your average PF.  It's a bit small but the staff is great.  The bathrooms can be a bit messy and overflowing with trash which is why I give it three stars.  Not bad for $10 a month.

I joined LA Fitness about 8 months ago. The facilities are nice and they seem to be kept clean. I love the fact that they have racquetball courts and a pool. I would love to play more basketball but the gym is always packed. It is always fairly busy when I go. 

Their sales staff is a little pushy and I was really excited on how they treated my sister-in-law when she went to use her 3 day trial. I think it is nice price for the facilities and options they have. My wife likes to go to the Zumba classes. I like that they offer different classes!

The trainer pushed my leg so far as to tear my muscle, which has now lead to physical therapy, and possible surgery, I'm disgusted by this gym. Trying to cancel the contact with a doctors letter stating this reason, getting told it will probably be declined because I'm not permanently damaged. So they will only cancel your membership and/or training after they permanently damage your body. Not before. Not when their trainer already tore your muscle. But after. Even asked, so I have to continue paying 350 a month, with an already damaged leg, cause you won't stop charging me, after you have been told by a doctor that I have damage and continuing to push it will cause permanent damage but you won't cancel until you and your personal trainer actually cause the permanent damage. Good business practices LA Fitness. Stay far away from this place. Never have I had a business actually tell me I have to permanently disable myself before they will stop.

I broke my collar bone several months ago and called the gym to cancel my monthly membership.  They said I have to come by the gym and talk to one of the account managers.   I am not into that high pressure "retention" talk.  They kept billing my card for six months.  I stopped the auto billing on my credit card and now I am getting calls almost every day from their billing department.  I told them I cancelled my membership almost a year ago, and they don't listen.  I will never recommend them to anyone!

This gym has lots of amenities such as the basketball court, pool, racquetball, and of course equipment... however, for the amount of money you pay each month they need to invest in some friendly front desk staff, some fans and AC that actually works, more cleaning stations (there are like 3 in the entire place), and people to come around and actually clean equipment. I've been to multiple LA Fitness's and this one by far needs some extra tender love for cleaning.

Please open earlier!!  Or go 24 hours. While I realize that would drive up costs, maybe open early for those who pay for it. I have a hard time going at the end of an exhausting day. (Yup it's about me). Otherwise I love the facility. Great job peeps

Great facility, always clean and the staff is always friendly. I love the BodyWorks class! There are lots of times to choose from throughout the week and weekend too, which is especially nice. I take my daughter to the Kids Club and am really pleased with that, as well! I have never seen this gym super packed either, which is another plus.

Affordable and it offers some fun classes. The personal trainers are also a great option. If I had the funds I'd definitely be signed up with one! If you like a group setting, the spin class is great. See ya there!

My wife just did a personal training consultation with Kyle and she had a great experience. He was friendly and gave her tips on training and different areas she could work on to have a better workout experience and see results. He wasn't pushy, but honest with his advice.

If you are new to working out and want a push, try their classes! All the instructors here are very friendly and care. The gym is always clean and you always will see a custodian on the floor cleaning. Their kids club is amazing! I had a terrible experience with the kids area at another gym and said I would never bring my kids to another gym... With that being said, I love all the staff members and feel 100% comfortable leaving my kids with them. They know my kids by name the moment they walk in. Overall, a great gym!

How is it that I come here so often and I have not managed to write a review? Well let me just stretch out my fingers and get to typing!! 

Pump up the jam! So I have been to a few gyms through living in a few places and travel. As far as gyms go this one ranks up there with the nicer ones. Nothing to special. They have the usual suspects as far as patrons and equipment goes. 

Say what?! I was an easy sale. Not going to lie, I wanted a gym close to me this LA happened to be a gym close to me. Hardly a match made in heaven but it was a match none the less. Looking like an easy sale did not stop Derrick from giving me his all and it's really presentation that blows me away. So the kids got to hang out in the Kids Klub and I got to tour and sign up. I got a lot of great advice along the way from Derrick. Sign up was a breeze, price was just right. We got some Kids Klub action, some personal training action. We we set! 

Little in the middle but she got much back. I'm a bit of a curvy girl ... ok so I have some serious curve in the hip. I don't feel judged. I feel judged A LOT elsewhere in life. Here, nope. No one cares, they are doin their own thing. I like it. So we have a personal trainer, a master personal trainer even, who is just great! Mason works on more than just the repetitive movement, he really breaks it down to the basics and helps you with proper movement. The best thing about him is he is so encouraging and not in the boot campy, harsh or angry way. I really feel true commitment to not wanting to disappoint him. Don't tell my husband (who trains with me) but seeing Mason is the highlight of my week. I kid, I kid. We have found true pleasure in exercising together. 

MOMS AND DADS ... Kids Klub. Wow. The people in there are so awesome. I'm not a fan of leaving my kids with strangers. These guys don't stay strangers for long and each one of them are so awesome with the kiddos. Secure. Yes. Secure. The kids are happy, I am happy. 

Overall. Love it. Try it. Change your life. Happy gyming :)

I see a repeating theme of unfriendly and unhelpful staff, especially the daytime manager, and I totally agree. Any suggestions/complaints are met with a "no can do" attitude. Because issues aren't addressed, people give up trying. Please don't confuse a lack of complaints with improvement of the situation. 

For example, for years we have asked for more cooling in the spin room and have been told an additional fan was about to be installed. Never happened. Same with the room used for yoga. We were actually told the room would be cooled for "actual exercise" classes. We were also told that each instructor was asked and said the temperature was perfect. Odd that each instructor has asked us to complain to management about the heat- it's very stuffy always and uncomfortably hot most of the year. Members have requested better cooling all the way up to corporate. 

Also, we have asked repeatedly if while yoga is in session, racquetball players could be asked to use a court other than the one that shares a common wall with the yoga room- assuming one is available. We have been told that is not a fair request to make to those members. None have ever objected the move when we ask so how hard could it be to post a sign on the door during yoga classes or assign a different court? 

There are lots of classes offered and the yoga and spin classes I take are great. Especially Liz and Sunday morning yoga. She puts a lot into her classes including use of blocks, straps and essential oils. 

LA Fitness is a value for the monthly rate for sure. The Marana management and front desk staff needs an adjustment.

Love this gym!  The equipment here is up to date, clean, and nice.  The basketball court is well kept and the people here are fun to play some pick up games.  The gym does not get as crowded as the one on 1st, which is the closest to my house, but I drive to this one since it is way better than that one.  This is definitely the best LA Fitness in the Tucson area.

Love going to this location. The equipment is new and clean, with personal TVs on almost all cardio equipment. There are also a wide variety of fitness classes at no extra cost, such as yoga or zumba. I just wish it was open 24 hours like other gyms.

I have been nothing but impressed with the service and facility at this location. I use to go to the one on the east side and wasn't that impressed with it. Even though there was a hiccup with our contract at first, Dane fixed it in a timely manner, and there has been no troubles after. I have to give credit to Travis up front who checks in clients and was quick to recognize that there may have been a billing issue and brought that to the attention of Dane and Melody. Like I mentioned previously they got this issue resolved promptly and no problems have been occurring after.

The facility is clean, and the childcare is wonderful. Ms. Norma and Ms. Genesis really look out for the kids. I know there are other ladies there too who do a great job watching the kids and as a mommy that makes me feel a lot better. Overall the staff has been great, the facility is clean, and the monthly fees aren't a crazy amount!

Can't wait to see Hannah later for a fitness assessment. As soon as that's done I'll be sure to give you an update so you know what to expect.

:o) Jessie N

This LA Fitness just opened Jan 2, 2012. It is the first full service gym in this area. The staff seem very friendly. Lots of equipment so you never have to wait. Even when the parking lot is full it never seems overly crowded inside. Enjoying my first month.

I did a session with Kyle and he was amazing! A trainer like him is rare to find. He is not only knowledgeable in Food Sciences and Physiology, but also highly experienced with how foods and workout can impact one's lifestyle, posture, and emotions. He is enthusiastic and infused with a burning passion to help others achieve their goals. If you are looking for a trainer who won't be giving up on you, Kyle is the right man to go to.

In terms of my rating for this LA Fitness, my explanation can be derived from the fact that there aren't much a variety of equipment here, and you can't rent anything. The place looks a bit old and dirty. Also, the initiation fees are too high -- I wished it could have been lowered for me; it would have been more than three-star rating.

Many amenities to include indoor pool! All classes are inclusive and its very clean and professionally staffed. Dane was our first contact there and he and the rest of the staff are very professional and courteous.  And if you have little ones the caretakers are CPR CERTIFIED and have background checks.
This Marana gym is decent.  Nothing too special.  I come here for the Tuesday hip hop classes, which are a blast!

I've been training with master trainer Joshua P. at LA Fitness Marana for a year and a half.  He's the best!  Always in a great mood and ready to work.  He makes training/working out fun and I love that he teaches me how to do each work out.  He encourages me when I'm feeling weak.  I always leave feeling accomplished.  I highly recommend him!

As for the rest of LA F, always clean and the staff is friendly.  The classes are fun, there are a lot to choose from.
Love this gym, new equipment. Friendly staff. Great Kids daycare with a very caring staff.

I did a free fitness assessment with Kyle and it was a fantastic session. He helped me find my strengths and weaknesses to help me further my fitness journey. I would have signed up with personal training with him had it not been for my personal finances but I would highly recommend him to anyone looking for personal training services. He was very motivating and encouraging throughout the whole session. He has a lot of knowledge with his background in multiple areas of fitness and is not a typical personal trainer but rather someone who is very real and truly wants to help people reach their goals.

I want to thank, Zack Schultz - Personal Trainer, for taking his time in interviewing me to help me prepare for a success membership. He was very educational, professional and he really knows about Health, eating to live and give the body what it needs to maintain optimal health. He was very patient in shadowing my workout and critiquing my form. I'm very impressed with the quality of the staff. I look forward to the months ahead. Thanks Zach!!
Very clean. One of the best that we've been too!

I've been coming here since it opened and was excited about the remodel, it was minimal but looks nice.  It's now been reopened for about 2weeks and it's already dirty.  You can see the hair, dust, water spots and dirt on the brand new floors.  This wasn't visible with the old carpet but if cleaning isn't done daily (sweeping, mopping and cleaning machines) it's going to be a disgusting dirt pit soon.  Nobody wants a dirty facility to work out in!!!

We have been going to this club for the last 5 months and it is awesome.  It's relatively new and still might be considered an undiscovered gem!  But not for long.  The word is out!  Dane, is an outstanding GM and is always there to assist you with any concern you may have. All of his staff are friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.  The trainers are really great and are always available to answer any questions you might have.   The facility is always so clean and well maintained.  They have excellent equipment, a wide variety of exercise classes, 5 racquetball courts, basketball court, heated pool, sauna, beautiful daycare center, and so much more.  We especially appreciate that the music they play is not blasting so loud like in other clubs.  We just really appreciate Dane and all he's done for us since becoming members.  We give this LA fitness the highest rating!

I've been in and out of gyms over the past 15 years. I won't name full names, but among them: G_ld's, 24 Hour ________, Ch_ze, as well as the Gall__y Fitness Club. I have never experienced a fitness club like LA Fitness. The people who work there care about you--starting with Mufassa, the red at the front desk. She always greets me with a warm hello, and if I'm lucky, even makes eye contact. The gym is very clean and well lit with many machines available. You will never have to wait for a machine or free weights--there are just so many that you can easily find a bench, dumbbell, etc. I've never had an issue waiting there, even at night during peak hours.

My main reason for joining this gym is because of the training director, Kyle. He changed my life by getting me signed up with a personal trainer. I was a sickly, weak, little girly-man and could barely do a lunge when I walked through the door. Thanks to Kyle, and my personal trainer, Tristan, I'm now having to buy bigger shirts. My old ones no longer fit through the chest. My body fat has gone from 24% to 19% in three months, and with my new 5 Star Gear (trapper keeper), I'm beating women off with a stick. Kyle has all the qualities I look for in a leader. He cares about people and is there to help. The other girl, Leah is awesome, too. She is incredibly knowledgeable and professional. Just don't let her catch you staring at her shorts. My personal trainer, Tristan is always kind and helpful. He really knows his stuff. I would not hesitate to recommend him as a trainer. What's really great about the staff at this gym is that they're like a family. They have a really upbeat, positive attitude, and it's contagious. My wife loves the classes at this gym. My mom loves the swimming pool. It's rarely ever under maintenance, maybe once a month for a day or two because they totally clean it down. The water is warm and crystal clear. There are lap lanes and it is just delightful. 

This is the best fitness center ever. I highly encourage you to check it out. The most impressive thing is the price. No annual membership dues? No contract? Count me in!

This gym is in a weird area. It's in a shopping center and that makes it hard to get to when it's the weekend. There is usually a lot of traffic along with several restaurants surrounding it. 

The people are wondering and they are very active about cleaning machines. Personal trainers are very committed to helping in any way they can. They have a plethora of workout machines along with several racket ball rooms that can be used for several things. The basketball court is closed off from the main area so it's nice and quiet.

I used to go here because my friend brought me in as a guest. Everyone I've encountered at the facility is friendly, and the place is clean and usually not busy just a few hours before closing. Ryan was super helpful with getting me my own membership and I even got to have a personal training session for a day! And if you're looking to pay for a personal trainer I would go with Josh. He is the one I trained with and he just wants you to be knowledgeable about health and fitness, and he also wants you to push yourself so you can get to where you want to be while still feeling comfortable with the pace you're going and the workouts he's giving you. We did a work out for not even 45 minutes and I was sweating and out of breath. David is great at the front desk too. I called to ask something about my membership because I wasn't able to catch Ryan after my work outs, and he ended up fixing what I needed help with! This location is out of my way but I think it is worth it to go here

Cleanest LAFitness ever... I travel a lot and have not been impressed with any in the Houston area ( I've been to six different ones ), and always long to come back home to my Marana location. Staff here are very nice and the equipment is always in good shape. You can tell there is a sense of pride with the people working there.

I joined LA fitness and this is my primary gym. The facility is nice with good upkeep. There are lots of great machines and classes. I only doc one star simply because I have been to the LA fitness location on Ina and Shannon and think it is a better layout and facility. There are some machines that are missing for me. Oh and their pool, the temperature is kept on the warmer side (which makes it hot doing laps). There are also no time clocks so you can complete interval workouts in the pool. There is also only three lanes that can get crowded sometimes. But compared to other gyms, LA Fitness will be my gym!

This fitness center is okay. It has everything it needs. Nothing too special about it. A while back, a personal trainer named Kyle asked me to write a review and mention his name and he would give me a free workout. As soon as he said that, I was honestly a little sad. He seemed genuinely interested in my health and fitness journey. Well, here's my review, there's his name, and I 100% would decline a workout from not only him. He asked me about the review again after not following up with him and then two other trainers approached me in a similar manner. They weren't rude necessarily, but it just didn't feel right. After this incident, I started working out at Undisputed Boxing Gym and learned what a real gym (yup..no a/c or fancy pools and saunas) felt like. Trainers there literally just walked around, asked very politely if they could help me with my form, learned my name, and asked for nothing in return. I was so inspired by this staff that I am now a nutritional sciences major. I feel so awesome and independent my fitness journey now and I'm not afraid to ask for help at that gym. I still go to LA Fitness sometimes, because it's on a family membership plan, but I feel really really awkward around trainers at this gym. 

I feel like I'm definitely more knowledgeable in the gym, and there's absolutely nothing wrong with getting help from a fitness professional. In fact, I would encourage you to approach an LA fitness coach. This was just my experience. If I were new to a gym and read a review like this, I would feel more confident in knowing details about a place and people I'll be spending my time around.

This is a real nice gym. Very clean, plenty of lockers. 
This is the most friendly population I've encountered in a week. I m doing a round table tour of all the locations. 

But a glaring miss is NO SEATED SHRUGG MACHINE.  It s not just gone, they didn't get one.  
Huge miss. You are restricted in what you 
Can do it if you improvise.   But!!!
That alone cost a star from me and I won't be back. 
But as a free weight area it is excellent.

So...im bit of a gym addict. I get excited to go see gyms, environment, machines and gosh darnet im a people watcher.
Anywho...i went to this gym...guess what! It has punching M.F. bags. And no one uses them..because they dont hit! They lift. I enjoyed myself and the solice of my peace and quite. Through out the gym is clean...some of the personal trainers are lacking the im a friendly person attitude...but other than that. You have really serious lifters cause their clothes are matchy matchy. So you know they serious. Staff was quite not real friendly but you weight the pros and cons...friendly staff or clean toliet. I choose clean toliet.

My wife and I have been members for 7 years, no issues until you try to cancel your membership. For one they say you have to appear in person and speak to a manager. They said the manager is only there for 4 hours on Friday. I tried to meet with the manager last Friday, wasn't there and no one new when they would be there. I called a corporate number, same BS, said you need to fill out a form that they would send( still have not received) and take it to the manager in person. The facility is closed now due to the Coronavirus. I believe I wall just stop payment, I believe I have enough paperwork to sue if the try to send to a collection agency. Don't even join, it's a nightmare to get out of.

The classes and instructors are wonderful, the manager and front desk staff are AWEFUL. I would give it one star but I love the instructors. The manager is so unfriendly and has ZERO customer service skills. I once witnessed her buying "stuff" from a guy "very discreetly", or at least she thought so. I grew up in the 70's and know what it was. When you walk up to the front desk they have one person working, and more often than not they are also on their cell phone. Avoid this place if you can. Do yourself a favor and go to the one on Ina. I moved to this gym when it first opened, and now drive much further to avoid it. The only reason this gym has the rating it has is because the trainers offer a free session for a good review. BTW they want $1500 for a trading package. LOL

The gym has been down for ten days for renovations.  What has changed:
*new floors for easier cleaning
*carpet removed or trip hazard for reduced liability
*the area that was available for stretching is now restricted "for trainers only"
*the hot tub is "out of service"
"Why?" you might ask.  I have a theory...cost of doing business.  He gym is rated by income versus cost of doing business.  The hot tub is down because utility costs are too high.  Carpet was removed to reduce insurance liability costs.  The new floors can be swept during the day...no need for night crew vacuuming.  The "trainer only" area now reduces the liability footprint thus reducing the insurance liability.
Regarding the renovations nothing was done in the wet areas.  Showers need the grout cleaned, wood work could have at the least had a fresh coat of stain, sink areas could have been upgraded, and the peeling murals in the pool area could have been replaced.
Very impressed with the equipment here! On top of that, it is clean and the staff is very friendly!

These are my people! I've been coming to Eagle Fitness for a year and a half and you couldn't pay me to sign on with a big gym after working out here. A smaller gym means better child care (my sons get mad at me for not taking them on rest days), cleaner facility, friendlier staff, and regulars who become your good friends. I got signed up because of one of their specials, and I encourage all of my friends to do the same!

Great gym for the price. It is usually clean and most of the machines work. You never have to wait to get onto the cardio equipment. The free weight and stationary weight area are just the right size. Sometimes you have to wait for the weight machines though. The daycare center offers 2 hours of free child care, which is awesome! My daughter loves it there, and she has separation anxiety from me 99% of the time. The woman in the daycare is super sweet! I don't stress at all about leaving my daughter with her. My daughter also loves it there. My only gripe is that there is one person who works there that isn't very nice and has a poor work ethic. She is super sweet to all the guys that come in, but is on the verge of rude to the females. The gym is also dirtier when she is working. But, I'm not there to make friends so, it's not a deal breaker for me.

My credit card expired and I was issued a new one a few weeks later. When I received my new card I decided to cancel my account. I sent an e-mail to the company letting them know this e-mail serves as a letter of cancellation since I moved out of the state. The response I received back from the company was shocking and outright insulting. I told the company I never signed a contract as the gym membership was a month-to-month. 

My gym access card didn't grant me access to the gym but the company has still decided to charge me for no gym access and now is telling me that no gym access or not they will still be charging me for the next 3 months and will send me off to collections and there is nothing I can do about it. This company is disrespectful and unprofessional not to mention most of the equipment is outdated and broken. Eagles Fitness's managers response is below. I would not recommend this gym. 

#Start Quotation#
Jonathan,

You signed a month to month agreement with Eagle Fitness, in which it states you would provide a 30 day written notice to cancel (as long as the account is in good standing). Our accepted forms of the 30 day notice are in person or a letter by USPS mail and it doesn't matter if you moved you still need to come into the gym somehow to cancel. 

I find it unfortunate that you stated in your email that you understand our policy's but are refusing to follow them and will not respond to further correspondence from Eagle Fitness. Since I am not expecting an email back from you, we will send the account off to collections when it declines next month and will be 90 days delinquent in which we will get all the money from you that we believe that you owe us. 

If you would like to reconcile the account, call the club and update your information with them.


Best,

Raquel Rehman
Account Manager
#End Quotation#

Great location with open and plenty of parking! I walked in with my wife and was greeted exceptionally by Justin, who gave us a tour and answered all our questions. Gym is great with plenty of things to do definitely going to be working out here for a while.

I have belonged to this facility since it opened.  I love the location and the fact that they are now accessible 24 hours a day.  They do have some equipment which could be updated and there always seems to be something that is out of order.  That said, I am comfortable there - it seems the same people have been there as long as I have. Good value for what is offered.

I found every excuse not to go to the gym despite an inexpensive monthly rate and a whopping 3/4 mile trek up the road.  Casting pure laziness aside I finally went to Eagle Fitness yesterday with the thought of being the wimpy guy among a sea of meatheads, but to my surprise I was quite pleased.  What a relaxed, clean and no-pressure environment this was.  People of all ages, shapes and sizes so there was clearly no intimidation factor.  Don't get me wrong, I'm pretty confident yet I've been in places where Arnold, Hans and Franz all look at me wondering if I'm in the right place and not in a Zumba class.  Which reminds me; they have Zumba, kickboxing, yoga and other classes available here every day of the week.  Bonus!  My wife actually likes going here too for all the above reason and actually LOVES the kickboxing class!  That alone garners 5 stars!  There were plenty of machines to choose from, loads of treadmills, ellipticals and a rowing machine.  Don't worry, there are tons of free weights as well with well placed mirrors for the self-assured flexor.  Hey, come spot me!  Anyhow, this is a really nice gym in a convenient location where you can have your after workout cool-off at the coffee shop next door.  The price is right and the excuses are gone...

Hey...gotta run to the gym!  Later everyone!

Amazing gym facility and classes.  Friendly, welcoming, and clean.  However, their cancellation procedure is a tremendous headache!  I moved out of town in May and requested to cancel my membership.  I was told that I was on the hook for a full year from when I signed up.  Okay, six months left, whatever, I kind of get it.  They told me it would auto cancel per my request at the end of that period (the end of November).

Come December and I get billed again.  I call to inquire why I was billed when my membership should have been canceled, and I was out of state by this point.  I was told that my membership was never canceled, and that he would cancel it at that point, but that I would be billed one more time in January. What the fuck? Patiently waiting to see if I get billed again in February for some bullshit because this is absolutely ridiculous.  

I used to love this gym and recommended it to anybody and everybody.  After dealing with this nightmare of a cancellation process, or lack thereof, I will never set foot inside this place again nor will I recommend it to anyone.

I haven't had any issues with Eagle Fitness so far. At first I didn't feel like the front desk girls were very friendly but they are, just not in a fake "omg how are you?!" kind of way which I actually appreciate. I do feel like it needs one more squat rack but other than that the equipments nice and in good shape. But the reason I wanted to leave a review was because of their childcare. The lady that works in there is great with my son, even though he throws a huge fit when I leave to go workout, she seems to be good at calming him down and half of the time he likes to sit on her lap the entire time so he obviously feels comfortable with her. Childcare is a huge plus for me because without it I would rarely be able to go to the gym .

95% of the clients and 100% of the trainers have medical conditions!  

This has been my gym for over 10 years.  Everything was fine until the pandemic hit.  Only about 5% of the people going to the gym wear masks even though they are now required.  The front desk people wear the mask under their chins.  The trainers do not wear masks at all.  I asked the front desk person why they were not following the mask requirements and she told me that people with medical conditions were not required to wear them.  I told her I was not comfortable going to this gym because they are so cavalier about the rona and asked if I could get a prorated refund on my membership.  She said 'nope.'  

Too bad they are so irresponsible about peoples' health and fitness

I joined this gym earlier last month and I am really enjoying it so far! 

Only minor downside is that it is pretty busy for such a small space. Even their bathrooms are tiny. However, I really do enjoy coming here. They keep the place clean and they seem to have figured out how to squeeze in a good variety of machines for such a limited space. It's close to my home, with a good amount of parking. I would recommend this place to others looking to get a good exercise in!

I've been a member with this gym since they first opened their NW Reno location (roughly 7 years) and offered me a great monthly membership at only $17 a month . A few years later I moved to sparks and to my luck there was a sparks location and stayed with the gym even through  their location change right up the street on Los Altos. Btw the newer location is beautiful with more space. 

My frustration came when I had a personal trainer at the Los Altos location who would come and interrupt my workouts attempting to show me the "right way" to lift weights and other nonsense causing annoyance and distraction to my workout sessions. I got fed up with it when it happened for the third time. I have quit this gym and joined anytime fitness. 

Pros: clean facility , for the most part a friendly staff , a decent amount of workout classes you can choose from. An affordable monthly membership with a good amount of equipment. 

Cons: gym is frequently busy , In the mornings after 9 it's frequented by a large amount of elderly people which they often socialize in groups blocking machines. And again the trainers there are friendly and will leave you alone except for one in particular.

My husband and I love this gym! Everyone is very friendly. I recently started bringing my 5 month old to the daycare they have and Patty was very sweet! She made me feel like my baby was safe and she would get me if anything happened. It is so nice not having to have a family member or friend come over to watch my daughter when I want to go workout. This gym has it all!

Great place to get in a wonderful workout! 
The space is clean and no one bothers you while you workout, there isn't a pitchy sales scheme to this club. 
The locker rooms are very nice, I like the amenities they provide.

Great facility. Clean, streamline and functional. I have only been in the early morning so I can't say anything about the crowd yet. Will update accordingly.  Morning classes are invigorating and heart pumping, great workout!

Reno facility is a dump. Super small and they close down a whole room with an extra squat rack when they are training one person. The bathrooms are disgusting and locks don't work. 

The sparks location is bigger and cleaner, although they do not have enough squat racks and it gets busy to the point where you have to sit in the corner and pray that one thing opens up for you. They never answer my calls and it drops/hangs up. I have pretty severe asthma and so working out in a mask can be life threatening for me, so I was trying to get in contact to ask about a way we can go about that. I was not able to get in contact due to the reason listed above. 

Employees are nice and respectful, but the people at the gyms socialize too much and block equipment. Lots of parking at both locations. All in all if the UNR gym still weren't being the same old money hungry idiots they usually are I wouldn't pay for a membership here.

Again I'm writing because now I receive phone calls daily leaving automated voicemail asking for new credit card information!! I no longer am a member. Nor would I want to be because of prior review! Who runs these places?? Better business bureau needs to be contacted apparently. Awful business

I appreciate this gym. Small yet friendly...love yoga led by Sandy and Gia. They know about the importance of focusing on breath as a huge benefit and they hold focus on the moment.
After years of exposure to some of the best Zumba instructors, I finally discovered a sub here called Sylvia. Wow!!
She adheres to the principles taught by 'Beto, the founder of the international Zumba corporation. One key principle is that the choreo remain 70 percent Latin dance:)! YES!
My feeling of being disrespected  has now been resolved. I thank the beautiful girl at the front desk and Raquel for kindly handling this issue in a polite and genuine manner

Yay! I'm so happy that I get to update my review! I went on a 18 month leave from the gym (got busy starting my own business, had a baby, etc). All not great excuses to stop going but I'm back now. And, now I feel like I need to update my review since it has been 2 years. The girl I was talking about in my last review hasn't been there since I started working out about a month ago. Well, I should say, she doesn't work mornings. The girls at the daycare are still there and they are great with both of my girls. I thought it would be a fight to leave them there, but they love it! Now I can happily give Eagle Fitness 5 stars!

We are visiting from Colorado. My husband spent $40 to use this gym(Sparks location) for two weeks. His card they gave hasn't worked for a few days. He brought it to their attention yesterday and they didn't care that he missed out on some days we paid for. He tried again this morning and couldn't get in again! Don't bother with this place. Especially the $20 for a week. They don't give you the proper amount of days on this pass nor will they fix it.

You join a gym and acquire a trainer. Whether you use a personal trainer that works directly with the gym or as a private contractor ( while working in gym facility) they should be forthcoming! If you pay for services that are not able to be met Example: trainer is ill, days can't align
As a client you should not have to beg to be reimbursed, let alone completely ignored!!! Bad business!!!!

As long as Shareen is there I will not recommend anyone to go there. I recently found out a camp was opened in Clearwater so I immediately told my friends and family about it. My brother called the camp and he had such a horrible experience. He called asking about the 20lb 6 week challenge and spoke with Shareen. She immediately asked how much he weighs and was so rude about it. She was annoyed by his questions and kept telling him to come into orientation and everything will be explained there. He is 5'11" and 280lbs (Large built police officer). She said that he doesn't qualify for that promo and he needs to do 4 challenges (lose 80lbs) to see a transformation because 20lbs is nothing in his case. And then If he lost 80lbs with them then he can get his money back. A majority of the people come to the camp because they are over weight. Putting them down and making them feel that unless they lose 80lbs that it's not a transformation and how 20lbs is nothing compared to 280lbs is not how you gain loyal clients or even a new client. I'm sorry but that is very misleading and not how other camps work. She proceeded to say how it's just a marketing scheme to get people to become members (who says that?!). It hurts me that they would say that to my own brother when I'm here trying to get everyone I know healthy and introducing them to this gym. I called myself and Shareen answered; she was very pushy and rude. I called myself to get some basic info to see how she really was and turns out she's worse then he described. I'm a member at the camp on the west coast and have referred a lot of people that purchased memberships and completed challenges. At that location everyone is friendly and sensitive when it comes to someone's weight. Sadly, I re-told all my family and friends not to go there bc I don't appreciate how they treat people and don't want anymore of them getting disrespected and put down. A few of them found a similar program at a cross fit and are happy and comfortable there. Idk if Sam (the CEO) knows how badly this location is being run and ruining the reputation of the camp but I sure will bring it to his attention.

Pleas note: this review is on a Shirene and that I fully support The Camp Transformation Center and liked it very much when it was under its last ownership.

The first time I came here I was very happy with this location. The prior owner treated me very well even though I did not make my challenge weight. She agreed to take the amount of pounds that I lost multiplied by $10 and roll that into a monthly membership. 

But when I came back in to utilize my credit on account, I told the new manager, "I have one month of credit on account here that I would like to use up." First words out of her mouth were, "That's not how we do things here, let's go to my office." 

It was obvious that it was under new ownership. Shirene was unbelievably rude when I was trying to explain to her what I was offered. She could not wait to jump at the chance to cut me off to say that I was wrong and proceed to explain that this wasn't the way things are done. 

I could barely complete a sentence with out Shirene cutting me off to say why what I was saying was incorrect. I was so pissed that she never even let me finish speaking!

She tried to make me pay for an entire year to in order to acquire my credit. There are VERY few places that I've stormed out of, but this one is on my list. 

I even stopped a moment while I was leaving to tell her that if the prior OWNER of this establishment has offered a customer (ME) something, that she should AT THE VERY LEAST be willing to listen to what was offered. 

Shirene should be demoted until she's been retrained in customer service.

I came here with a friend and had a great experience. We went on a Monday which is arm day and moved from station to station doing different arm exercises. In between stations we did ab exercises which was great. The two staff members I met looked fit, turns out they both had completed the program they deliver. The front desk girl lost 100 pounds and our trainer lost 60. I find that impressive and encouraging. I think best of all is the gym it'self is not intimidating and I personally find group fitness better than just going to a gym and not knowing what to do.  Grateful to have this in Clearwater.

I was drawn to the Camp Transformation Center due to the success I'd seen others have here. I needed something to jump-start my weight loss, and this was the right place to do that. The director of the camp, Shirene, is very sincere about her desire to help you succeed. She takes the time to talk with you and encourage you. The workouts are very challenging, and at first, I was very overwhelmed by the new moves and the quick pace of the workouts. But, every trainer takes the time to explain and correct form. The trainers are encouraging, helpful and give modifications if you're not able to do a move. By the end of the six-week challenge, I'd lost 20 pounds and gained strength and confidence. I'd highly recommend the Camp Transformation Center to anyone looking to lose weight, get fit and have fun working out.

I absolutely love the Camp Transformation Center. I just completed my first week and I I'm down 4 lbs already! I can already tell a difference  with my clothes and the pain from the workouts are getting easier to handle. Love the team and the energy they bring to each class. Great group here in Clearwater and I'm so thankful I made this decision.

Another bada** workout at the Camp. The kind where you kind of might wanna puke at the end of it but you're so glad you didn't so proud you lasted on that plank. The best coaches only here, so encouraging throughout the work out

I have literally tried everything and this place is the ONLY place that actually changed my mindset about food, lifestyle & exercise. Shirene is amazing because when you need to change your life you can't be babied; she and the entire team of trainers and front desk staff put 100% into making sure everyone who joined the six week challenge got results. They educated us on how to eat, what to eat and when to eat. They pushed us in our workouts every day and if we didn't show up, they called us and made sure we stayed on track even when life got hectic as it always will! They celebrated us each week as we lost more and more weight and inches and encouraged us throughout the way, because most of the staff are previous challengers! so they know first hand what we were going through. I just finished the six weeks and I lost 17.6 pounds!!! I lost a LOT of inches even better. I gained control of my eating and I love the energy, self-confidence and self-love they've given me and I've worked for. I can honestly say this place changed my life. The people, the other challengers, the members, the staff, the coaches, shirene- you guys are the REAL DEAL!
Awesome work outs! Super support!!!! Highly recommend this place for a killer workout!

I've taken a lot of spin classes over the years, and nothing compares to the classes at Body Cycle. From the nice, clean space and amazing bikes, to the welcoming and motivating instructors, every class is a top notch work out.

For anyone who struggles to fit workouts in, the online scheduling system makes it easy to plan ahead (and there's no need to line up way in advanced like many gyms make you do).

There is no way I can write this review without giving Russell, the owner of Body Cycle, a shout out. Russell's passion for fitness and cycling is so evident, as is his desire for all of his clients to succeed. He is always dropping in to classes to check in/provide encouragement, and is open to ideas and recommendations from anyone. Russell always wears a smile on his face, even when he's kicking your butt in class!
Love this Place! The instructors actually care about their clients. Great Customer Service!

I simply love Body Cycle Studio.  My body may not agree (especially at 8:30am) but I figure it'll appreciate my efforts when it's toned and fit.

The instructors are all friendly and supportive.  If you're really looking for a sweaty workout, try Shoshanna's (if you can reserve a spot... she's very popular!). She's full of energy and always has a playlist I'm dying to steal.  Even amateurs can jump right in since the workouts can be adapted to any level.

The owner, Russell Carter, is amazing and should win an award for customer service.  When he's teaching a class, you know he's working out just as hard as you are!  He's also constantly stopping by to make sure that everyone's bikes are properly adjusted.  He genuinely seems to care about everyone's welfare and pushes you hard but never beyond your own limits. 

First class is free so there's no excuse not to get off your butt and get on a bike!

Love BCS! Signing up for classes on their website was easy. The front desk staff was friendly and energetic. The instructor was very nice and helped everyone get their bike adjusted appropriately before the class. Great workout. Definitely felt the burn.

OMG - GO HERE.  I've taken spinning classes at a number of places, both in the city and elsewhere.  I've never been anywhere as amazing as Body Cycle.  Here's what you WON'T see:  broken bikes, out of towels, classes cancelled at the last minute, instructors getting subs you don't like at the last minute, stupid rules about how to sign up for a class, instructors half assing a class, or any kind of mess.  If the owner's goal was to find the very best instructors in the city and bring them all to one place, he has succeeded.  I love Monica, Rebecca, Russell, Barry and Erik, but I have no doubt the other instructors are crazy good as well.  These classes are well planned, and they are no joke.  The bikes are amazing.  The space is beautiful.  There isn't just a water cooler, but one that lets you choose the temperature of your water.  This place is nicer than my home.  And I feel as welcome here as I do in my home.  The instructors are always friendly and welcoming, and always helping people set up their bikes if they're new to the studio.  The patrons are lovely as well.  No weird cliques, no one judging you or making you feel out of place.  You sign up for your classes on line, and can do so up to two weeks in advance.  They have an app so you can accomplish this right on your phone.  The more classes you buy at once, the lower the price.  Also, your first ride is free, so check it out.  I have zero doubt you'll be glad you did.

This spinning studio is amazing! I have attended their spin classes regularly since January and still love every class that i go to!

As mentioned in other reviews of the studio, the facility is amazing... Kept immaculately clean and with a great ambiance, you can't help but fall in love with the vibe of the studio. On top of the amazing location, wonderful decoration, and the best spin bikes ever (they have magnetic traction with an awesome screen that helps you track your RPM as well as resistance) the instructors at this studio are wonderful.

I have taken other spin classes and never fallen in love with the workout until I started at body cycle. The instructors (especially the awesome owner, Russel Carter) take time to learn the names of the students and really provide a personal experience that pushes you to your limit at every workout.

I have brought many of my friends with me to the studio because I honestly cannot rave about it enough... My family even visited from out of town last week and I included one of Russel's spin classes as part of their Philly tour!

Love this place!!!

While Body Cycle may not have the pizazz of FlyWheel, I'm a traditionalist and prefer the style here. The staff and instructor made me feel welcome and showed me the proper way to setup my bike to fit my body. The studio was clean and bright and I will definitely be back! Shoutout to Ross for a great class; I burned over 550 calories!

This studio is beyond awesome. The staff are really nice and welcoming. The place is clean and provides towels upon check-in. 
You can sign-up for classes on-line and there are plenty of classes at reasonable times. 

If you are new or wanting to try cycling, the instructors are great in making sure proper bike setup and safety.  The classes are fun and challenging. You want that push and these classes provide that result.

Give this place a try and remember why you went to try out and that is to work hard.
Saturday A.M. 90 minute ride was a great way to start the day! They have cubbies, no locks, one shower, you can refill your water bottle during class.

I am in town from Denver and looked on Yelp for a spinning class with a shower and found this gem! Super friendly staff who helped me snag the last seat in a full class. Russell was the instructor and he was fantastic. I really liked that the resistance and revs were numerically monitored so I could always be sure I was at the right pace and resistance, and this couldn't slack off the way one could in other kinds of spinning classes where resistance and pace is more relative and self-measured.
Been spinning for over 3 years here! Such a great, fun workout. Each instructor has their own take on a workout, and I have enjoyed all classes I have taken! Shosh is my fav instructor!

I'm in love. This is a great fitness studio, everything is always clean and working properly. I've been a client on and off  for the last few years, and they have made great changes recently to make the studio even better than it was.

Solid little spinning studio in center city Philly.

Highlights:
First class is free. And subsequent classes are not expensive, as far as spinning studios go. 
Instructors are very supportive and go out of their way to help newbies. 
The class I took with Russell was a very tradition spin class...no weights or crazy dance moves on the bike...and it was solid. He comes out into the crowd to ride on empty bikes next to class participants which is super cool. 
Good music. I know some people mention in their reviews that it's loud but I found it actually quieter than I'm used to. 
Sign up, reservation, and check-in process was super easy

What to know:
This studio is not dark. This was strange for me and I realize now I prefer spinning in a dark studio. If you want closer to dark, sit in the back row along the back wall of the studio and not under the skylight or by the windows. 
The spin bikes are ones I've used with a trainer but not in a studio before. They were fine but there's not a summary at the end of the ride of your watts/MPH which I'm used to seeing right on the console. 
There's one bathroom with one shower. Plan to shower elsewhere. 

Overall, I really liked my class at Body Cycle. When I'm in Philly on business again, it'll definitely be my go to.

Wow what a workout. I had Maria but it was her last class, so I can't speak for the rest of the instructors, but she was great. It was my first free intro class, and it did not disappoint. I also loved the bikes since they show RPM and you can really push yourself versus the standard bikes. The place is a little hard to find and is on a second floor of a row home. It's quite pricey, so I don't think I would get a full membership since I like having variety of classes to pick from, but for any spinning enthusiasts this is a great gym!

I really loved the energy during my first class here last week. It was a 60 minute ride. The instructors were on their A game. The music was perfect. And being that it was my first ride, it was free (YAY!). Everyone was super friendly and helpful, and now I can tell with Shoshana's classes always book up so quickly. She rocks.

I use body cycle as part of my ClassPass.

This place is good for the beginner to mid-level spinners. 

However, if you are trying to get a hard workout in, I'd suggest Flywheel.

The instructors and staff are friendly and helpful especially when you first start out.

The equipment at BC is a bit dated as well as the sound system. I'm a spinner that really gets going based on the bass.

Great location, great classes!  Robby is my favorite and he is going to be one of the celebrity instructors for the huge indoor spinning event happening this fall called SPINTENSITY 200. Check out the commercial:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_nt79LEaIAM&feature=youtu.be

Love...LOVE Body Cycle.  Best spin classes, hands down.  I've been going to Body Cycle for at least once a week for about a year and I don't intend to stop any time soon.  The teachers make you feel really comfortable and want to make sure you're getting the best experience possible (plus they will actually get to know your name...totally unbelievable if you've ever been to other gyms around the city).

The classes are really kick-ass and you feel like you're about to pass out after, in a good way.  I normally go to Shoshanna or Jess, and they are both AMAZING. Sign up early or you won't get a spot. Best music playlists that are constantly changing (so you won't get bored).  It's not an intimidating environment either, and the instructors will always take the time to show new-comers the right way to position your bike and more.  

First ride free for newbies, and it will be awesome!

I took my first spin class last Saturday (the first is FREE!), and have fallen in love. I have never sweat so much in my life. I felt great afterwards. The instructor (I believe it was Jessica) was very sweet and motivating. She helped my friend and I adjust our bikes before class started, and really helped me push myself. I'm going to start going twice a week, it was AWESOME

Another 5-star review, another drop in the 5-star bucket for Body Cycle. It's not easy finding a cycling studio with a fun vibe, good energy, perfect music, and psychopa...I mean, intensely passionate instructors. Shoshana, Russell, Jesse, Jessica, to just name the few I frequented, are the crème de la crème, baby.

Not to mention, compared to most other cycling studios, you get major bang for your buck, especially if you buy classes in bulk, or get in on the various deals they have throughout the year. 

Also, your first class is free, which is totally sweet. Stop pinching your muffin top and check these guys out already!

First I'll say that I definitely get a good work out here.  I just moved into center city from the suburbs and I've regularly attended spin classes 4-5 days a week for the past year.  I didn't want to join a gym right away down here with the nice weather approaching so when I heard about this place I thought it would be perfect.
The room is very small for the amount of bikes, so you are kind of on top of each other, which kind of grosses me out when everyone is sweating profusely and breathing heavily.  The bikes are also very different than any other spin bike I've ever seen.  This isn't a bad thing.  I do like the power meter on there, because usually I'm just guessing at my speed and resistance level.  
The online reservation system is nice too, but I've had a hard time getting a spot in a lot of the classes even signing up a week in advance.  I guess that's a testament to how well this place is doing, but its a little frustrating.  
All in all, I think its a great class, just wish the studio was bigger and there were more classes available.

Amazing place. Business is run with customer in mind - I once got sick and had to cancel less than 24-hours, they honored that given my condition. They could have been difficult about it, but this place actually cares about customers as individuals, and not a source of profit. Very clean, amazing instructors.

I went to my "first ride free" about a month ago, and it was all it took for me to become hooked! The bikes are smooth, the instructors are dedicated, the music is diverse and the atmosphere is electric yet comfortable. I love this place! The student pricing is also very reasonable.

(to the tune of T. Swift's classic, "22")

It feels like the perfect place to don some leggings
and destroy our hamstrings (uh uh, uh uh)
It feels like the perfect place to wake up with the sun
and to get our spin on (uh uh, uh uh)

Yeah.... we're sweaty, drenched, and energized at the same time 
It's miserable and magical
oh yeah.... BodyCycle's the place where we forget about the outside
It's time

Uh oh.
I don't know about you
But I'm feeling sweaty, WOO
Everything will be alright 
If you just stay on your bike! 
You don't know about me
And isn't that the best thing
Everything will be alright 
If we just stay on our bikes getting
Sweaty WOO (ooh ooh)
Sweaty WOO! (ooh ooh)

So, I'll go ahead and say that this is NOT my number one favorite spin studio, but it is a fairly close second. Super convenient location (for me), love their generosity with the towels, and the space is pretty fantastic. Sometimes during the daytime hours (read: suns out, guns out) the lighting is a little brighter than is ideal for my "perfect" spin class (I love a dark studio, music bumping). They've got a skylight that allows a lotta natural light (but hey, some folks are into that!) ClassPass gives me three classes a month, and while I rarely use them all, I feel super lucky that I've got em! Lots of class times, and hype instructors.

ive been to many good spin classes but unfortunately ive been to many bad bad boring classes which just feel like a waste of time.  the two classes here so far have been great; i love this studio!  the instructors are fun and offer a great (difficult and heart-pounding/but not deathly) workout! what i really like about this studio: 

1. the bikes here are so new and nice!!! the bikes are so smooth and i love that all bikes have individual screens to track your exact gear (no more big knob in the middle) and how fast youre going. the time on the screen also gives you a sense of when you can start counting down to the end of the class when you are dying :D

2. its a very nice, clean studio.  its super close to my apartment and right by a cvs if you need a lot of water very very immediately. 

3. online registration ensures you get a spot in the class! such a wonderful/time efficient system!

4. the towels also smell slighly sweet, which i like. nothing offensive or too strong, but a very subtle smell :)

it would be nice if they had a water fountain and turned up the music a little louder (perhaps the instructors can use mikes?).  all in all, i definitely recommend this studio for anyone interested in spin classes. the first class is free! and all the other classes are reasonable, especially for students!

On the instructors: I have become addicted to spinning because of this studio. Seriously.  Russ, the owner, teaches great classes... worth waking up for the 8:30am class, because he remembers your name, calls you out (nicely), and pushes you to your specific limits and beyond.   Shoshana/Jess/Kim are also awesome.  I've taken classes from almost all the instructors due to schedule reasons and everyone is super professional and nice (or nice in the kick your butt with love kind of way).

On the activity: Spinning is the best way to do cardio in an intense, compact 45 minutes... the peer pressure and the exhortation of your instructor ensures that you will keep pushing even when your body feels terrible.  It really is the best high!

Great workout. I always leave feeling refreshed and energized. I haven't been there since I heard that they renovated the place and made it bigger. I love the music and how the instructor always pushes up to our limits. I feel like I'm at the club dancing, but working out :)

I was in Philly for Thanksgiving and needed to hit a workout on Friday AM - Found Body Cycle and the first class was free. I wasn't wild about them not giving out shoes but I guess that's the spolied New Yorker in me. This kinda then set me up to think the class was gonna be lame. 

I was wrong - completely wrong. 

Jess taught class - she was on point as was her music. It's an interesting set up and the studio is also not completely dark (again another spolied NY thing, I guess?!). Jess' energy was great and kept you engaged the entire class - esp when you need that push. The music is LOUD and runs through you. It's amazing. 

This was my first time using a Keiser bike but I liked that it still had the little screen giving you the RMP's/Distance and Gear. 

Overall a great class and I shouldn't have judged a book by it's cover!
Great studio, very friendly and helpful staff. I'm an avid cyclist and have been to a few studios. These folks definitely know how to run a class. Thanks again

I just started coming here a couple of weeks ago, and it has been so easy to get to know people and feel like part of the community.  I have only taken Russell's class, and I think he is a fantastic instructor who really keeps the class energized.  One of the best spin studios I have been to.

Body cycle studio rocks my work out world! I've been going here for about 2 years, ever since the studio opened. The instructors and staff are beyond amazing and really make the experience stand out. They're helpful with your bike set-up, friendly and genuinely care about you. Within only a few classes, each of the instructors that I have taken with remembered my name, which definitely gives the studio more of a "family" feel and makes me motivated to go back. The instructors I've had have absolutely rocked. If you are into newer music and instructors that change the exercise depending on the song then Shoshanna, Jess and Russel are the ones for you. I've also taken with Kevin and Barry and enjoyed their classes as well. They both seem to teach based on longer intervals throughout the 45-60 min class -- I found those classes a little less intense, but great if you aren't looking for a crazy cardio workout. I'm so glad they added this little gem to center city. I will continue to go as long as I'm living in the area!

They popped my cherry on spinning and I am hooked.  It is a great workout.  I always leave wondering if I can make it down the stairs without tumbling.  
All the instructors are great and each unique in their music and workouts.  The studio is clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful!  Would 100% recommend body cycle!

This place is awesome! A friend dragged me here after spotting an event on facebook called B cubed (B^3) = Bikes.Bootcamp.Brunch. 

For $25 you got a 30 minute spin session (courtesy of Russell who is also the owner and is fantastic!), a run to the art museum (which I skipped and drove to the art museum cause I parked on the street, oh, and I also hate running!). Then a 30 minute boot camp session on the steps of the art museum which was a collabration with Fit Academy owner/trainer Osayi Osunde (which was brutal). Followed by a free bloody Mary or mimosa at Urban Spoon.

Best $25 bucks I have ever spent. Russell is great, personable and encouraging. He helped get me set up on my bike. His staff (Erin) was great too. 

The space is clean and organized. This business should definitely be supported.
It's all about Russell's class for me. He's the best! So high energy, and the best playlist. I also enjoy the diversity in the age and fitness level of the clientele.

I have tried spin at a number of places in the city and this is one of the finest places I have been.  The bikes were a little unusual but easy to adjust and actually easier than most to use. The staff was warm and friendly. The teacher was excellent, and her music (unlike most places) was not too loud or too offensive.  The price is competitive, but you can do one class for free. I was lucky to get a bike where I could see in a mirror (I love to watch my form), but there were a lot of bikes that did not have mirrors nearby.  There is a bathroom with a shower but I am not sure the shower is for spinners as opposed to employees.  They give you towels and have water for purchase at the usual way-too-high-how-does-water-cost-this-much price.

I have been coming here for 5 months and loooove it! I've even invested in cycling shoes to clip into the bikes. I prefer spinning bc I don't like the impact running has on my knees.

I attend Jess Sullivan's class and seriously break a sweat and feel the burn in my legs. Literally the sweat is dripping into my eyes! I love the energy and music in her class. If u like hip hop and rap...
Go to Jess's class. She's  great at motivating the class and keep us going even when we want to quit. 

I've done bikram, in door rowing, running, hot yoga, cardio kick boxing, etc..... But something abt body cycle keeps me coming!  

The staff is very helpful here and they ask u to ask them questions ! What an awesome crew!

If ur a newbie, I suggest taking Soshanna's free intro wkend class to learn the positions and how to adjust ur bike. It's 20 mins and well worth it. 

I love BCS!!!

Another 5-star review! This place rocks! All the instructors are great. I've been to about six classes now and every instructor is awesome in a different way (Chris, Russell, Shoshanna, Tiffany). They are helpful and will help you set up your bike if you are new.

They have a student deal which is 13 dollars a class or about 100 dollars for 10 classes. First class is free!

The idea of riding a bicycle in place with bunch of other sweaty people had never appealed to me as my choice of exercise. But I saw a deal on LivingSocial and bought it on impulse. I procrastinated to use it for a month or two but I few days ago I finally dragged my lazy butt across the street (great location: between 19th and 20th street on Chestnut) and checked it out. 
First one was with Sara- loved her choice of music she was energetic, fun - next thing I knew I was peddling like my life depended on it. My second class this morning was with Russell and this was the REAL DEAL. Music, lighting, changes in speed and rhythm everything was prefect - if there is such thing as perfect spin session haha it sounds bizarre but I highly recommend it because I know I'm going back.

Russell Carter is the best spinning instructor I've ever had -- his music, energy, and rides are just amazing. So glad he has opened up this new studio which has state of the art bikes and lots of great instructors. Check it out!

First spinning class ever today on a whim. Best workout I have had in a long, long time. I am hooked. Couldn't have gotten a better instructor than Kerry. Positive, motivating and very helpful! Thanks for making my first time a positive experience, I will be back!

Jess is just the best.  All the teachers are absolutely stellar, but she is my favorite.  She is just so sweet and nice and energetic.  And also very inspiring.  I seriously don't know how she gets around to have a personal interaction with everyone--and still manages to teach a great class.

She was even gracious when several of the students were (quite literally) WAIVING their water bottles at her!  That takes composure and grace.  And, PS, management should stop indulging this kind of silliness and self indulgence in the overpriveleged students.  Nice is nice--but get your own damn water--and plenty of it at the beginning of class.  You don't wave from your bike to get them to come and fill your bottle.  It's obnoxious.  And yet they all handle it with grace.  But I digress from the Awesomeness of this place.

For starters:  I have never met a more gracious and helpful front desk staff.  They not only go out of their way to make me feel welcome and special each and every time I'm there, but they are actually sincere about it.  This is a very special culture indeed.  You don't get that kind of genuine interest from employees and staff--unless they are being well taken care of.  In any case, give these ladies a raise (nope, they did not pay me to write that, lol)

They then usher you into the studio--nice facility--simple--all you need, really and the teachers are all really helpful about getting you set up on your bike--Jess even says "even if you've been here before" so that you don't feel weird about asking if you forgot.

Now to the workout itself:  A quick, fast, sweaty, pretty diffilcult jaunt--it's all in how hard you push yourself, but the instruction is energized and varied, and the music is on point.

My only constructive feedback is that the facilities for after could be improved.  It would be great if they had showers and didn't share bathrooms with Barre.  I may be a bit spoiled by that other Cycle studio's shower area, though, admittedly.

I will be back again and again--I try to go weekly.

Friendliest Excercise studio in town by far, and not an ounce of pretense or snobbery.

Did I mention all the instructors are pretty to look at as well?  But not in a way that makes you feel bad about yourself:)

I have actually been delaying writing this review because I love the place so much I don't want it to get overcrowded. But one must give props where props are due. And this place ROCKS.

All of the instructors are great at their jobs -- and genuinely nice people. The studio is sparkling clean (a tough job when you have 30 sweaty people rolling through every hour or so) and the scheduling process is super-efficient.
