Highly recommend -- just make sure if you go you leave a bike for me!

I was ready to give up on spinning because I had tried a class at a Philly gym and at another spinning studio...and hated it (no air, horribly loud music, monotonous 'routine' overly focused on speed, disengaged instructors) But thank you Body Cycle for turning me around! The studio vibe is great - friendly, approachable, and serious hard work + sweat. The workouts are solid and the instructors do a nice job with giving you as much variety as you can have in a spin class. And their energy & personality has been perfect. Motivating without being annoying :) You can see them constantly scan the room and watching to see if people need help, a good-form reminder or just checking in on your energy level. I like that they have room to get off the bike and walk around a little bit too. It keeps your attention. And I like that the studio is kinda dark but not totally pitch black like other places, and BC does a MUCH better job keeping air circulating. You get seriously sweaty, but you can still feel fans & AC so you don't pass out. Yay.

I've heard good things about this studio over the years and I can see why!

I started spinning only a few years ago when I joined Unite Fitness, and quickly fell in love with it. But I hadn't ever been to an exclusively spinning studio before until one of the trainers, Juliet, invited to me try out one of her classes at Body Cycle. The second floor studio is small, but the quality is what counts - and what you'll feel after your workout! The bikes they have are great, and I really loved Juliet's class, her music is always great at Unite and her playlist for spinning is no exception. I would also prefer having more mirrors to check on form, but otherwise this is a great studio. Once I can afford several gym memberships, I'll definitely be joining Body Cycle!

I discovered Body Cycle via ClassPass and, I must admit, I love it wayyy more than FlyWheel. The instructors are extremely motivating and I find myself working harder at these classes due to the energetic instructors. Only reason I am giving it four stars is because there is only one shower. Other than that, no complaints.

In comparison with other spin studios in the area, body cycle is definitely my favorite. The playlists are always great, the instructors are always motivational, and they have free hair bands in the bathroom! The classes are always difficult and as Aria S. mentioned, it sucks that your 90lb neighbor can see your resistance level. But regardless, you can always modify to your own level, just try and push yourself to your highest potential.

Body Cycle continues to be the best spinning facility in Philadelphia.   Thank you owner Russell Carter for adding a second spin class to your schedule on Saturdays!  Thanks to Russell and Shoshana, the studio has created a warm, happy, welcoming community where all spinners feel individually appreciated and cared for and everyone - teachers and spinners alike, deliver their very best.

While I've lived next door to Body Cycle Spinning for 5 years, I only recently built up the courage to try a class. I love it! I took an intro 15 minute class to learn how to set up the bike and the different positions, it was helpful and motivating enough for me to come back. 

The first class was hard, the next 10 were still hard, and then I signed up for the Love Yourself Challenge. I went pretty often and had a great experience. This class is still hard but I've learned to love it and I typically burn at least 450 calories per session, so I can't complain. Happy to have this next to my apartment!

Can't say enough great things about this place! Russell and the other instructors are so helpful. I can't tell you how nice it is to be in a clean studio with bikes that are well maintained! And being able to sign up for classes ahead of time and the iPhone app is great! Thank you, Body Cycle!

I see that I'm the minority here...but I'll still write my review! I bought a 20 class package here after just finishing a group of classes at flywheel. In my mind, they aren't even in the same league. The instructors at body cycle are been subpar, at my class today the instructor simply yelled "position 3. Position 2. Sit. Pedal hard" I'm not even kidding. And the music? If I was closer to the door I would have left, it was so loud It was literally hurting my ears and it was hardcore rap the entire time! It's a different kind of bike than I'm used to also and seems to be hurting my back. What I miss most about flywheel is their ability to track your progress so you can see how your doing, and reserve a certain bike. I've not given upon body cycle yet (I have 16 classes left...) but I'm pretty disappointed so  far :(

It all started with a text from my sister asking me if I wanted to accompany her to a spin class. "It's free for first timers.."= SOLD. But hours after the Tabata Spin Class with Carly, I realize I would've paid the regular full price for my experience in a heartbeat.
When I tell you that this was one of the most positive experiences I have had in any sort of fitness class, I am not exaggerating. Carly was happy to help my new-to-cycling sister and I in adjusting our bikes, and explaining all of the terminology she would be using during her class. She was particularly mindful of my injuries (lumbar back spasm and degeneration of left knee cartilage) as she adjusted me into my bike, and reminded me to not forget that this was "my ride" and to listen to my body, above all. The next 30 minutes was a blur of sweat, music, encouragement, challenge, and accomplishment. It was HARD, and I certainly burned some fat (that was the whole point for me!!), but I was UNINJURED, thanks to Carly's sensitivity. She repeatedly dismounted from her bike to make sure I was okay without making me feel like a leper or an invalid. I got the workout I wanted and needed so desperately, without the injury I feared.
Post class, I was delighted that Carly and the owner (I can't remember his name, but he was so sweet!) stayed and chatted with my sister and I. Carly gave me some tips on strengthening my core to help buffer the pain I experience in my back. The owner was happy to answer the million and one questions my sister and I had for him regarding spinning and the studio, and seemed genuinely delighted that we had such a wonderful experience.
There is not a single doubt in my mind: I WILL be back!!!!

A great workout! First class is free. I left struggling to walk, don't worry I made it home. There were plenty of bikes, the class wasn't crowded. The instructor was good. Riding a bike non-stop for an hour can be gruesome and you may go numb from the waist down but after a few sessions your legs will look amazing!

I absolutely LOVE body cycle. The studio is clean and well kept without being too stuffy or frilly. The instructors are super knowledgeable and clearly spend a lot curating the workouts and playlists. Russell and Sho are fantastic and so passionate about the studio and clients. They also do a great job establishing relationships with local vendors like Sip N Glo. Classes are well priced, especially for Philly and there are lots of pre/post work classes as well as options for an afternoon sweat sesh. I highly recommend giving it a try!

i hated it in the best way! i have taken spinning classes in the past and it was never my favorite thing to do. i took a class taught by russel this morning and i left feeling like my former athlete self. my first time there, russel took the time to set me up on my bike. he was super nice and i felt instantly comfortable. i thought that i would struggle since its been years since ive done spinning, but i kept up like nobodies business! i felt like a beast! russel did mention he took it easy on us. uuuummmm, that was easy??? i am scared to find out what a more difficult class is like. the studio is very nice, music was great, and the class went by quick. my legs were like jello on the way out. i feel like a million bucks.

I can't get enough of Russ and his team!! I honestly love every instructor I've had and hope to take them all at least once! I am back writing a second review because this morning's class took me to another level!  I had a 8:15am class with Emily Benton and she was amazing! Loved her playlist, energy and teaching style. The class had me challenge myself beyond measure both physically and mentally. Something I needed...

I've been to the studio several times for the past few years and highly recommend it to everyone. Awesome atmosphere, friendly staff, great workout!!

As a first timer to the whole indoor cycle workout, I was skeptical that I couldn't get a decent workout from cycling. I was poorly mistaken and am now addicted to taking classes here. The instructors are great (I've been to 4 so far) and the music gets you pumped up. From what others say the bikes are way nicer than other places and the studio is cute, clean and has all the essentials (water, towels bathroom). Best of all, you get a killer workout that makes me crawl home every time :) Highly recommend it!!

New to Body Cycle and spinning. I could not have chosen a better place. I really enjoy Reem's class and keep coming back! I love when the instructors are so encouraging, it really makes you push and there is a lot of great energy. Everyone is very friendly and the vibe of the studio is very non-intimidating. Overall very happy I chose to check this place out.
Friendly instructors that are super helpful. Always clean and a great workout- Tiffanys classes are awesome. Good music and good motivation!

Yes. I'm definintely a fan!

Before trying it today, I was sure I was going to come to Yelp to give Body Cycle 5 stars after the first time because my favorite instructor (Robbie) from the Bellevue teaches classes here. I've even taken Russell at the Bellevue a few times over the 5 years that I belonged (though not regulary because when I was a member his classes were too early for me). I even took one class with Shoshana when I was there and she teaches here too. I remember her being really good (I over-analyze instructors that I'm new to). So with that said, I was already impressed with some of the instructors before even stepping foot into this place.

When I did step foot, I was impressed with the simple layout. I liked the exposed brick too. It was a simple sign up process and when I got there all I had to do was initial my name. I was greeted by Kerry, the instructor, who was friendly and answered all of my questions. I wasn't familiar with the type of bike that Body Cycle uses but someone from my good ole' old gym was there and helped me out with that. Once Kerry got started he also gave the newbies the rundown on how to use the bike.

The reason for the 4 stars is because I wasn't that impressed with the class. I was expecting a livelier, more intense class. It wasn't a bad class at all. I just wanted my ass kicked. Usually, when I take 90-minute spin classes, I'm ready to go after about 60 minutes and I have to really push myself to keep going. I had to leave a little early today for an appointment, but I could've easily kept going without a push. 

I'm going to definitely come back on the weekends that I'm in Philly. I need to work out while here and since you pay per class, it makes sense. I am familiar with some of the instructors, so I know I can come here and get my ass kicked. 

Finally, there is one shower here. It isn't advertised probably because there's only one. It's nice and clean and comfortable. I had to use it today because I had another appointment immediately after.I wouldn't rely on it though because, again, there's only one. 

First class is free. Glad this  was it. I'll be sure to pay for what I'm familiar with next time.
Went back for Sunday AM 90 minute class. Kerry is a great teacher.
Excellent spinning studio! SUPER challenging classes! Fabulous instructors! Great bikes. My favorites: Shoshana, Erin, Carly, Jess, Russell. Love it here. :)

Oh my god, this was the most intense spin class I've ever attended. I went on the recommendation of a friend who's been riding at the studio for a few years now; she promised me it was the hardest spin class in the city, and she was definitely right! The instructor, Carly, was motivating throughout the ride and played great music! It's one of those workouts where you FEEL it the next day; my legs were so sore! Would definitely come back for another class and great workout!

Small studio but welcoming & unique to the cyclist in you. Offers back to back class offerings to suit everyone's schedule. Out of water during class? Raise that hand high and someone is there to fill it for you. Shower available but just one that I noticed.

I love spinning and have some pretty high expectations for instructors. Russell was amazing. Super friendly, motivating and energetic. I loved the music and appreciate the feedback he sought from clients about theme rides and music. And oh yeah, the workout totally kicked my butt. It was a challenging ride, be prepared to burn some serious calories. 

The facility was great. Clean. Great bikes. Interesting space with the exposed brick. And online reservation super easy and convenient. 

I've only been once as I was visiting from DC, but I'm regular traveler to Philadelphia and every weekend I'm there I plan to make it my mission to get to a ride in with Body Cycling Studio.

Simply the best place to spin in the city. As a cyclist, spinning is a necessary evil and try as I may, it's never something I have looked forward to. But Body Cycle has changed that for me. The classes are challenging and fun and often geared towards cyclists. The instructors are experienced, highly knowledgeable and extremely motivating. This is exactly the place you need to be when the weather gets bad and you don't want to lose your aerobic threshold or when you just want to kick your own butt!

(one day later) Holy hell. My booty hurts. 

My first BC class was all thanks to the gals at The Positivity Charge. They hosted a SipxCycle event, which started with a class taught by Jenna Stern and ended with fresh juices from The Juice Philly. Awesome way to spend a Sunday.

I've only tried SoulCycle in the past. While that was great, BC is an entirely different experience and I recommend trying both to compare. I prefer BC more because of the overall vibe/clientele. Jenna, the instructor, was unbelievably encouraging and had a rockin' personality. For me, the overall experience lies mostly in the hands of the instructor. Also, loved the fact that you DON'T need cycling shoes. 

Would 10/10 go again.

I chose to start at Body Cycle after reading the Yelp reviews and it was a great decision (thanks Yelp'ers!).  The classes are amazing b/c the instructors are excellent - motivational, great music, clear instructions and tips on form, plus a great studio. I've taken the most classes with Dawn, Shoshanna, Jessica and Robbie. They all bring something unique to their classes and are fab instructors. I take Dawn's Sunday class quite a bit (although they sometimes have a different teacher at 12:45, I hope she is back to being a regular on Sundays) and I really appreciate how she varies the rides and let's us know what is coming up - ie, 2 minutes on this hill in third position etc. When you are hungover on a Sunday, that really helps:) Shoshanna is incredibly fun while being hard as hell, Jessica will straight up kick you ass and Robbie will inspire you to ride hard. 

The best part is that after two solid months of Body Cycle, I dropped a decent amount of graduate school weight and can run a couple miles easily again. 

Highly recommend Body Cylcle!

Classpass review: Body Cycle is probably the most if not second most frequent studio I visit with Classpass; yes, it's that awesome of a place! I've had classes mostly with Jessica and Jenna, both are great! Jessica is a little more intense since she does more choreography but you knowing you worked hard that day. Nonetheless, it's your ride, you do what's best for you and your body whether it's more or less intense. 

You check in and the receptionist hands you a towel to use for that class. If you need help with your bike you can ask a staff member who is happy to help. Every class has awesome music. You can wear sneakers or cycle shoes. The studio is getting updated so there's new bathrooms and now SHOWERS!

I met three beasts by the name of Ross, Shoshanna, and Monica. I absolutely love Body Cycle and took classes while I stayed in Philly for a month. I'm not going to lie, I thought I was going to die during my first class. I was not a happy camper at all. However, I felt amazing the following days and was able to go to my second class. During my second class, I was much stronger and my resistance was much higher. I'm so happy I gave it a shot and continued taking classes through out my trip. I ate so much food in Philadelphia, but came back home to FL tiny thanks to BC. The equipment is new and the facility is very clean. All of the instructors have their own style and motivate you. If you're a beginner, don't worry, you can go at your own pace. Also, speak up and ask for help to set up your bike. You want to be comfortable, but most of all, the instructors want you comfortable with proper form.

I took my first 45-minute Body Cycle class last week with instructor Jessica (?)!  Your first class at BC is free= huge plus! Then I signed up for Classpass (which is awesome and highly recommended- whoever came up with that idea wins!). So I went to my second Body Cycle class last night with instructor Tiffany Wallace. Here's the rundown:

Studio- small (one room of bikes), but plenty of space to cubby your schtuff, use the restroom, and hang out when you are waiting before class. 

Bike room-  space and bikes are close. Stadium style and everyone can see instructor. Everyone can also see themself in mirror whether from front or side. 

Bathroom- has one shower and some toiletries accessible to guests. 

Noise- yes, classes are REALLY LOUD, but come on...have you ever taken a spin class before? You need this loud 'pump-me-up' music to get through a gruesome workout! And if you can't tolerate loud, they offer you ear plugs!!

The bikes- really nice. Awesome speedometer and definitely quality

The instructors- so far so good. They spend a lot of time helping people before class to make sure seat height is correct, etc. I overheard Tiffany speaking to a couple last night who had just finished their first spin class and she was giving them lots of helpful tips! Really nice girl. Jessica gave me a good instructional about bikes before my first class there because I had never worked with that brand of bike before. 

Music- each instructor has their own playlist, but so far it has been a techno/rap blend that definitely gets your butt moving

Class times- ok considering they have one room

Location- center city, safe block!

Overall, highly recommended. I wish Classpass would let me attend this studio more then 3 times per month! 
I would consider buying a full time membership here if I had the money!

Addendum: took a second class with Jessica this week. That girl can KICK YOUR BUTT! Holy crap! HR 180s the entire time and I thought I was going to die. Needless to say, can't wait to go back!

I went to the studio last week for a trial ride, as I've just moved into town and wanted to find a good place for spin. I do a lot of road biking, I love spinning, and this studio came well recommended! The first ride is free, which is great for testing out the studio, and the sign up process is online which means no waiting in line or worrying about getting a spot. 

I did a 75 minute spin session with Barry. He was great - the class was full but he did a really good job of checking peoples monitors during the class to see how we were doing, and answering any questions that people had. The website says that hes a very experienced triathlete and ultra marathon runner (!) and after the class I felt that I'd really learned a lot (we did several hill climbs using different gears, to see how our power output compared for each) and had a really great workout. The temperature was good - cool for a spin studio, and he picked good music.  

A few small things meant that I didn't give the place a 5, one is that its really small (including the lobby area and the actual studio) and some of the bikes face other people in the class which can be a little offputting. There were about 25 bikes. The bikes do have really good displays on them - syncs with a heart rate monitor, shows watts, calories, rpm etc, but I did find it slightly strange that there are numbered gears on the bikes rather than the dial that you tend to get on spin bikes that lets you gradually add resistance. I guess it makes it more like riding a real bike and shifting gears, but sometimes I wished there were more in-between gears when I was riding!

I'm definitely going back - just bought the $95 student pass (10 rides) which is a pretty good deal.

I LOVE the spinning classes here! I got a package of 5 classes and probably will get more. Its a small studio on 19th and chestnut (easy to miss they just have a small sign on the door). the classes are from 45-90 minutes long. I have taken classes with Tiffany Wallace and Russell and they were both really good. Russell's class felt like you were in a night club but at 6:30am on a Monday morning. The classes are fun and the instructions really push you. Also, the choice of music is pretty good! I highly reccomend morning spinning classes there because they re not too full and you can always get a bike and get your workout over with for the day!

Also, first class for new customers is free so definitely worth a try!

This place is awesome. The instructors and the front desk staff are all so welcoming and friendly, and the classes are always challenging with great music! 

Before purchasing a Gilt City deal for this place, I had never tried spinning at a studio before- I was just used to taking them as regular gym classes. My first class I felt kind of anxious: were they going to be snobby? Were they going to smell the Gilt City coupon and non-Lululemon on me? Was I going to be totally out of my element?

No! Totally unpretentious, sweaty fun. It's so addictive, and I'll definitely be returning for classes even after my deal runs out. The class prices and packages are really reasonable, especially for the quality of instruction you get. It definitely feels like a very community-oriented spinning studio, which is also great. 5 stars all the way!

Russell's spinning classes are the best in the City and make my day.   Body Cycle has evolved into a happy united community and the space is clean, funky, affordable and accessible.  After twenty years of spinning, these are the class that I love best.

I've attended my fair share of spin classes even before boutique cycle classes were a thing.  One thing I learned about spinning - it's always difficult, no matter what kind of shape you're in.  

Body Cycle does not disappoint.  Even though the classes are 45 minutes, they fly by and before you know it, you're dripping massive amounts of sweat and your legs feel like jello.  Each instructor is different - some classes are more interval-like and some offer more of an endurance ride, where you climb hills for days.  I like that there are lots of classes offered throughout the day, although I do wish there was something around 4:15 or 4:30 on the weekdays.  

If you've thought about trying a class here, don't think, do it!  You're first class is free, so really, you have nothing to lose (except some toxins that you are guaranteed to sweat out!)
This place is great!  I've been to 8 class's in past month and loved them all.  Spinning has done wonders for my running.  You feel great after class.

I've been back to Body cycle for the past month because Revive closed, and I don't think I'll be straying again.  These are the hardest spin classes I've ever done.  I love the music and the instructors.  They have lots of early morning classes. They have a new space which is bigger so there's more room for the bikes.  The 90 minute classes are a great challenge.  Only wish there were more membership options for people like me that use this as their primary work out; having to buy class passes will get expensive.

I take back everything I said about spinning

Ok, as a guy I never gave spinning a passing thought, I thought it was for girls and have always been self-motivated to work out and had always imagined spinning consisted of deafening techno music and instructors yelling at me to pedal harder. I even used to make fun of my ex for doing it. 

For perspective, I love endurance sports, have run distance races and triathlons, love to swim and love my road bike, and I weight lifted for years.  When this spinning studio opened nearby I decided Id give it a try because I have a nagging achilles running injury and its just way too frustrating to ride my bike on the trail after work - too crowded.  I figured it's pretty cheap and theres no membership fee, I might make some new friends, whats the downside?
 
Man. Let me tell you.  If you push yourself to have good form and cadence and the highest resistance you can tolerate, this is one of the hardest workouts you can do in an hour.  This is so much harder than even swimming for an hour straight.  At the end of certain classes, when Ive pushed myself, I am exhausted, drenched in sweat,  nauseous (...thats a good thing if you are like me) and euphoric.  

Im telling all the guys out there who are like me and want a convenient, inexpensive workout that will bring you to your knees  - especially the ones who used to knock spinning like i did - to check this out.  I mean the first class is free so why not?  Youll like it.  

The music is good and the online reservation system is awesome, so you don't have to get there a half hour early to claim a bike.  They have free towels and water is a buck if you don't bring your own. 

Personally, Im a huge fan of Robbie, that guy is a mad man.  Russell is awesome too and just about the nicest dude you'll ever meet.  Im still trying the other instructors but Ive never had a class that wasn't outstanding.  

Thank me later!

Great environment, great music, great bikes and great instructors! Loved this place - highly competitive to other cycling studios. Only downside is the monthly membership cost - wish it wasn't so expensive.

I am a newcomer to spin (I'm 31 and two weeks ago was my first time trying it).  I always thought it was super intimidating, and did not want to embarrass myself by falling off the bike or something (trust me, it's a legitimate possibility, I'm incredibly clumsy).  I ended up being convinced to try it by a friend who found a deal for 20 rides on Gilt City Philadelphia at Body Cycle.  I signed up for a 20-minute introductory class, which is made for beginners like me.  Shoshanna showed me and the other newbies how to set up our bikes, adjust them for our heights, explained how the classes work, and what to expect.  It set my mind at ease for my first "real" class two days later.  Wowza, is spinning a great way to get your heart rate up and your blood pumping!  I've enjoyed every class I've taken so far, though every instructor has a different teaching style.  I'm still figuring out what style I like best, but all have been great workouts.

You can book on Body Cycle's Web site (which allows you to book classes up to two weeks in advance). I suggest you book as soon as you know what classes you want to take, b/c they often sell out.

I absolutely love this place.  I have been going for about 2 months now, and I am completely obsessed.  It is so fantastic to have a gym dedicated to spinning. There are so many class options, you can go pretty much any time you want.  The instructors are wonderful.  The bikes are my favorite part.  They are all digital, so there is no guessing about what "gear" you are in with a quarter turn to the right, you know exactly where you are.  
Highly recommend this place for a fun, fantastic workout.

My first class was held today by the amazing Jessica and though I was a little concern, being new to spinning, Jessica and the amazing receptionist in the front made me feel at ease.

First walking into the building, you see smiling employees that honestly doesn't feel artificial or commercial, the two that helped me today were/are beyond helpful, explaining the classes to me and the people who go there are beyond helpful, not snobby whatsoever. The whole environment is welcoming!

Jessica is tough and she lets you know that, but she also goes out of her way to assist you when you need help and makes sure your seating is comfortable, giving you tips along the way! If you feel uncomfortable, SPEAK UP.

I'm looking forward to being a regular here and being trained by her.

Still the best boutique spinning studio in Philadelphia.  Russell is my favorite spinning instructor in Philadelphia. The studio is clean, accessible, friendly and my go-to at least once a week.  I'm a proud "body rocker"and now my teenage sons can join me in class!

Awesome first class with Dawn. Nice studio
I love the bikes. A must do when Visting Philly. I have done at least 5 classes here my favorite spin studio on the east coast. Really make you feel comfortable and welcome from your first free visit! All the instructors are excellent.

instructors are great, bikes work well and show rpms and gear levels, music is on point, price is competitive, and the check in process is easy. 

the only reason i'm docking a star is because the studio doesnt get dark at all - they have a huge skylight - and there arent enough mirrors to check your form.  

overall i love this place.

The best spinning studio in phila for a number of reasons. It's like flywheel without the pretense. Don't get me wrong I love a good flywheel class but body cycle is like it's less culty little sister - and there are no arm workouts which let's be honest makes sense (if you're going to work out arms do it separately not during cardio! though it is a welcome break from interval sprints). Body cycle shares a studio with yoga and barre classes which is nice but it's got its own little area in the back and doesn't feel too crowded. Classes are at convenient times for the most part but there aren't any early afternoon which has been frustrating occasionally. The teachers are phenomenal and I never get bored during class - Robbie is one of my favorites. A notable difference from flywheel is no shoes provided so you either bring your own cycling shoes or wear sneakers and use their shoe cages (which I have found to be almost as good as clipping in though serious cyclers would probably disagree). It's a great workout and you'll leave sweaty but happy.

I went to Body Cycle for a spinning class today and absolutely loved it! This was my first time taking a spinning class. I rarely ever leave a review for anything however I had to share. The instructor (Dee) was very impressing and motivating. I also met the founder Russell, he was also pleasant and very helpful. There was a special so my first class was free but I will definitely return!

I've been waiting for an exclusive spinning studio on Philadelphia for years.  Russell is so nice and accomodating and his instructors are incredible.  The workouts really push you to work hard and get the most out of the 50 minutes.  I totally recommend it to anyone- beginner, novice, intermediate, or expert!

I love the classes here so far! I came in for my first ride free when I hurt my shoulder, and I bought a class package after that. They have student packages which are really reasonable. 

Studio is located above Breakaway Bikes, and it's a really nice space. I like that the bikes have the monitor on them telling you what resistance you are at and how fast you are going. The instructors will often refer to what RPM and resistance number range you should be in. This allows for you to push yourself harder than you would normally, since you can see how much slower (in my case) that you are going compared to the number they are giving you. Also, I definitely use more resistance using these bikes!  Studio uses the black lights and when it's dark outside, it's dark in the studio. Little clip on lights on the bikes let you see the monitors.

They provide towels, coat rack, cubbies, bathroom. They sell water and some other things, but there is also a water cooler for filling up bottles.

So far I have taken from Jessica and Shoshana. I found their classes to be very challenging!

I have attended Body Cycle for 1.5 years now after moving to Philly from the land of the fit (LA) and would highly recommend Body Cycle for those who take their spin workout seriously. Here's the skinny on Body Cycle:

1. Superior equipment: Magnetic bikes w electronic gear shifts and display that shows RPM, wattage and heart rate stats (if you're wearing a HRM). This is far superior to the Schwinn hand crank bikes where you have to guess at speed, resistance and progress. Take the guesswork out of your workout and be amazed at how much you will progress if you come here regularly.

2. Great variety of challenging classes: Jessica's and Shoshanna's classes work you w/ intervals at fast and faster pace on high gear; Barry's class tests your endurance; Jacqui's class helps me work on speed and pushes me to my lactate threshold; Russell's 1km race spurts get me in into competitive spirit. Each instructor brings their own style, intensity and challenge to class. 

3. Ease of scheduling: Just sign up online. Classes are posted two weeks in advance. What can be easier than that?

Body Cycle has such an awesome range of classes... from the 60 minute endurance ride with Triathlon guru Barry (used to be 75 minutes... womp womp) to the upbeat jams with Jessica Sullivan, to the challenging workout with Russell (not to mention he is NOT bad to look at)... there is something for everyone.  I try to make it at least once a week when my schedule lets me... I would go more if I could!  Affordable packages for students, top of the line bikes, and a clean studio puts Body cycle over the top in my book.

Love it!

AMAZING place. I have officially fallen in love with spinning or I should say BCS. I was introduced to BCS when I first moved to the city in 2011 but did not return until 2012. My only regret is that I did not return sooner! The atmosphere of the studio is great, the instructors are genuine, and the classes will make you sweat and feel so satisfied afterwards. I honestly do not have a bad thing to say about the place. I think the owner has an incredible philosophy and strives to make BCS the most welcoming and loving place out there to break a sweat. Instructors meet you where you are at and there is truly no judgement. There website is incredibly easy to navigate and you can look up info on the instructors right on the webpage to see who may be a good fit for you. I've taken classes from a variety of instructors and they all have varying styles with different music. I prefer some classes and instructors more than others but that is complete personal preference. I wish I could go every day!

Definitely not great classes. But worse is their customer device, hence the 1 star review.  If you write a bed review you may get sued, lol... According to them.

I've used Body Cycle through ClassPass and have not written a public review until now but they accused me of writing a terrible one based on other feedback I gave through ClassPass and threatened a law suit me so I thought, well now's the time to write that bad review!

So... The maturity level of Shoshanna, the manager, is non-existent.  Some of the teaches there are not great, and I've mentioned that.  She has no tolerance for anyone who doesn't think everyone there is fabulous.  So if you don't like the teacher be on your way or you'll get a nasty email telling you that you are banned from the studio.

The only teacher there worth taking, in my opinion, is Ross.  He doesn't blast the music and gives instructions you can follow.  He also doesn't make you jump up and down on the bike (not my preference) and do silly claps. I find dance-type style annoying.  Others may like it.  It slowed down the calorie burn in my opinion, and I've been teaching dance and Pilates for 20+ years.

Also, the classes aren't hard but are okay for only beginners.  If you have any experience you will most likely not feel challenged here.  The bikes have levels you can read on them (some gyms you just turn a knob and never know what the resistance is).  But the technology doesn't compare with Flywheel or Soul Cycle.

I would highly recommend you go elsewhere.  Unless you want to hear empty threats of court proceedings after only getting a mediocre workout.  Not my thing... I just want a decent sweat, not a front row ticket to the People's Court.

It's true, there's pretty much nothing I can think of that's bad about the spin classes here. I've only been to 3 classes, three different instructors, both great, but Jessica Sullivan's class was the best cardio class (not just spin class) I've ever tried. From the beginning, she was helpful and friendly, but I really appreciated her adamance about form throughout the class. She didn't just say "no bouncing," but explained how to not bounce so that we don't injure ourselves. (I'm a newbie to spinning.)

The studio is clean, not overcrowded, towels and water available, well ventilated, the equipments are new. 

The only drawback is the schedule of classes. There are hardly weekend classes (no afternoons), and the times are not consistent during the week, so for many of us who have a set work schedule, there's only 1 class I can attend the whole week.

...and if Jessica teaches more evening classes, that would be ideal!
Professional operation:  Keiser bikes, certified & experienced instructors, and online sign up guarantees placement.   Programs accommodate all levels of fitness.   Highly recommend.

Body Cycle Spinning Studio is a delight.  I enjoyed my first ride with my  favorite spinning instructor Russell Carter in a spotless, prime Center City location.  Russell's classes are safe and fun and the best work-out around.  I would highly recommend the studio to anyone looking for a terrific spin class; I can't wait to go back.
Russell Carter's spin classes are the best in Philadelphia and I'm delighted that Body Cycle has become such a hit.   More bikes, please!  More and longer classes with Russell and Shoshana each week!

I love Body Cycle! I have taken classes with Russ, Sho, Tiff, Jess & Ross so far. The Kaiser Bikes are great and are friendly to my joints. Instead of the free weighted front wheel, these bikes use magnetic force. I also dig the freedom the instructors have to bring their individual personalities to their classes. I just completed my first three Triathlons & found out that my time spent at BCS have prepped me in a big way.  Additionally, in this big box economy, I feel great spinning locally. Everyone there is super helpful and all give amazing customer service. I'm a fan, can you tell.

I've been to this studio many times through classpass! Specifically to Carly and Jenna's evening classes. I always leave incredibly sweaty, a little dead, but totally refreshed.

The studio itself is a nice space, and the quality of the classes/instructors is just as good as the other more "corporate" spin studios in the area. Fortunately, this one has a more affordable price tag, too. 

BONUS: I randomly receive discounted class package offers to BCS after attending a few times through classpass. This definitely helps make it more affordable and works well for me personally bc I'm not the kinda gal that needs an unlimited monthly deal for spin.

I think this is a solid spinning studio at a great price! Their website is easy to use and they have frequent classes! It's conveniently located at 19th and Chestnut (2nd floor)! 
They use Keiser bikes (which aren't my favorite), but they are well maintained and each have a computer with RPM, kCal, Distance, and Gear. 
They offer the first class free! And their class-cards are a good deal. The instructors are nice and enthusiastic! Each class definitely has its own flavor- so check out a few!

I love bodycycle! I have been taking classes from Russell for a while so i was really excited when i heard he was opening his own studio. The bikes are state of the art. i especially like the heart monitor read out. i makes a big difference if you can monitor how hard you're really working (no cheating). the high ceiling space gives the room a pleasant airy feel and light streams through the south facing large windows. the vibe is low key but personalized and supportive. the workout is the focus and russell has a wonderfully eclectic sense of music- you never know what he's going to use, but you can bet that it will motivate you and get you rolling  regardless. my favorite class is wed because it really sets you up to finish out the week- it's all downhill from there.

Every once and a while I like to spice my fitness workout up by trying something new or taking classes at different place around the city where I find a good deal.  So when I saw the Gilt City for Body Cycle Spinning Studio couldn't pass the opportunity up to try this place at a discounted rate, I had already heard awesome things.

If you are into spinning this is the place to be.  There are tons of class times, some of the more popular ones do fill up lucky for me I work a slightly odd schedule and that doesn't effect me much except occasionally on the weekends.  All of the staff has been super friendly and accommodating.  The instructors are great they have a variety of styles and you can learn something different from each one to improve your performance and technique.  If your not a fan of one you can usually avoid them. 

Body Cycle Spinning Studio spicy things up with themed rides and workshops.  I was able to attend the Glow Ride which was pretty cool.  They also gave out a free ride and bottle of champagne to one randomly selected spinner who came on valentines day I didn't win but it was cool to have a shot.  In addition there customer service is awesome some of us got left in the cold because the person was late to open the studio and they comped us a ride.

I've lived in Philly for about a year and yesterday was the first time I tried the class. The first class is free so def check it out! Each class is about 45 min. 

I like that they play upbeat EDM music- it was easier for me to get through the class. Our instructor was Tiffany and she was super nice and patient with helping us adjust our bikes and teaching the class. I think this is a great place for beginners! 

They have showers but only like 2-3 so I recommend just going home to shower. The studio is located on the 2nd floor. If I was still living in the city I'd be interested in coming back.

Managed to get my -i hate mornings- butt in here one fine 6am morning to take Russell's class and it was worth it. He played Kanye and other hip hop which I really appreciated because *ints ints* music doesn't get me as hype. And while I was planning on peddling away at 1/2 the RPM we're supposed to go, I managed to turn it up cause of him. 

The studio is nice, auditorium-y so everyone can see the instructor. I do find the bikes a weee too close.... cause when I'm going 1/2 the RPM I don't want miss nosy-super skinny and fit to judge me , ya feel?

As the great Billy Blanks (of Tae Bo fame) once said:
"Girl, you gotta pick those knees up."

It's come to my attention that some people believe a workout should be sweaty, hard, and challenging. While I wish playing bocce burned calories, the fact is I was looking for somewhere to kick my ass. Enter: spinning. 

What's spinning? Well, it's biking without going anywhere, but it kicks your ass. Expect fun instructors, fun music, and usually (in the classes I've been to) a darker room. Dark room weirded me out at first, but it helps prevent you from worrying to much about how you look, and more about racing to the top of the 'hill'.

I've been to two classes so far, and I imagine I'll be a regular at a certain mid-day class that ain't too crowded.

Body Cycle has super schmancy spin bikes (you can even wear a heart monitor to class to get your heart rate on the screen), filtered water, comp towels, and CLEAN bikes (ever been to a Bikram studio? it's hard to keep sweaty places clean!), and this spin studio is one that will have you returning week after week.

One shower available only, and if you use it, it feels like I'm preventing someone else from using the bathroom.  There were cubby holes, which I am not a big fan of, especially for in the city.  Bikes were put so close together that for the stretches at the end, I had to constantly be careful not to hit the person next to me.  Staff is friendly, and people seem friendly, especially if you can get to know them.  They may decide to change the cubby holes in a few months or so.

I took my first Body Cycle class thanks to Yelp Fit Club and enjoyed the class so much I bought a five class package. This studio doesn't have the bells and whistles of some of the larger, national studios that have rolled into town, but it does come with a more affordable price tag, which I can get behind. 

There is definitely a quality over quantity vibe to Body Cycle that I dig. Instructors know names, and they really keep an eye out for form, reminding the class at times not to hunch shoulders, keep butts back, etc. Those little cues are great reminders for me personally, since I have a tendency to tense up. Also, I love the bikes. They are very smooth to ride and easy to tweak as instructors call out cues to adjust the resistance. 

I've taken classes with Jessica, Shoshana and Jenna and I love all three instructors. I've also never had a problem getting into a class time I want, though generally I go for more random times like weekday lunch and 4:30pm. The front desk staff is always friendly, and I do believe they have the softest towels in all the land.

My five class package has been completed and I tend to take my cardio outdoors during summer, but I look forward to taking more classes at Body Cycle sometime in the future.

Great class with Russell who really made an effort to make sure every cyclist new and regular was properly set up on their bikes. Also showed and reminded everyone of proper form. Bring your own shoes or cycle in your sneakers.

I've been to many LA Fitness locations and this is by far one of the best. Having it's own attached parking garage and 2 stories of space and equipment, making it one of the largest I've been to as well. TONS or cardio equipment and space for plyos.

Overall I like this gym more than the smaller Hyde Park Village option and it's less than $10 a month more so it's a deal in this area. There are plenty of pros about this signature gym, especially compared to other options around South Tampa. I go at various times and I have never had to wait for a machine, although the free weights upstairs do tend to get very busy and you will be waiting at peak hours. The pool and hot tub are always clean and I love how the lanes are set up for splits (two people can do laps in same lane), the sauna could be much hotter (avg. is 162 and it needs to be about 170), but it's always clean, and the showers/locker rooms (for guys anyway) are again, always clean. I've never had my stuff moved or my locker opened or anything stolen and I consider this a plus and they have a TV for every locker row which I appreciate. The scheduling of classes seems to hit the majority of work schedules and I have taken over 20 spin classes and like everything, some of the instructors are good and some are better. They even play the background music pretty low (except for those loud, obnoxious sales days where the group fitness companies get to come in), the food and drinks at the smoothie bar are good and the service there is always friendly. 
I do have a couple of cons though: the parking is frustrating! Tight, and if you go during peak hours be prepared to wait in a long line, come close to getting clipped around corners from juiced up necks in their beer-bro trucks, and I've almost hit a few pedestrians in that garage myself. It's craziness during the peak hours! They need to wipe down the racquetball courts more often - they are more slippery than other courts and that's an ankle injury waiting to happen. My biggest gripe is the staff at the front desk, and even a few trainers. The front desk are simply clueless. I was told recently that I couldn't schedule a racquetball court less than 8 days ahead of time (this was wrong), it took 20 minutes to get a receipt for a league I was signing up for, they seem to play on their phones instead of watch for the herds of people coming in to check in, and just last weekend I was dropping off a cancellation form for a friend and the desk girl said they simply wouldn't take it, wouldn't even drop it in the mail for me, I had to mail it myself to the California office (it says right on the form to drop it off at any club). They are almost useless. Over by the trainer area the trainers have their clients running almost full speed up and down the elliptical and treadmill rows and that is ridiculously unsafe and I can't believe they allow it. The TV's on the cardio machines are hit and miss and there's no way to tell what is going to work or not until your set up and running already. It's a big place though with plenty of space and equipment to do your thing without any hassles in the least. Overall, the best gym I've paid for and a real deal for the money in the South Tampa area. Also a shout out to Ron who gave me and my girlfriend great deals to move from the Hyde Park location to Signature - well worth the time and money for a gym.

Im giving the gym a 3 star for the purposes i used it for. It does have a bball court, raquet ball and pool but i never used these. 

Sales
I was bothered several times by trainers and sales people about buying training. If i wanted to buy id let you know, but dont walk around and bother me during my cardio workout. 

Working Out
Most weights and machines are great, they have lots of great weight lifting equipment but there are a few problems to why it makes it average in my opinion and a 3 star.
1. All of the good stability equipment to help you grow is located in the paid training area only. The purpose of holding the good equipment hostage is to get you to buy training. Im used to using that equipment to grow, its normal to have access available for all members in any average gym. 
2. Machines are broke and not fixed for long periods of time. Im looking at 3 currently and 2 have had a maintenance sign for over a month. 

They recently moved the training area upstairs which makes the gym feel a bit cramped and smaller.  I liked it better downstairs. 

Overall the gym is clean, people are nice and it has a good atmosphere. Towel service is fantastic.

I always like checking out the local LA Fitness whenever I travel and I can say this is one of the nicest facilities I've visited. It is huge with tons of equipment, you walk in and right off the bat you're greeted by rows and rows of cardio equipment.

There is an indoor pool, they have child center for your kids to ensure there is no excuse not to get your workout in. There is a cafe that serves coffee, smoothies and energy drinks. A pretty large spin class and a personal training workout area and this is just on the first floor.

Upstairs you will find all the free weights and nautilus equipment you will ever need to get a full body workout in. They have a full court basketball court and a yoga room. 

There is ample parking with a three story attached garage.

One of the best gyms in Tampa, but they can always do better.  The staff can seem less than friendly - if not apathetic/ complacent. The $45/month my wife and I EACH pay is a bit much, but what a nice gym and a great kids care area.  Not the best gym I've ever been to, but this has significantly raised south Tampa's gym stadards - finally!  If only the can keep the place from falling apart.

I would think that it would be a little cleaner, being a Signature Club. There is always garbage laying around; on the floor, on the cardio machines, in the locker room. Not a huge mess but enough to notice. I never see anyone cleaning. 
As a nurse/germaphobe, I really dislike the equipment cleaning process. Paper towels and hand sanitizer just doesn't seem adequate and I rarely see anyone doing it anyway. 
I do like all the machine options and that they give you a towel (works better than paper towels to clean the machines). I've enjoyed all the classes so far, but I wish there were some between and 10 and 4. 
I don't get hassled by the club to purchase personal training, but I do get bothered occasionally by random people walking around. 
All in all, pretty decent and probably better than the rest around.

Quick Summary: As one of the largest gym chains in the country most people already know what they're going to get.  I like the place because I've never had to wait for a machine, or had a problem with my favorite machine being broken.  And they have always had a towel for me (albeit... my normal hours at the gym are midday).

As a Signature location, it means that this location has everything, bball, racquet ball, swimming, kidz club, etc.  They've got a whole long line of your typical machines (treadmills, elliptical, cycles, and the other day it looked like more ergs were being put together).  The weight area is upstairs and is quite vast, with all the machines and free weights you can think of.

So all of this is pretty much expected for a signature location; so here's what I like the place:

1) The Staff has been very friendly and receptive to comments. Usually I make them on my way out, so I can't say if they follow up immediately, but they don't give me a haughty look when I say something... you'd be surprised how often this occurs.

2) The locker rooms are decently kept.  There's always someone that leaves something out, but I haven't been scared to go in and change in there... 

3) The pool is also kept in good conditions. You'd be surprised how often I've jumped into a pool and the water is cloudy... yeah not good.

4) Parking seems to be pretty decent; now keep in mind, I usually come midday and am always able to grab ground floors spot. It's nice that they have a dedicated parking garage though.

Typical commercial gym. Plenty of space, plenty of equipment. Not my scene. 

I'd join if the plates were rounded. The flat sided plates are dangerous imo because they will shift while deadlifting.

If you're just looking to get in shape, great place to do it.

I rarely post on here but felt today it was necessary. One of the check in girls overcharged my girl friend by $192.00 when taking my account off hold status. I met the manager today, Cati, and she corrected it within 5 minutes. I can you that your previous manager would not do it. Management here has been poor and feel Cati is a step in the right direction.

VERY crowded at peak hours like most gyms. 

NOBODY picks up or re-racks their weights/dumbbells.

Little pricey for the "Signature" offerings.

Wish it were open until MIDNIGHT like all the OTHER la Fitness locations. Closing at 11 is an inconvenience for me since I work nights. 

The Smoothie Junction is AWESOME. Delicious smoothies and great quest bar prices. Wish it were open past 9 pm though lol.

Four stars because a signature club should at least provide bottled water too since they have towel service like Lifetime Fitness. That's my only complaint really. Since this location is in South Tampa where parking is very limited in this specific part of town, the parking garage is great. There's plenty of parking here. 

It's a two story building with weights on the 2nd floor and cardio machines on 1st floor. I came in during lunchtime and there was plenty of weight equipment with little to no wait. Tons of cardio machines. There's also a smoothie bar on the first floor that has supplements, fit for life meals along with smoothies. Since this was a fairly new gym all the equipment was newer and clean. The 2nd floor has every weight machine or equipment you could ask for from free weights to machine weights. Yeah there are a lot of young, fit people but you can't let that bother you. Everyone was a beginner at one point so don't let that or the place intimidate you. There are also trainers ready to help you if you are just starting out so don't be afraid to ask. 

I wished there was a signature club in the Tampa/Clearwater area since I do pay for it.

The way they went about closing the Hyde Park location was super shady. They announced closing for July 14 and then just locked up and turned off the doors sometime last week. No notice at all. Showed up to work out and...wtf. They have my email - they're great at sending me marketing emails- couldn't just inform us they were closing? They're just such a horrible company on so many levels

I have reviewed other LA Fitness Clubs since you can go to mostly all of them without paying extra, but here are some things I like about this one.

1. Plenty of Equipment! Ive never had to wait to use anything or fight with a person who was hogging the smith machine or cables.

2. Towel Service- I  always forget to pack one. No worries when I go here

3. Basketball, Pool, and Racquetball Courts- I dont use them, but if I ever wanted to at least the are there.

4. TV's on the Cardio machines...every single one- No need to rush home to watch Scandal when you need to get that cardio in.

5. Clean!- Some of these LA fitness or ex Lifestyle fitness need some serious maintenance 

6. Staff- I don't interact with them much, but they seem fine.

7. Smoothie Shop- You can buy supplements and sometimes they have fit life food meals.

8. Parking- there is usually plenty of it, even if you have to go to the top of the garage.

They have an abs area, I wish they had a designated area for plyos, trx, sprints, stairs or ropes to switch things up a bit, but they have mostly EVERYTHING you will need.

Avoid this gym. The people "working" could care less about any members. The gym is dirty. All I see is so called employees walking around. Hey instead of walking around, how about cleaning something. The equipment is filthy. Its covered in old sweat and hair. Check out Crunch. At least it is new and probably clean. All positive reviews on here are obviously from the group of idiots they call employees. I have never seen a group of people less interested in the place they work. Everyone working there is either on their phone or talking to each other. They literally ignore you when you ask them a question. I was shushed when I had the nerve to ask one of the idiots the front desk a question.

i joined in February 2014. I'm pretty happy with this gym. 

First, the staff is great. 99% of them are incredibly pleasant and have great customer service. I always feel welcomed here and love when employees go out of their way to acknowledge their members. A sense of community is important in a gym, at least in my opinion. 

Second, I pay for personal training. I have seen - Tara and Nikki - are PHENOMENAL. They have wonderful personalities, are both incredibly smart in their trade and are awesome motivators. I look forward to training STRICTLY because of them. Eric is also a trainer there and though I've never trained with him - he is really nice and is always with a client which tells me he must be just as great of a trainer. Update: I recently began doing group training with Tara as well individual and I must say, I LOVE group! Definitely recommend :)

Third - The smoothie bar. They make great smoothies and have great prices. The staff there is always pleasant. 

Fourth - They had an issue with a lack of towels for a while. Seems it was because people mistakenly took them with them without realizing it. Anyway, they ordered more and this hasn't been an issue! Thank you for that!
getting dirty, not being maintained as other Signature locations. come on mgmt!

While it didn't happen smoothly, I am now a member of this LA Fitness since the company closed my previous "home club" in Hyde Park. 

Because their Hyde Park location was the only location I could visit based on my particular membership, I was transferred to this club since it was obviously the nearest location to my home address.

Yes, I had to get face to face with the staff at this location to transfer my membership and confirm my home address with my ID, but they got it done and were quite professional about it.

There was no change to my rate from the previous club. 

This is a very good deal for me since I was not a member here previously because of the higher charge for this Signature Club. 

Thanks to the staff for keeping me a member and handling my situation like they truly cared about my continued business.

I am so happy that I live in the neighborhood now and can visit this LA location frequently now.  This club is huge and has an enormous cardio area.  No more waiting for a treadmill or stair mill machine or being squeezed in between other gym goers.  The area is very spacious and there seems to always be adequate space to hop on a machine of your choosing.  The weight area is another story.  While they have a great selection and multiple machines for each body part the free weight section tends to get pretty crowded.

The club appears to be clean when I visit in the morning or evening.  I have not utilized the pool yet, but it looks nice.  I like that they have a nutrition bar where I can get a shake.

Searching for the right gym in my area is a challenge... This gym was over crowded, I felt like I needed to dress up just to workout. Not the vibe I want while I'm trying to get in shape. If you're young, single and don't want to really workout and get sweaty then this is your gym.

There are leagues for racquetball, Tuesdays 6-8PM for Co-Ed Singles Thursdays 6-8PM for Beginners, with instruction and playing and Saturdays 2-4PM for Women's Only.

Parking garage and good workout equipment.  I have not tried any of the spinning or other classes.

It's a brand-spanking new gym so not too much to complain about. Parking is a little tough during peak hours even with the large parking garage. Sign-up was pretty painless (the bf is a great negotiator), and I only received ONE phone call asking me to sign up with a personal trainer (the free session). There are plenty of cardio machines, weight machines, free weights, etc so you rarely have to wait around even during rush hours. The machines are the brand new, fancy ones with the usual tvs. During evening hours when the sun is starting to dip, the glare from the floor to ceiling windows does make it tough to actually watch tv. Plenty of weight equipment upstairs and floor mat space.

I've gone to a couple of cycling classes and those have been great. A lot of fun. Mainly due to the instructors. Weeknight classes fill up fast so get there early. You'll be ok on Saturdays though.

Locker rooms and bathrooms are well-kept (so I've noticed so far) and there's a sauna in there as well.

Plenty of space in this gym. I've yet to roam to the bball court, racquetball courts, or pool.

This is a signature LA Fitness club, which means it's a "step above" your typical LA fitness club. So basically, it has everything you would want in a regular gym, plus some. 

This location is pretty massive. I think I've only been into one other LA Fitness this size actually. Same setup, really, but still, pretty nice. The place is kept well, so it's clean and there are lots of cardio machines to go around. 

I haven't been to the weight room yet (it's on the second floor) but from what I've heard it can get kind of busy in peak hours.

Speaking of peak hours, I have also heard the parking situation can be crazy at primetime, which is after work. During the day this place isn't too insane but I've seen it at night, and wow. Good on all you brave souls for venturing out to this place with everyone else in Tampa at that time.

I like LA Fitness well enough. The pool is the draw on this location. It's got three big lanes and is good when you need to crosstrain!

I've been a South Tampa Y member for a long time but after letting it go recently decided to try the new LA Fitness to rejuvenate my fitness plans.  I watched construction for weeks, prepurchased my membership, and after many delays I was excited to visit. 

The gym itself is loaded with equipment, the entire bottom floor is loaded with cardio equipment - treadmills, stairmasters and ellipticals. Finding a machine isn't really a problem, even during heavy use times. Spinning and group exercise rooms are also downstairs. Upstairs has a free workout area as well as all your weight and resistance machines. Racquetball is also upstairs. 

One very nice feature of LA Fitness is the pool, it's indoor so no need to worry about temperature or needing sunscreen.  I wish they had some hooks and benches inside though to hang your towel and bag.

I ended up letting it go because I missed the personal vibe I got from the YMCA. At LA Fitness I got a real hard sell at each visit from the personal training staff, even when politely telling them I wasn't interested and to back off. When I found myself having to hide in a back corner treadmill just to get a few minutes of peace I knew enough was enough and let my membership go. Another complaint is the disparity in the pricing, it's kind of like flying an airplane - no one pays the same price for their seat. My "upgraded" plan was supposed to include towels and lockers. They were always out of towels and the lockers were available to everybody, nothing different in that regards so I would definitely recommend to question all the available options before you sign on to anything.

Why one star?
I already was over the staff, the disgusting filth and general overall attitude of everyone. Then the management changed. I was promised things were going to turn around and It would be so much better. "I knew this wasn't true because they fired all the good people, kind of like when you flush the toilet and the turds don't go down. This is what happened. So the turds are still there. 
This is what they do on a daily basis. They never miss a chance to get a workout in. I love waiting for an employee to finish working out while they use 3 machines at a time. Especially when they all look like they want to murder you. Never a smile. So being a trainer you would think they would take care of the gym floor and equipment they use to make a living right? NOPE. They walk by garbage all day and don't even rack their weights. 
The reason I bring all that up is because how can you expect the members to clean up after themselves when the people who run the gym don't!
Onward.... The manager sits on his ass all day. When I ran gyms in college I was walking the floor, cleaning, vacuuming, folding towels constantly. I cant tell you how many times I walk in the gym ask for a towel and they are out!!  OUT? It's what distinguishes you as a supposed signature club and your OUT!!!
Anyway she doesn't have time to get you a towel anyway because it would cut into her texting time. 
I don't need one anyways the floor is so damn dirty on the pool deck and the water is disgusting. Don't worry about limiting pool lane times or anything. Spend 2 hours in there. Even if they had a rule they wont enforce it. 
Wanna workout barefoot?? Go ahead, nobody cares. Get that athletes foot fungus all over the damp carpet. "which is why I love seeing people face down doing pushups, and crunches. It makes me cringe. I could go on all day but hell I made my point......

So here's the breakdown:

Pros:  convenient location, decent amount of equipment to choose from.  Janitorial staff is incredibly friendly (even though I think they could double that staff).

Cons:  Not very clean and maintenance in the machines is lacking.  Front desk staff is either nice or absolutely horribly rude (depends on who you talk to).  I've literally been taken aback by how someone spoke to me.  Perhaps too little pay for the work?  The team can sometimes look miserable.  Take care of your employees and they will take care of your customers.

Hours are limited if you have a crazy schedule, wish there was a way to make it 24 hours.  Pool is far too small.  The hard sell on a personal trainer is exhausting.  

Last but certainly not least is the outrageous effort to cancel your membership.  You have to either mail a form or go in person.  No luck doing it online or over the phone.  Oh and by the way, when you go in person you might wait an hour for the one guy who is allowed to do it (operations manager).  Oh and that person may not do it properly so weeks later you may realize your membership was never cancelled... And back you go. 

Tons of potential... But overall a disappointment.

Update: it's been a week since I "cancelled" and I just received an email that they are charging me again.  Back I go... Another hour wasted to just finish this thing.  The original cancellation never took, now I owe more money.  At 9 months pregnant and being forgotten while I wait for the ops manager again, I just asked if they could finally finish it all if I pay them one last time.  I had to leave because I was about to burst into tears due to frustration.  They were apologetic but at this point I just didn't have the energy to fight anymore.

It's a nice looking gym, but it should have more. 

Once you factor in the signature club premium fee, the additional towel service fee, and the fact that they close an hour earlier than the major competition in the area, this place charges Downtown Powerhouse Gym prices without the service or the equipment. Yes, you get a gym and a pool, but the weight room is not sufficient for power lifters and it's deceptively small. So, good luck training at any time except during off hours. Also, many machines have weight stacks that I swear are designed for only children and the elderly. 

It is very hard for an experienced lifter to get a decent workout in at this gym with any exercise variety.

I have been a member at this gym for the past six months.  The gym is kept clean with the exception of occasional water bottles and paper towels left on the machines. There is a wide variety of classes with decent instructors.  The pool, sauna and basketball and racquetball courts are a plus. The main issue that I have is during peak hours they are often out of towels. I feel that management should make sure these type of things do not occur as they are easily preventable.  All in all, it is a good gym and worth the price if you take advantage of the "Signature" amenities.
Very nice facility! Has 4 racquetball / handball courts and one basketball / volleyball court, swimming pool and jacuzzi, all kind of cardio equipment, free weights and exercise machines.

This is a wonderful facility with a great and caring staff. I wish it was a little bit cheaper but it's a minor gripe given the great quality we're getting from them.  We have our 8yr old and 4yr old son's signed up for a Winter class to keep them active during the cold months.  

We had initially put our 8yr old in the "Fitness" class... he did not enjoy it but stuck it out for the first class.  The teacher approached us afterwards and said she felt he would better enjoy the "Gymnastics" class at the same date/time instead.  It was an easy switch for us and our son couldn't be happier in his new class.  It was great to see the staff want to make sure the kids are challenged but still having fun.

A word on flexibility (double meaning alert!)... The teacher for our youngest son's class has been very easy to work with because of his limb difference (no fingers on his right hand).  She meets his needs without making him feel different or limited... which we TRULY appreciate.

I would recommend Fusion to anyone!

I would not recommend this gymnastics school. My husband and I called a combined 3-4 times starting Dec 1 & including today to get our son a spot in a class with friends who attend. We never received a call back to even confirm there were slots open. I decided to come early today before the class started to get him registered. I filled out all the forms to then be told the class is full and there were no other 5pm options for his age group. I would understand if this was the only contact we had made but to not return phone calls and then also let me get through the paperwork process {when I communicated what class we wanted before taking said forms} is just not okay. I got to leave with a crying child and upsetting his friend as well. Please work on your communication skills and procedures.

The gym space is decent size and has plenty of equipment, watching the kids higher up on the benches is perfect. This is about the only thing I liked about the place.

When we used to go here two years ago they were clearly under staffed and a young teen employee watching a large group of 2-4 year olds didn't work at all. It was supposed to be two employees, but one of them would never show up or quit? The employees here all seemed clearly frustrated and not happy which carries over to how well they can teach and manage the class.

The owner seemed very stand offish and treated the business as a daycare center for her daughter. The daughter would constantly cut in between classes interrupting them or being dangerous. Nobody seemed to care about this at all.

For the price you pay I don't believe it is worth it for younger kids and this is why we left. The majority of the focus is on the older group and everyone else is a dollar sign, not once did I see the owner get involved with the younger kids. Maybe things have improved since then but we won't be returning. This is a shame because the facilities are really nice.

I signed up for Will's classes to help me get me back in shape before my wedding. Will is very motivating, knowledgeable and helpful inside the gym and out. Always available to give advice on nutrition, supplements and goes above and beyond to help you reach your goals. Will is great for anyone regardless of fitness level. He will figure out a plan and exercises that work for you.

Will Nelson really knows what he is doing when it comes to fitness/nutrition for whatever your goals are not to mention just a really good guy! I joined his online 6 week challenge with a number of other guys (all who had different goals from losing weight to staying healthy, to building muscle and everything in between). Will had advice and tips and help for everyone no matter what their goals and helped keep the group engaged with multiple check ins per week to see how everyone was doing.

I had never been able to consistently go to the gym before because I would lose motivation or burn out but Will's program helped keep me engaged and hold me accountable. He lays out a very easy to follow process and allows you to actually create a LIFESTYLE rather than just a fad diet or workout plan. He helps to create a mindset of something that can really change your life. 

I lost 8 pounds in 6 weeks under this program and learned so much more about nutrition than I had ever known before. If you are an experienced health/fitness goer who just needs a little push or someone who has no idea what you are doing, Will's program is definitely for you! If you feel like there is a plethora of information out there and you are overwhelmed or confused, that's how I felt going in and Will helps to simplify it and really help you out. Highly recommend Will for trying to reach any of your fitness/nutrition goals!

I never thought I would be able to get myself to the gym before 7am, but with Will I have found that motivation.  He is very supportive, whatever your ability, and encourages you to meet your goals without being pushy.  The group is small and non-judgmental, exactly what I love about it, everyone is there to workout and get fit.  I have been working out with Will now for six weeks and am so happy with the progress I am making.  Not only is my pre-baby body coming back, but I feel stronger and more in shape than ever before and I owe that all to Will.   I highly recommend anyone wanting to get in shape, to lose weight or to build up their strength to give Will a try, you will not regret it.  It is the best investment you can make.
Very clean, great staff, all the machines you need, affordable, personal trainers are excellent!

I have been going to this gym since March, and I am loving it so far! They have a full gym with everything you need, plus they offer lots of classes. Most are free, but there are some you have to pay extra for. The membership fee is so cheap for what they offer! The facilities are very nice, too. They do lots of promotions, and I have had the chance of doing smaller group training with some of their trainers. All of them are knowledgeable and friendly - the staff is very nice, as well.
Great Gym! Its nice and big, clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. They also offer a good variety of classes and workout options.

Beautiful gym! Always spotless and everything in perfect working order.  The staff is extremely friendly and this place is always open, even on holidays!

The trainers are awesome and always keep you motivated. The TRX and Pilates instructors are fantastic. Beautiful locker room with flat screen in sitting area and steam room. Everything's first class here. I couldn't ask for a better gym in a great location.

The Parks has everything you need. It is new and clean.  The staff is helpful and friendly.  There are tons of classes to choose from. The price per month is competitive with other gyms in the New Orleans area.  I have a great experience every time I go.  If you are considering a gym membership I would definitely check out The Parks.
Impossible to work with Paramount due to an injury and an injury that is signed by a surgeon and physical therapist for the Babycakes. No Louisiana love.

I had been a member here for a number of years but recently quit. The Y has basically ruined a gym that was close to my work and now have to drive out of my way to go to a gym. The prior owners of this gym which was called Level Five Fitness were better running a gym.  For starters.. the spinning classes here at the Great Valley Y have been cut to only two classes per week. They also don't unlock the doors to the fitness studios until the instructors show up usually late. So yo have to waste your time waiting for them. I also find the staff here snobby or just talking among themselves and never once look at you or say hello.  I also fine that their mentoring program for kids is more important than the actual paying members. They let the kids on the machines and take up valuable work out time from paying members These kids are just playing on the equipment and the "mentors'' are never really around.  Its shame they have ruined a gym that is so convenient to so many. The paying memberships have declined drastically after the Y took this place over. I felt like I was one of the last ones still going there from the 7 years I had gone there.  So, if you want annoying non-paying kids around you and very scarce classes this is the place for you.
