A good - less crowded - alternative to the Upper Main Line YMCA.  Less crowded weights room and cardio machine area.  Group exercise classes less crowded, too.  If you're a UMLYMCA member and fed up with crowds, try this location.  If you come out to Route 29 for Wegmans, this is almost next door.  
PS: I don't care about "community out-reach."  I'm looking for a work-out.  This is a decent place to get one.

I was beginning my long term stay at a hotel across the street, so I started searching for nearby Gyms on Yelp, but this one which was right under my nose did not show up. I later saw it on my way to Baxters to have healthy beer. So have duly input it for you all - you're welcome.

So far it's been great, never too busy, lots of equipment and it's bright with lots of windows. It's especially nice if you're staying at Homewood Suites since their gym sucks.

I love the Y overall, and I don't even mind that this gym is more of a "typical gym" than the full Y. In fact, sometimes, when I just want to work out, I go here because there are less kids, less noise, and you can just concentrate on working out. However, the 2 star rating is due to the complete lack of service. The employees are not very friendly and are always late, which is super annoying at 5am, when you want to get in, get out, and get to work. In addition, if you do require assistance or have a question, don't expect from the people working there.

I'm taking off one star because last time I was there, the gym was closed, even though their hours of operation clearly said that they were open, and there was no sign explaining why it's closed. I don't understand why this location is so unreliable.

For as cheap as it is, it's good enough. The locker rooms are surprisingly clean, and I've never had to wait for a machine, even at peak hours. But I absolutely agree with all of the comments about the staff. They could at least pretend to not hate their lives. Also, kudos for being open during all of the snowstorms this year.

24/7 cardio equipment and weights for $10/month.  Clean, spacious, and you can typically find equipment, even during peak hours.  Locker rooms are spotless, unlike a lot of gyms.  Bravo, Planet Fitness!

I don't know what the Screaming Squirrels that gave this location bad reviews are talking about. The front desk staff are very friendly and accommodating. The locker room and bathrooms are well maintained. The equipment is well kept and very clean PF personnel are constantly cleaning and members are good at wiping down the equipment.
Very cheap and good for a quick workout, but nowhere near a top-of-the-line gym. Why do I feel like the staff judge me here? Oh, that's right, because they laugh at me when I walk in.

I've been a member for about 5 years now and the facility has gone downhill noticeably. The staff is indifferent. On any given day half a dozen treadmills don't work. And not all of the ones that aren't working have  a sign on them saying they're out of service but when you actually run on them the deck cuts off and on very quickly making it impossible to continue the workout. This could be dangerous. Half of the audio devices on the treadmills connecting to the TV's don't work so don't count on listening to the televisions.  You would think one of those bored staff members would actually get on a piece of equipment and actually test them to see if they work. Including the audio.  On any given day one of the three giant overhead fans isn't working. I have the Black Card membership and visit other PF's around the country when I travel for work and I have to say the Pottstown facility is the worst I've been to so far.  This place is in need of a big refresh - management, staff, and equipment. The only reasons I give it 2 stars is the reasonable cost of membership and the potential to turn it around.

Price is obviously good. This place can be hit or miss. Some other gym goers can be rude by sitting at the only pec fly machine or any of the few machines and texting while you wait. One thing that really grosses me out is the fact that people do not clean the machines after using them. Every time I go to this gym there is at least one or two people who don't clean their machine when they are done. 

Other than a few things here and there the place is ok. My advice go early in the morning!

Pottstown planet fitness is the best! During my travels, I have gone to a few others which were nice but not to the level as Pottstown. It is huge! Lots of machines! The best trainer ever, Kelsey smith. She has taken me to a new level. The staff is friendly and helpful, the facility is clean and open 24/7. The hydro massage beds are the best after a tough workout. This is my home club and I wouldn't go anywhere else. The cost cannot be beat.

Decent enough for the price. I agree with Denise about the staff. It is clearly obvious the majority of them do not enjoy their jobs and are quite rude to the customers. I would say there are possibly 3 employees that are actually wonderful and greet you pleasantly when you come in. The flourtown planet fitness is a much better location to check out if you have the chance to. They have more free weights, balance balls, even a whole ab section.

My home Planet Fitness is in Roxborough which in fairness is a brand new facility in comparison.  I also have been going to the one in Phoenixville on occasion. My two cents: make the trip to one of these locations before going to the Pottstown location. 

In short, the Pottstown location is a disappointment.  The equipment has been used and abused and seems to be in desperate need of a makeover.  Not all of the equipment of course, but the equipment that is most commonly used.  My treadmill sounded like a three-wheeled shopping cart.  Some of the workout benches I used had rips in them.  The only thing more annoying was the lunk alarm.  Overall, after frequenting the other two PF locations, this one is like a flip phone compared to a smartphone.

Let me preface this next comment with this: I by no means come off as a "gym rat" or a "lunk" as PF like to say.  I am 5'11", 170lbs and your pretty average run of the mill guy. It doesn't matter what I look like, point of the matter is I am a respectful gym-goer and also disapprove of intimidating gym behavior you may see in other gyms.   I "get" the lunk alarm and what it represents but what I don't get is how prematurely pushing the "lunk alarm" to warn of disapproved behavior does not make people in the gym feel even more uncomfortable and awkward.  I was in the free weight section and had a dumbbell standing tall on its side.  I went to shift it and fell to its side creating a mild thump.  And when I say mild, I mean mild.  A 25lb weight falling on its side from a floor position accidentally did not justify creating an even bigger scene by pushing the lunk alarm.  I almost would have been embarrassed except I was so obviously not demonstrating inappropriate behavior that I didn't care, nor did I think anyone thought it was from me.  Quite simply, the noise should have been perhaps noted and observed, but it was clearly an accident (a mild one at that) and not a representation of intimidating behavior.  If it repeated again and again...that is another story.  Now, instead of having a member utilize that location out of convenience, PF Pottstown is now getting a bad review and one less person going there.  

So from the equipment that is ripped up and worn out to that experience in within 45 minutes of my first visit, I will drive the extra twenty minutes to go to the much better Phoenixville location when I am in this area.

Benn going there for years. Understood that Covid changed things. But this is a gym. People are sweating, getting dehydrated while working out. SO they cut the water to the Fountains? How safe is that ? We are preventing Covid by causing dehydration? Cutting off the water is a bigger health hazard.

Some of the most unhelpful people I have ever met! 
I don't understand how this planet fitness as gotten so unhelpful. Workout is someone we should all do every day however coming here is dreadful and it's takes a toll on a person working to be better. However it is the only place open at 4am so I am stuck here and to another gym opens up earlier or I moved to Philly! If you can go to a different gym please do! The one star is for the hours!

Reply to "Reply" from Customer Service: Your "reply" does not address my complaint. At all. If you allow people to not wear masks "when actively working out", you are allowing them to spread aerosol droplets when they are exhaling most deeply PRECISELY BECAUSE they are "actively working out". What part of that do you not understand? 
In view of your very unhelpful "reply", I am now reducing my review to 1-star.
==================================
Original review:
It's a decent gym for the price. They're not LA Fitness, but then they don't try to be, and I really do appreciate the affordability.

If this was pre-Covid I'd give it more stars. I appreciate that they let members suspend their memberships for a few months, and not have to cancel them, while the pandemic is still going on (which it is). But I'm very disappointed in their corporate HQ's decision to allow customers to not have to wear masks "while actively working out":

popculture.com/trending/...

It's a ridiculous policy - it's exactly when people are working out that they huff and puff and exhale deeply - and exhale the most aerosol droplets from their lungs, which then circulates all over the place! So, until either they change their policy to require masks 100% of the time - including while working out - or until the Covid risk is 100% over - we will keep our family's memberships suspended, or we might even cancel our memberships.  All because of an unwise corporate policy. It's really a shame.

It's a decent gym for the price. They're not LA Fitness, but then they don't try to be, and I really do appreciate the affordability.

If this was pre-Covid I'd give it more stars. I appreciate that they let members suspend their memberships for a few months, and not have to cancel them, while the pandemic is still going on (which it is). But I'm very disappointed in their corporate HQ's decision to allow customers to not have to wear masks "while actively working out":

https://popculture.com/trending/news/planet-fitness-walks-back-mandated-face-mask-policy-during-workouts/

It's a ridiculous policy - it's exactly when people are working out that they huff and puff and exhale deeply - and exhale the most aerosol droplets from their lungs, which then circulates all over the place! So, until either they change their policy to require masks 100% of the time - including while working out - or until the Covid risk is 100% over - we will keep our family's memberships suspended, or we might even cancel our memberships.  All because of an unwise corporate policy. It's really a shame.

Decent location to check out if you're in the area or live here.  Very clean, a bit smaller then your normal planet fitness location however, they have a wide array of machines for both cardio and strength training.

A few improvements would be to update a few of the machines.  Newer planet fitness locations have w updated equipment reasons for my 4/5 and not a 5.  Also, the WiFi isn't great typically slow and horrible to connect to however, this is an ongoing issue at least locations.

Overall highlights:
1. Clean!!!
2. Great location if you're in between the Pottstown/Boyertown areas
3. Decent selection of machines for both cardio and strength training 
4. Friendly staff 
5. Not super crowded for an after work workout
Horrible staff. The heat in this place as well ad the humidity makes it insane and unbearable.  The atmosphere is unhealthy.
24 hour hour gym, plenty of cardio machines.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because some of the employees are rude.

Some of the most unhelpful people I have ever met! 
I don't understand how this planet fitness as gotten so unhelpful. Workout is someone we should all do every day however coming here is dreadful and it's takes a toll on a person working to be better. However it is the only place open at 4am so I am stuck here and to another gym opens up earlier or I moved to Philly! If you can go to a different gym please do! The one star is for the hours.. 
so because of this review the cops were called on me today. So please don't give them a bad review.

New owners bring true pride of ownership.  The place is small but had pretty much all you need.  If you are looking for a small, less busy, no screaming muscle monsters, check out this place.  Open 24 hrs.  Price is about $30/ month.  I will never go back to LA Fitness.  


New owner Mike is fantastic.  He just painted the inside and front of the building himself.  The place is meticulous and he is friendly and knowledgeable.  You just can't beat what you get for the money.  Plus, it's open all the time for members.   Now we that is convenient!

New owners bring true pride of ownership.  The place is small but had pretty much all you need.  If you are looking for a small, less busy, no screaming muscle monsters, check out this place.  Open 24 hrs.  Price is about $30/ month.  I will never go back to LA Fitness.

Won't be joining. Looked at a several local facilities to go to and get personal training. This is definitely not the place for that. Found what I was looking for elsewhere. 

Won't be back!

Typical Snap Fitness. If theres one thing that separates this one from the other locations is that it offers a small punching bag and a tanning bed. 

The location is ok, you shouldn't have trouble finding parking space. 

The gym has the usual equipment, nothing modern. The treadmills could use an alignment, tried three different ones and they all felt imbalanced. 

Overall, its not one of the better Snap locations that Ive been to, but its not horrible either, just ok for me.

I have been coming to TZ for almost three years! It continues to add a variety of classes and constantly adapts to challenge even the regulars. There are classes as early as 5am to fit anybody's schedule. I have taken classes at multiple gyms and this one has provided the best experience. There are classes that cater to everybody's fitness level and the instructors are approachable. The owners Scott and Leslie are always quick to respond to questions and concern via email. My favorite classes are boot camp and afterburn. If you are a fitness enthusiast, TZ is more than worth the money.

I've only been going for 2 months, but my wife has been going for over a year. She loves it and I finally decided to try it out (after not having worked out for nearly 10 years--no joke). There are great trainers who are so impressive in their athletic abilities that it's easy to be in awe of them--but they are so personable and down to earth that they really make you feel like they want to help you on your fitness journey.

I like the format of the varied classes. You know you're in for a hard workout no matter what you choose. There's good music and before you know it, the hour is done and you've undoubtedly burned a ton of calories, cleansed your body of toxins, and sweated through all over.

I've taken boot camp, spin classes, hiit, tone, strength, tabata, and their afterburn classes. My goal was to be going 2-3 times a week, but I've found myself going 5-6 times because the classes are so addictive, easy to schedule, and fun. 

I definitely recommend it.

I love Tone Zone!  Their Real Ryder class is absolutely amazing and fantastic workout.  It's a super clean and new space and all of the instructors are great.  They really push you to work as hard as you can for the length of the class and you will feel the affects of it for days after.  I've done both the Real Ryder class as well as Spin and during the winter months, the Real Ryder class is wonderful as you feel as though you're out on the road again and not stuck on your cycling trainer for hours on end.  There are so many different classes to choose from, I just wish I had more time to attend all of them!
Took a class using Class pass this week.  Great environment/facility.  The owner and instructor were very personable and welcoming.  The class itself was excellent.  I would definitely return.

So glad I found and joined this place!  Times of the classes are extremely convenient, there's a wide array of work-outs to choose from, there's a phone app that makes signing up for classes super easy, and every single person that works there is dedicated as it definitely shows.

Found this gym while on a business trip thanks to classpass! I did the trampoline class and was immediately hooked!! So much fun, a great way to start the day :) I liked it so much I immediately starting researching to determine if there were similar classes in St. Louis. 

The instructor was great and had a great playlist to match the intensity of the class. 

I can't wait to go back next time I am in the area.
Love Tone Zone! Scott does a wonderful job!

3 stars because the first class was great, welcoming, inviting and the trainer was nice to newbies like me. The workout was hard, exhausting, but not bad.

Small building, kind of expensive. Parking is annoying

2nd class was awful. Different trainer, different building, different class/set up. No welcome, no introduction, not even a hi. Just walk in and have 8 people stare at you like you're a freak. I felt so unwelcome and confused with what the class was about that I just left. There is no point in working out when you feel uncomfortable and unwelcome. I will just work out at home.

I love Tone Zone.  I had been working out at another local gym and needed the extra push.  I decided to give Tone Zone a try based on someone else's recommendations here on Yelp.  I love the bootcamp and the cycling classes. Highly recommend for those who are local to Conshy.

Fantastic facility in a very well thought out and clean space. Excellent air filtration system which is super important to me with my exercise induced asthma. I've taken classes lead by Ann and David and they are each the best of the best! High energy, patient and knowledgeable trainers in terrific shape. A variety of classes and times plus a very reasonable per-class price. I love it here!

So much fun! I started going to the Wed night tabata classes last month- and now I'm obsessed. I can't wait for the new studio to open because I also love the ballet burn class. I'm so happy I finally joined!!

ToneZone is probably my favorite place for fitness classes, ever.   I've been coming here about once a week since I started working down the street in Conshy about a year ago, and absolutely love it.

All of the classes I've been to and all of the instructors have been top-notch.  High energy, great workout, awesome music, and best of all fun.  My favorites are Wednesday/Friday Warrior, Boot Camp, and Cardio Kickboxing.  I'd say I'm in pretty good shape (I also rock climb, run, go to a regular gym)... and the classes still all kick my a$$.  However they're really designed for you to push yourself personally whatever fitness level you're currently at -- and there have been plenty of beginners, moms-to-be, people trying to get back into shape, etc. that attend classes and do really well.

As I mentioned, all of the instructors I've had have been awesome (Scott, Frank, Erika, Regina, Anne, ...).  They all seem really into it, have a lot of energy, and make sure you're really pushing yourself as best you can.  And they mix up the classes and exercises so even the "same" class is totally different week to week, which keeps it fun.  The playlists they use are also basically the best workout music ever -- great upbeat mixes of both current and classic pop songs, that also always change every class.

ToneZone is also extremely clean, has great new equipment, and is always a comfortable workout temperature with AC at high 60s (which is very important when it's over 90 out).  The Elm St. location is a little smaller than the newer one on Ridge, but still a great space.  I generally go to whichever one has a class I want to take at the time I'm looking for, on any given day.

Woooo ToneZone!

What Mike has me do in 45 minutes I could not do in two hours on my own. He pushes you, but understands your limitations. Because of working out with Mike, I am healthier and much stronger at age 43 than I was at 23 or 33.

I have been a client of Mike's for over 5 years now and all I can say is DO IT!  If you are ready to turn your life around, Mike is the best trainer to help you make it happen.  He is patient while pushing you to achieve your best!  You will never be bored with his workouts as they are never the same - he keeps your interest while working every muscle.  If you are looking for a trainer that is not intimidating but still pushes you to succeed Mike is your answer.

Mike is the first personal trainer we've worked with and we think he's awesome.  He pushes us enough, but also works us within our limitations.  My husband and I are not athletes, but needed help with our exercise routines.  He's helped us both a lot and is fun to work with.

My wife and I recently moved to the area, and we are self proclaimed fitness fanatics, so the first order of business was to find a gym. First off, this is a locally owned fitness center, not some nationwide globo-gym, so temper your misguided ideas that you need every machine under the sun to get a good workout. My wife and I have had countless gym memberships, and we compete in powerlifting competitions, so I like to think we are good judges when it comes to gyms. This place is the best place in town, we also have memberships at Gold's, yet we choose to come here instead. The facility itself is always clean, even if its a little cluttered some times. But, there is plenty of equipment here from dumbbells from 2.5 lbs all the way up to 100 lbs. They have a couple of squat racks, and benches, and machines for practically every bodypart along with tons of cardio equipment. Every interaction we have had at this gym has been exceptional, whether its other members, or employees. We've made friends with members, and employees as well. There is every demographic being represented in this facility, there are older members who enjoy their social interactions, younger members who enjoy their social interaction, and others in-between who come in to get a workout and leave. The employees at this gym are all nice, courteous, and helpful. My wife and I will be moving again soon, and we are sad that we won't be using this facility anymore. We wish this place, and all their members and employees would just up and move with us.

Great, family owned gym. Friendly atosmosphere, helpful staff. Been a member for three years and love it there. It is a smaller gym but waiting on equipment is rare.. I have had more times of waiting for equipment or machines at gyms with 5 times the amount of equipment. The fact that it is smaller is what appeals to me. I can work out without intimidation and the staff gets to know you and cares about your progress.  Highly recommend it.

Main Street Gym is a perfect fit for the historic St. Charles area.   The gym has everything you need for your workouts including cardio, tredmills, free weights, Machines, bosus and so much more.  MSG has tanning, group ex classes, a juice bar, personal trainers and the people are super friendly.   The gym is very nice and the locker rooms are spectacular.  A lot of thought and care goes into making this gym exceptional.  Skip the corporate gyms & give MSG a tr

This gym is truly amazing. The location is in such a beautiful area. The staff as well as the patrons are friendly and always willing to help. For a single female, I actually feel safe and comfortable here which was a huge change from the pick-up scene gyms I was use to being in.

The equipment is always clean and the gym has no weird odors like some of them do. The tanning bed is a great pick-me-up after an intense workout. The locker room looks like my bathroom at home; very cozy! Things like shampoo and conditioner are provided for you as well as a hair dryer. I love this!

Best part is, the personal training is incredibly affordable; an absolute steal for what you get! My personal trainer is John Baker. He is pheonominal! He truly cares about his customers reaching their goals. He will push you but never to were you will feel uncomfortable. Each personal training session with him I accomplish things I would have never thought I could do on my own. 

Join the Main Street Gym family! You won't be disappointed!

P.S. The juice bar is amazing. You gotta try John's peanut butter protein shake! YUM!

Wonderful variety of free classes at convent times. Plenty of equipment for whatever I want to workout that day. Andi, Adam, Allison, Wendy and all the staff are amazing, encouraging, and knowledgeable. Only 30$ a month.

Have been a member for 3 or 4 yrs now, trying to get back in the habit of working out. Have never been a member of the large chain gyms, so I don't have another experience to compare it to.
With that said it is a nice gym, generally not crowded, but when it is crowded it can be a hassle to work out because the equipment you want may be in use by someone that doesn't understand the concept of sharing. Earlier this year they rearrange a lot of the equipment to make room for a large barbell setup. The new layout put equipment that I used all the time in odd locations, and now some things are squeezed for space.
The one thing that drives me crazy is the music they play...the base clientele here are mostly older 50+..we don't listen to Pop, Hip Hop, Rap Crap, Disco, Dance Club, Top 40 14 yr old mind numbing music! But maybe that is what the big chain gyms play also..I don't know, but when I am there just some good old rock n roll, blues, or Motown would do.

Here's what I like about the gym:
Everyone is nice, from the regulars to the trainers.
Equipment is in good shape.
Reasonably priced

Here's what I don't like:
The trainers and the owner like to occupy the only squat rack in the entire price for an hour at a time so they can stretch out their trainees. They put a mat down and spend the rest of their session entrenched in front of the squat machine.
They also use the only bench press as a apparatus for attaching various bands so their trainees can do curls on a bosu ball. 

It's a small gym, so there isn't much extra room, but all of these things they're doing could easily be done elsewhere. Instead, they occupy the only bench press and squat rack for purposes that aren't what the manufacturer intended. It'd be fine if it was only for a few minutes, but it's usually 30 minutes to an hour. 

If you're looking for a serious workout you're at the wrong place. If you're looking for a low-key environment without a big crowd you'd probably fit in. Just please don't place a yoga mat in front of the squat rack and spend an hour there.

Okay Guys- yeah-- I just received a letter from the Gym- FROM THE OWNER-  She apologized and is resolving the situation. I feel she meant it and will contact the bank with a full refund if I take off the negative comments of her business.   I appreciate her taking action.   This is all I wanted. Hopefully she talks to John baker and any of her other employees that do not understand the gym policies or the LAW
  Thank you all for supporting me and writing reviews and advice to Facebook-  See we can DO SOMETHING- when we are treated poorly.  Thanks again

This gym has gone thru an owner change, and a complete make over. It looks like the make over has run all of the clients away that I used to see here. When it was owned by Wendy Black this was a fun place to work out, and everyone that work here knew every member by name and they would greet you and were always up for conversation. Now the staff just stares at you, no greeting, no welcome, no good bye have a nice day, nothing. Very stand standoffish now, except for a young lady that work Sundays. She always has a smile for everyone. The music they play continues to be too loud and the most annoying music I have ever heard. If you wear your own ear buds, you can't enjoy your own music for the loud back ground noise. The equipment is pretty antiquated compared to a place like 24hr Fitness or other large gyms. A change in staff and new equipment would greatly improve the atmosphere. If you have difficultly going up and down stairs there is no elevator to get to the basement workout room and locker rooms! Seems like that would be in violation of the Americans with Disabilities Act. There are definitely nicer gyms around town.

Though the toughest workout Philly has to offer, the 50 minutes flies by.....thank goodness. The best part is hearing in 22 seconds you can high five your neighbor when you are done. Big shoutout to the manager Alex who is badass!

THIS CLASS WAS HARD! I felt the burn in some of my muscles immediately because the focus of that day was arms so my arms were crying after this class. My abs, not as much. But fast forward 24 hours. The pain slowly crept in and got more and more intense. It was a burn that lasted a few days and that's when I knew I had gotten a great workout. The staff was awesome - super friendly and the instructor was really great. I loved that the class ended by high-fiving everyone around you. It was really cool and an awesome way to  make a community. A few reasons why I never went back to the studio. 1) Price: my student budget cannot afford $30/class and there's no student discount; this was the biggest issue. 2) Distance: this place is so far away from where I live and not even on my route home from school; I'd just have to go too far out of the way to do it and I'm not sure that I'm disciplined to do it. 3) Contact: after the first class I wanted to try a few more and there was a 5 for $125 deal for first timers; I emailed back and forth with the studio manager and at the end of the conversation asked to purchase the package, but never heard back from her. I even called a few times to get the purchase done and heard nothing. Honestly, despite the other two reasons, I was willing to give it a try but since I never heard back I just figured it wasn't meant to be. 

I think studios like this are great - the reformer is an insane machine to workout on but it gets the results that you might be looking for so if you're willing to splurge, I highly recommend trying at least one class. Hopefully your experiences getting the new student discount will be better than mine!

Ever feel like you're about to pass out or vomit during a workout? Me neither..until I tried Solidcore.
This is NOT for the faint of heart. You spend 55 minutes working muscles that you've only heard of, and believe me, it's a game changer. 
Ever had your abs shake so hard you feel you're about to collapse on yourself? Well you're about to. But don't think this is a bad thing. You look around and see everyone on Sweatlana (what the Solidcore team calls the torture machines that whip your abs into shaky, sweaty submission) and you feel a sense of community that comes from knowing exactly how much pain every single person in that room is in. 
Perhaps the biggest incentive to come to one of these classes is how you feel about your body afterwards. Almost everyone suffers from thinking they're not 'fit enough' (whatever that means), but after one of these classes, you want to pat yourself in the back for making it through something that's insanely difficult, and feel that you're basically doing everything you can to honor the body that you have. 
Try it. You will not regret it.

If you want to find muscles you never even knew existed and rock them hard, [solidcore] is the place to go.  The first class is tough, but it's so addicting to want to go back and be better the next time.  I started off doing a lot of the modifications on my knees (which the instructors are helpful in showing you) and have been able to work myself up to being on my toes (at least for a portion of the moves haha).  The 50 mins goes by in a flash.  Every muscle in your body will hurt, but it makes you feel like a rockstar.  Alex and Patrice are two instructors you can't miss in my opinion - so motivating and helpful as you get started.  Definitely give [solidcore] a try, you won't be disappointed!

No issues with the workout here at all. I've done workouts on the megaformer plenty of times and I thought it would be similar. It is, but this 10x harder, in a good way. My only issue is with some of the coaches. I have a bad back so sometimes I have to make concessions. I guess I have to make sure to tell the coaches beforehand if I need to do something different because of my back. Some coaches are ok with it, and some give me dirty looks. Or sometimes you are completely ignored if you dare to use the white resistance band instead of the grey with their "10 class" rule. Today one of the coaches refused to add weight to the upper body section of the class when she moved everyone else's. Really? So I had to stop and add them myself, which annoyed me since I lost workout time during the VERY QUICK transitions. Speaking of those, I sometimes can't transition that fast, again because of my back, and the reps are halfway over by the time I get settled. All in all, a great workout, but I'm not sure if it just a matter of sticking to only going to classes that have certain coaches or accepting that Solidcore might just be too advanced for me.

Don't come to SolidCore if you're looking for an easy workout. Come to SolidCore if you seek a CHALLENGING and highly effective workout without the impact on your joints. This is the opposite of boot camp. The antithesis of Crossfit. Here, everything is different from what we have been programmed to think is an ideal workout: the slower you go, the harder you're working. And despite the jaw-dropping price, the effectiveness of this workout combined with the virtual lack of stress on the body made me jump at getting an unlimited monthly membership. When I do this workout, I sweat like crazy, I'm sore right after and the day after, but I am never in any pain like I was with other workouts. My first class was so difficult, I could barely do any of the moves without collapsing! I have been coming since January and I now do it 3 to 5 times a week, and go for a 2-4 mile run the days in between for sustained cardio -- gone are the days I run 6 or 8 miles, due to my SolidCore workouts burning my muscles out so I can now only run slower and shorter distances. I believe the older I get, the more my body will reward me for choosing a workout that gives me strength without the impact.

WOW. This class will make you work muscles that you did not even know existed. Your body will cringe and cry and BURN but it's all worth it in the end. 

Solidcore is basically lagree Pilates plus with slightly different reformers. Would recommend arriving to class a little bit early to go over the machine if you haven't used one of these before. 

Sarah was great! She makes sure your form is correct Music is upbeat and time goes by quickly! 

Downside: it is pretty pricey; I think the classes start at $30 each and get slightly lower with the packages. First class is $15 though! Also, there are only 12 reformers and the last class is at 6:30, which makes it very popular for the after work crowd. 

HIGHLY recommend for ladies who are really trying to tone and carve out the right curves! You will FEEL it the next day guaranteed!

Went to my first Solidcore class on Sept 10 and ever since my first class, I am addicted and cannot stop going back. Today I took my 10th class with Coach Patrice at 6 am and immediately I was sweating. You will feel your body shaking during and after class. Be warn your glutes, thighs, abs and arms will be sore for days after. Is a nice change from the outdoor bootcamp class that I take. Now I am debating unlimited or need more class package?

Oh. My. God. I consider myself to be in pretty good shape, frequenting Flywheel and PureBarre weekly. But I have NEVER experienced such a challenging group fitness experience. Within the first five minutes, well, actually the entire class, I thought about whether the embarrassment from leaving the class early was worth sparing myself from the shaking, trembling pain I was experiencing in my ass/thighs/ego. If you're looking for a challenging class that will make you literally feel the progress you're making toward your fitness goals, this is it. Will be going back ASAP

Luigi Says-I have done Platoon for 7 years.  It is the finest workout for joints and the cardio-vascular system.  It is fun and what else can you do at 6 am to take care of yourself.  You are guaranteed a trained instructor to teach you the correct way to perform an exercise.  The instructors are creative and rarely repeat exercises.  It is outstanding 52 weeks a year.  You should take care of yourself-don't flat line at an indoor gym.  This is the best!!

My trainer, Kara B., was great. She kept me on track, helped me gain muscle, and worked out adaptations to accommodate my past injuries. Very knowledgeable and motivating. I highly recommend her and the other trainers at Platoon.
The facility was always clean and the manager was easy to get a hold of. Great location for people working around Old City/Center City.

This review is for the Platoon Boot camp at the Art Museum. 

I have been doing it for the past couple years and would recommend it to anyone.  The group of people that work out are very friendly and range in ages from 20's to 70's.  For $115.00 monthly fee, you can work out at any of their locations 6 days a week which rounds out to about $5.00 a an hour long session.  I think that's a fair price since most personal training sessions are like $50.00 and above.  Basically the week days are split up to cater to certain body parts.. Monday is lower body workout, Tuesday is upper body workout, Wednesday is cardio day, Thursday is lower body workout, Friday is upper body workout and Saturday is whatever the teacher wants to do.  They break up the workouts by always moving and changing things up so your body never gets used to 1 particular workout.  There are also 2 different groups.  There is a phase 1 and a phase 2 group.  Phase 1 does more modified workouts than phase 2 and you have your choice as to what group you would like to work out in.  Some days if I'm hung over, I'll do phase 1.  It's completely up to you.  The instructors are all VERY well versed on anything that has to do with form, fitness, etc.  If you have any questions or aren't doing a particular excercise correctly..they will let you know in a nice way.  Just recently I needed help on doing arm circles above my head..my hand eye coordination sucks..it was funny.  They also motivate you when you are slacking or when they know you are about to quit.  Even a little " come on guys!  keep moving!" can really lift your spirits when you think you are about to die.  It also doesn't hurt that you can look out over the  the beautiful city while you are getting your ass kicked..or look at Rocky's Statue for motivation!
Love Platoon. Steve Cornely is the best. In my 50's and I FEEL GREAT,

I've been taking Platoon's free classes at the Comcast Center for the past four weeks and I absolutely love them. The trainers, Michelle and Malik, are awesome and inspirational. 

I'll admit, I begrudgingly went to the second class dreading the various cycles we had gone through the week before. I assumed that because the classes were free, they would be exactly the same. Wrong! Every single class has been different. Each has been painful in its own special way, but for me, not knowing what's next makes it easier to push through. This has kept me going back for more week after week. 

Although I already have a gym membership and pay for another boot camp in NJ, I am seriously considering looking into Platoon's programs.
Locations at both Ina Rd and Oracle Rd have equipment that is out dated and or needs repair.  If in need of repairs the average time to complete the repairs is at least 3-4 weeks.

Evette is the best employee la fitness has had working at the front desk. She always greets you with a smile on her face and has a great positive attitude. Don't listen to the negative reviews I have been coming to this location for over two years and haven't had a bad experience.

I hadn't been there recently but finally visited last week and want to reiterate how great this Fitness Center at this location still is.  I stopped off when I arrived in Tucson, asked for a visitor's pass and they accommodated me in a flash.  They have the same clean locker rooms, the same competent staff, and the same equipment.  They even had the same gentleman who goes there to socialize but not exercise.  My only complaints are the hours are too short on weekends.  I would have gone there on Saturday and Sunday evening if they were open.  The best time to go seems to be between 0700 and 0900 when it's not very crowded and a lot of equipment is available.

Gotta move it back up to a "4."  I went there last week and the manager took care of me and I was able to work out with now problem.  Clean facility, good selection of equipment, raquetball courts, spin classes, basketball, arerobics -- it has it all.  I just wish they had longer hours on weekends so I can go there before I go to my thing at the Tucson mall.  My only complaint is one fellow who stands at the equipment and talks politics, weather, the tile on his roof, his ethnic status to anyone who will listen and then takes up a whole section of the locker room when he's in there.  But then what gym doesn't have his type?

Still going here after over 3 months.  Very crowded after work.  The fees are reasonable though and it has a pool so I've been happy with it.  Most of the other people going here have been friendly.  There are two in Tucson, the one I go to is by the Park Mall at Wilmot & Broadway.

Been member here since they first opened. They just did huge renno (without warning) but you'd never know the people who laid out/purchased the new equipment had ever been to a gym. Oh but they did add a useless sitting lounge area in the front. If they changed it back I would maybe say 4 stars.

Was there last week again on a visitors pass.  It's remarkable to not even live in the area and go to a place twice a year (at the most) and still have the staff recognize me.  The same folks on the gym floor.  The gentleman who likes to talk about everything and anything to his buddies is still there doing the same -- he even spent about ten minutes on the treadmill one day.  For what little exercise he does, he sure packs like he's going to the olympic tryouts -- two lockers stuffed with his stuff.  He's a nice fellow but I don't like to chat ad-infinitum about nothing in particular.  The staff is efficient and consistent.  If a person leaves, another competent person replaces them.  Some of these places seem to have different people every week.  Consistency allows this club to focus on the little things to improve the workout experience.  My only complaints is that they need longer hours on weekends and one of their paper towel dispensers was broken.  However, for cleanliness and competency of the staff they still deserve a "5."

This location is great.   It seems to be kept up and maintained.  This is a bigger LA Fitness and can handle the larger crowds.  It gets too busy around 5 to get most stuff done during Mondays and Tuesdays, but later or earlier times are not  a problem.

Lots of classes and a very clean locker room.

My only complaint would be for LA Fitness to enforce members to wipe off machines and benches like other gyms I have joined.  They have antibacterial cleaner and paper towels for everyone to use, but I never see anyone using them.  In fact, when you do go to wipe down machines prior to another person using it, people often look at you weird.  Anyway, that is the only complaint to what is a great gym in the neighborhood.

My boyfriend and I got gym memberships here a couple months ago and I'm a fan. There's lots of equipment and never a wait for machines. I also really love the classes, BodyWorks Plus Abs is my fave. Kelli and Emily are great instructors!

This place has a lot of equipment, which is the only plus about these clubs. I've seen over weight people being talked down to by trainers, heard horror stories and have personally been swindled by the sales staff. 
Also a lot of gyms don't charge activation fees. This place may have a lot of equipment, but being in this environment is not worth it.
First time here!!! Very clean and well maintenance. Better than the location near tucson mall! Guess what im doing??! Leg/thighs work out!

Been coming here for the past 8-9 months, love this location! Very convenient since it's near work. I usually go on my lunch break or right after work for a quick workout. The staff is always courteous and friendly. And since I've been going there for a while now, know me by name. 

This facility has a couple of racquetball courts, a basketball court, a fitness room-for fit classes, separate spinning class room, sauna in each men's & women's locker room, and a pool in addition to all the latest fitness equipment and weights you need to get your workout on!

I enjoy the Zumba classes when I can make it. Leta, the instructor, is fun and very lively like all Zumba instructors I know! As with anything, it takes a few classes to get used to the moves. But it's fun learning! It's probably even more fun watching us trying! Lol. Class schedules are available online or at the facility if you're interested. Other classes are offered as well. (Spin & cross-fit)  Once in a while they offer quick workshops on the equipment they have on hand and how to use them...pretty cool & informative!

Membership is fairly cheap as well. Check your health insurance at work. I have UnitedHealthcare, and LA Fitness is one of their health & wellness partners. I get a $10 fitness reimbursement for going to the gym at least 12 times every month! So going to the gym is even sweeter!  

All in all, I like coming here. The associates are friendly and helpful, & so are the patrons! There are a lot of machines available, so no waiting either! Come and give it a try! Your body will thank you... =)

Dropped my membership after about 9 months. 

The physical space of the gym is well maintained; I agree with most reviews about the cleanly state of the gym.  However, the staff at the front desk is young, ostensibly arrogant, and casually disrespectful. I dropped my membership after waiting for the two young men working at the front desk to finish their 2-3 minute conversation about getting drunk so they could scan my membership card and continue talking as if there were no paying customers present.

I'm updating them to a five because of Jessie, their manager.  He went out of his way to be helpful and to arrange a visitor's pass.  He even remembered me even though it had been over 6 mos since I talked with him.  The place is clean and well maintained (although they do need to check their antibacterial cleanser dispensers more often during their busy times) and the equipment all works.  To top it off, that fellow who likes to stand around the men's locker room, equipment, etc. and talk forever about nothing wasn't around anymore.  However, he's been replaced by a fellow that has a gym bag so huge it would get him kicked off SW airlines.  Said fellow uses up most of the bench in the men's room.  Oh, well, we can't win them all.  Kudos to Jessie and the rest of the staff.

I had been going to Gold's Gym (it is free with my apartment) but we recently decided to upgrade to LA Fitness. And it really is an upgrade. The space is very large, bright and clean. All the equipment is on the newer end of the spectrum and there are multiples of most the weight lifting machines. Some unique pieces you don't see in every gym as well. The facility also boasts basketball as well as two large group fitness rooms (one for spinning) and a pool. Lots of free weights as well. 

This gym has a much younger crowd than the Gold's on Oracle. This is reflected in the TV channels... as in Fox News is in the minority here. Lot's of TVs hung from the ceiling that you can tune into with a radio. No personal TVs on the cardio machines (which Gold's does have), but that doesn't bother me. I go to the gym to workout, not watch TV.

I agree with one of the other reviews regarding the layout. Everything is all on one level, not broken up well and it is a bit like working your way through a maze navigating the equipment. Like all gyms that aren't in your own home, LA is busiest after work. If you don't like going to a crowded gym, then find a different time.

I was in Tucson again and am afraid I'm going to have to deduct a star.  I'm not deducting for the facility, or the staff (who are all great and personable) but I'm specifically deducting for a new corporate policy.  They no longer sell "one-week" temporary passes for $40 to visitors.  Instead they sell one day passes for $15 a day.  In other words the corporate big shots (B.S.) are clearly trying to rip off the public and line their pockets.  That is unacceptable.  Shame on you.  You have lost a lot of respect.

They're on the cusp of a five. The man at the front desk remembered me even though I only sign up for a week's worth of exercise when I'm in town (about twice a year). They seem to have a pretty good schedule of spin classes and aerobics. I forgot to mention their basketball court last time. It's very, very clean and the clientele are not the type to trash the place. My complaints are that they do run out of paper towels from time to time, they could be open a couple of more hours on weekends, and if you're not careful you could make a wrong turn into the swimming pool on your way to the shower. And, finally, one of the shower stalls was lacking a soap dispenser. Overall, a great chain, so I wish they'd buy out 24 hour fitness so I can go to a clean gym.

I liked this gym. It's nice, clean, spacious and the ladies in front were really friendly. Nice pool and sauna. Only thing I didn't enjoy was being given a dirty look by what seemed to be a manager. Doesn't really seem like a gym manager if she's just walking around in heels. I loved everything and everyone else, just not her states.

I go to this place whenever I'm in Tucson.  The staff has been terrific and there's a good variety in the Cardiovascular Equipment I like to use.  However, one reason I'm rating it so high is that it is "Clean" unlike my local 24 hour Fitness.  The mens rooms is carpeted and there are hair dryers for our personal use.  I am not rating it higher than four only because I can't figure out their ab-crunch machines and haven't had any interaction with the trainers outside of the ones at the desk.  It has a nice swimming pool and handball/raquetball courts as well as a separate rooms for spin classes and aerobics.  Pretty complete I must say.  24 hour fitness -- pay attention.

This location seems to be cardio orientated. They do have a free weight area as well as machines. But not as many as other locations. That's why I don't come here very often. But on nights when my go to locations are super busy, I come here to avoid waiting in line for a bench or EZ Bar. ;) Same thing if you play basketball. Other locations are packed on certain nights and you have to wait in line. The bf never has to wait in line here...but the caliber of competition is lower. ^__^

Why is it so easy to sign up with LA fitness but impossible to cancel? Manager at Oro Valley branch is on vacation so no one can help me there until he gets back. They send me to Ina and Shannon, manager is unavailable. They can print me a form and I can mail it, seriously? I don't trust anyone will get it or process it in a timely manner given their history. The icing is when my husband cancelled, they increased my monthly dues- I don't see anywhere in the contract where they can legally do this and after repeatedly calls, never heard back from anyone. I smell a class action lawsuit coming...!!!

When I signed up at LA Fitness, this is where that took place. I went here religiously nearly everyday for about four months. Then, I got a new job and started school again and my schedule got thrown off. 

In the beginning, things seemed new and clean still (though they'd been open for about a year or two) and the staff was really professional and friendly. It was the same faces everyday for four months! Then, when I finally was able to work gym time back into my schedule, people had left and their replacements were less than spectacular. Things kept going downhill from there. I saw front desk guys and girls flirting with each other, gym members, and even letting their friends come behind the counter. There was one young man who was actually good at his job (or so it seemed). Then, I learned that a girl I worked with was going to LA Fitness for free because she was friends with him and whenever he was working is when she'd come by because he'd let her and three of her closest friends come and work out for free.

I was pretty disgusted, but this was the gym that was closest to my house (other than the Y, and I'm not a fan of them). Anyways, I've since moved to Goodyear/Phoenix area and found one gym that's actually 20 times better than this one and one that's brand new but has a very similar layout to this one and I realized that was probably one of the things I liked the least about this gym; it was all on one level. The one I really love has entire floor dedicated just to cardio machines which makes working out seem more private and less bothersome with Customer Service reps walking around talking to people they know or checking out ladies (though I've seen this happen at all three). 

Anyways, this place is nicer than the other two that are in Tucson, but just barely meets the level of the ones up here.
Locker rooms and half of the gym is closed for remodel. Avoid this location for a while

Does the term, "Greasy sales tactics" resonate with anyone? If so, this is what you can expect when going to LA Fitness. Particularly the one on Ina/Shannon. 

Here's how my experience panned out. I get several  calls from a guy who claims to be the general manager named Clinton J.  I finally call the guy back and tell him I'll sign up that day, but that I'm not going to pay an initiation fee. He replies, "No problem. Come on in. We'll work something out for you." I then replied, "Are you sure you can waive the initiation fee because I'm not going to pay it and I don't want you to waste my time or yours?"  He said he was sure and so I decided to ignore my intuition which said, "They're like used car salesman...they probably won't do what they said."

At any rate, I decided to enter the lion's den. The greeter greets me and is very friendly. I am then taken to a waiting area behind where all the sales vermin reside. As I'm sitting there, I actually heard Clinton tell his sales team and VP who happened to be there. "You all ready to see how this is done?!" Then Clinton comes around the corner and greets me with his VP who says his name is also Clint.  

Long story short, I sit down at Clinton's desk and he says he's going to see what he can do and starts looking at his computer's screen like as if he doesn't already know what deals he can offer. I then tell him I'm only interested in the single club monthly rate with no initiation fee as I'm not going to pay one. He then abruptly gets up, shakes my hand and tells me that plan doesn't exist. 

All this could've been avoided if the dude was just honest. Instead, he wasted my time, his time, his VP's time and all that sales staff who were all listening to how "it's done." Now I'm going to post this review on ever site I can to let people know what to expect at LA Fitness.

By the way, I echo what all the other reviews have said about how it takes LA Fitness forever to stop charging you once you've cancelled. I sent two certified letters to their corporate office and made countless calls before they stopped charging me. Why I thought they would have changed by now is beyond me.

I'm so glad I found this place and got to work with Tyler! This gym has everything you could ask for. All the workout equipment, classes, pool, showers and more! Early to late hours, staff to help you anytime you're there. Tyler was so friendly and professional. He knows his stuff! The only thing I wish is that the classes would be offered at different times. If there was a yoga or power circuit class offered in the early mornings I would like to take it. You need to check this place out and ask for Tyler!

Don't expect anything from this place once you signed the contract. I have heard my wife and other women complain that the management won't do anything about loud mouthed, vulgar, sexist and lecherous behavior from the men even if they are told about it again and again.

Casey is the only fantastic guy still employed there. He is always positive, helpful and knowledgeable. I did have a few really good personal trainers that have since quit. I have seen other trainers leading new people through movements with bad form that could be (or were) injurious. I even told a trainer I was rehabilitating a knee injury and one of the first exercises he wanted to do actually set my healing back a week. It wasn't unusual to observe male trainers blandly counting reps for one of their clients while checking out women or their phones. 

The people that will enjoy this location are people that already know how to work out and women that know "men will be boys" and don't expect the staff will look out for them let alone enforce the club rules and etiquette.

There are so many things about this LA Fitness that I don't like. 

The first and worse thing about this place is the guys who work there. They are pretentious, douchey, and rude with egos the size of their biceps. 

I downloaded a guest pass on the internet so my brother, friend and I could try the pool. The pass was supposed to be for 3 days but he only issued it for one. To get the pass we had to sit through a lengthy sales pitch. We made it clear we weren't looking to sign up at the gym there since we live in San Diego (at the time--but actually we ending moving here) and my brother already had a YMCA pass. He asked us many personal prying questions like where we live, what we do, what we do for fun, how long we've been working out, what we do to work out and what our fitness goals were. 

THE WORST PART IS THEY WONT STOP CALLING!!!! They've called me maybe 25 times in a month. The guy Jimmy, keeps calling and leaving messages. The sales pitch guy said they wouldn't be calling me even though he forced me to give him my number. By threatening me, "Do you want to pass or not!?". I gave him the wrong number and somehow they still got my number. Creepy. They've also blown up my brother and friend's phone. 

Also, the locker room is carpeted and smells like feet. It's unhygienic and gross.

Don't go here if you want to be treated with respect, there are better places.

I was at this location to see what the population was like and equipment. 

First, nice gym. But the free weight section is underfunded. Less barbells , dumbbells, benches. 

Machine wise , there was lots. 
I was in the morning and I didn't have to wait. 

In the locker room only 6 lockers avail per section. I got the last one. No set asides for handicap. There should be twice that amount. 

Things were very clean. 

I doubt I ll use this location again for what I need. 

It's a ok plan B.

Great machines and great staff.
Always able to crank out my routine, though it does get a little busy in the early part of the week, just got to plan out some variations so you can keep moving.

I signed up online, and downloaded the LA fitness app, so all I need to do is have the barcode on my phone app scanned to enter.    I have not been here in 5 years, and thankfully they have done some remodeling.   Lots of diversity in the gym patrons, and there is something for everyone here.   I am going to check out some of the classes that come with the membership, in addition to weights, the pool, and cardio machines.  This gym will work just great for me as a supplement to outdoor biking and swimming.

I love this little gym!! It has always been one of the cleanest gyms I have ever been to. Not to mention the employees are always cheerful, helpful and professional which is so difficult in this new Covid atmosphere

The Gym has been remodeled, cleaned up and opened up on June 18th. It looks good on the surface, but there's a lot of loose ends to clean up like holes in the wall and dirt from all the construction. I am saddened that they got rid of some of the newer machines for bench pressing. Now there are fewer options for some of the muscle groups. What is more, they kept the old Precor ellipticals, but not the older (but newer than the Precor) Matrix elliptical. The new Mateix ones have a higher step in the revolution that hurts my knees. Still the newer ones have TVs. I'm noticing more young people on them. 

Also, there is LESS water Fountians and cleaning dispensers. This means planning your walks over to the stations. 

STILL Overall, the BIGGEST letdown for me was that the new dumbbells go up only in 5lb. increments, instead of the 2.5lb. increments like the Marana and Oro Valley clubs. I was really looking forward to that. But sad to say it did not happen. Still it is new with a newer feel. New floors, some new furniture, new resurfaced pool, new enlarged cycle classroom and several new (4) machines called "Hoist". These are the coolest upgrade for me. The Hoist machines rock entirely while doing a crunch, a bicep curl, the shoulder press or the back exercise. 

Try it for yourself if you are so inclined. You may find the new matrix machines are fitting for you. Maybe 5lb. increments are quite doable. You won't know till you try. I'm still going to show up, cause this location works great for me.

When I first moved out to tucson, I had to get into working out.  I was also finishing up my personal trainer certification.  Anyhow, there was a girl at the front desk that always greeted everyone that walked in.  Its been since 2009 and unfortunately i forgot her name.  She was nice.  The rest of the staff need to practice and work on their greeting skills before being out on the floor.  It was not an upbeat gym.  Any I never seen a gym that didnt have hot chicks working the desk.  Keep me focused on my workouts tho.  I enjoyed the machines, and not having too many big body builders trying to stunt and flaunt in the mirrors.  Mirrors are there to make sure you are having good form and posture. LOL

This club is the original LA Fitness in the Tucson area, opening in 2004. It was recently rebranded by LA Fitness as Esporta. ( who knows why but it doesn't really matter) on 10/25/2021 the club was gone over, again, with more new equipment and an entire area designated for "functional" fitness. While I always thought of the term Functional Fitness as being just another gimmick to sell fitness videos, the equipment that was brought in is very useful in completing a whole body workout. The TRX stations and sled are a much needed addition to any gym. Also two power racks with deadlift stations were included in this most recent remodel with rubberized weights much needed when deadlifting. 

AND they kept the good old equipment, like the hammer chest and back machines.  Well done. Plenty of dumbell weights are still available. I understand the two old squat racks will be returned to service soon as well. 

If you are looking for a decent workout, and not training for a specialized sport ( CrossFit, powerlifting, Olympic lifting) I recommend this gym.

UPDATE: It's been cleaned up. Lotsa stuff for disinfecting. Social distancing enforces and masks are required 100% of the time. 

2018: The Gym has been remodeled, cleaned up and opened up on June 18th. It looks good on the surface, but there's a lot of loose ends to clean up like holes in the wall and dirt from all the construction. I am saddened that they got rid of some of the newer machines for bench pressing. Now there are fewer options for some of the muscle groups. What is more, they kept the old Precor ellipticals, but not the older (but newer than the Precor) Matrix elliptical. The new Matrix ones have a higher step in the revolution that hurts my knees. Still the newer ones have TVs. I'm noticing more young people on them. 

Also, there is LESS water Fountians and cleaning dispensers. This means planning your walks over to the stations. 

STILL Overall, the BIGGEST letdown for me was that the new dumbbells go up only in 5lb. increments, instead of the 2.5lb. increments like the Marana and Oro Valley clubs. I was really looking forward to that. But sad to say it did not happen. Still it is new with a newer feel. New floors, some new furniture, new resurfaced pool, new enlarged cycle classroom and several new (4) machines called "Hoist". These are the coolest upgrade for me. The Hoist machines rock entirely while doing a crunch, a bicep curl, the shoulder press or the back exercise. 

Try it for yourself if you are so inclined. You may find the new matrix machines are fitting for you. Maybe 5lb. increments are quite doable. You won't know till you try. I'm still going to show up, cause this location works great for me.

The remodel looks great. Less carpet, upgraded and more equipment. The arrangement can use some change because the cable equipment is far too close for comfort. Turn around to do some fly's and you might be kissing someone's face or ass, depending on what exercise they are doing. 
Some of the plate loading equipment have been shuffled around out of order of the muscle group you are targeting. I guess that is petty, but it has some of us scratching our heads. 
Otherwise, I can say that it is a nice facility and I missed it when they were renovating it.

I do have issues with their preacher benches, you can't adjust the height on them.
Also the new bench presses. The hooks need to go. Makes it harder to re-rack the bar. Caught a couple people, including myself trying to get over the hook after sets and have to set it on the hook below or worse case- have the bar come down on your grill.

The worse part about being a member of this gym or any gym in that matter, some of the people go just to socialize. There are a selective handful of people who spend more time talking and getting in the way than working out. Go to a Starbucks and talk. Go outside. Go away. The same people also don't know how to re-rack the weights. I made it clear one day with one dude. I waited until a young lady goes over to the incline bench to re-rack the weights he used over a half hour ago. I went over to her and said, "No, don't put those back for him, hold on." I yell over at him across the gym, "Hey! you using this still?!" He goes, "Oh I was still using it." Yah, whatever dude. No you weren't you tool. It was sitting there unattended while you were on a machine elsewhere talking to the staff member that is part of your little gossip circle jerk. Do us all a favor and start using the gym as what it is there for and maybe then, just maybe you will look like you actually workout. Save your time trying to pick up women for the club or bar.

I haven't needed help with anything major, but the staff has been nice and helpful. The last manager in Feb 2019 had great customer service (interpersonal) skills and wasn't pushy about signing up for an extended membership as the original guy I encountered in August 2018. I haven't had any major interaction with the current manager, so I don't have any comments regarding that. 

I'm not very impressed with the locker room but I heard that the men's side smells --so maybe I shouldn't complain. There's a small lounge area with a TV upon entering, at least in the ladies' room. 

I learned that LA Fitness doesn't employ its (cleaning) staff full time. It was a bummer to learn that one employee returned to Europe since they were not able to offer him a full-time position. This older gentleman spoke a bit of English and would put in a lot of effort into cleaning the facility. The previous manager I raved about has since left.

Also, I heard that a nearby gym permanently closed, so the gym tends to be fairly busy in the evening M-TH.

I went there yesterday for a simple tour as I've recently moved to this side of Tucson and Chuze is now too far to make my weekly spin classes on time. The receptionist was very friendly and tried his hardest to get the quote on quote "gm" to come give us a tour. After 15 minutes the "gm" arrived sweaty with a completely soaked shirt as if he just got out of the shower or was working out on the clock. 

He then proceeded to tell us about the options in membership and didn't even offer a tour until I said I wanted one. This made it abundantly clear that we were being an inconvenience to him. 

He didn't discuss many of the options and I kept having to pry for more information. For someone who is a sales person you think he would have tried to engage with us a little more. 

He had little to no information on the spin class as that was my main reason for being there. 

He then took us directly back to the sales pitch where he discussed the options for signing up not even allowing us to think about it. I told him I had a membership already and wanted to wait until June. He said, " I wasn't the only one with double membership and this was the best deal they offer". It wasn't and isn't. I already knew there was an offer for 20% a membership online. 

Ugh, I told him we would ask for him when we came back because I know they work off of how many sales they get and need to keep their quota. He got extremely defensive and asked me "who told you that!" I simply said I used to work sales and I know how this goes.

 My boyfriend being kinder then myself signed up for a family membership (which is completely our fault as we should have just done the individual for me). This guy was a grease ball. He claimed to be giving us extra materials like lanyards, towels, a book. The book was used and had someone else's name written in it. 

Bottle line: we were swindled, felt like inconveniences, and no-genuine interest given to us. I'll be trying the spin classes for the free 7 days then making my decision. The sales tactics need new perspective. I would have felt better if someone showed more interest in my becoming a member then the just a sales pitch opportunity.

THE GYM

The facility is decent. I believe the gym was remodeled a couple of years back, though it makes me wonder what the place looked like before. From what I heard, LA Fitness tends to clean the equipment often, compared to 24 Hour Fitness (not that any exist in Arizona). We see the staff cleaning the equipment, mirrors, and floor each evening. 

The saunas are located in the restroom, showers have curtains and there is one handheld blow dryer is located towards the end of the locker room. It's not very glamorous compared to the university gym I've used in the past, but I guess it gets the job done. And there are free mini-lockers (where you enter in a code) located outside the locker room, if you need to store small things, like your wallet and keys.

They have a 4 lane pool and small hot tub. Sufficient treadmills and ellipticals, but I can't promise anything on Mondays --I'm not sure how everyone seems to gain the motivation to get to the gym at the beginning of the week. Then again, maybe it was because the nearest LA Fitness was under construction.

There are several racquet ball rooms (personally, I wished badminton or tennis was an option). The gym has one basketball court, another room for stretches, a cycling room and another for classes. There is a childcare area, I'm not sure about the specifics, but I believe it comes at an additional price. 

As for the people at the gym, it's fairly diverse in regards to ethnicity, age, and physical fitness. There are classes like Zumba and aquatic aerobics. I would imagine the schedule is posted online. 

THE STAFF

The bad: I am often wary about gyms as I am at car dealerships. My first experience here, 6 months prior, was with a stereotypical and superficial employee, trying to shove a gym membership down my throat, despite having stated multiple times that I only wanted to try the free trial for now and I wasn't ready to commit to a gym membership yet. 

Alternatively, the person who signed my brother up for a trial felt it was appropriate to show off a photo of himself with abs. Weird flex, but okay. I'm happy to say I think that both guys have moved on to a different facility. (:

The decent: The staff at the front will usually say "hi" or "bye." I realized this doesn't always happen since half the time, people walk past without responding. I haven't had any extended interaction with them, but the staff seems pretty alright to me.

The good: Mike is a new-ish general manager and he's definitely your go-to guy, if you have any questions or concerns. Mike is the most personable gym manager I've met and I appreciated his small gestures of encouragement when I revealed my couch potato life. I've also seen gym members discussing concerns with Mike in a friendly manner, so it appears that he is approachable and does a good job resolving issues.

So after my 6-month hiatus fo the gym, I returned for another trial and was pleasantly surprised with Mike his genuine and respectful demeanor. When it was time to sign-up, he informed me of a deal that came up in February. It was truly a great option for someone who is committed to visit the gym consistently, which I can't say that I am.

I want to commend Mike's integrity in providing an honest recommendation to help me determine which membership was the best fit (rather than his or the company's bottom line). I feel that the trust he developed is more than what money can buy. Mike's there most evenings if you need a tour!

We put our membership on hold last March after Covid hit. Went back for the first time today to check it out before we decided to unfreeze our membership. We were happy with them previously but they only mandate masks upon entering the facility and more than 50% of the people there were wearing masks. While they do have a couple of sanitizing stations set up and "suggest" that people wipe down the equipment before and after using, very few people were doing so. They're also open at 100% capacity. When we spoke to one of the front desk people. they said the health department had been out and gave them the all-clear but I assume it wasn't a surprise inspection and had time to prepare for the visit. I also recall seeing more cleaning staff pre-Covid than I did today. Meanwhile there's 4 people sitting at the front desk doing absolutely nothing. If they're bored, maybe they should go around and wipe down equipment. Much as I'd love to go back, I think I'll either look for a cleaner, safer gym or just keep walking around the park and using free weights at home. Maybe when AZ has achieved an 80% vaccinated population, I'll give them another go since they're conveniently located but, for now, hard pass.

I joined LA fitness and have the Cortaro location as my primary gym. This facility is my favorite though. There are lots of great machines and the layout is better. Their pool is nicer with four lanes. The temperature is kept slightly on the warmer side (which makes it hot doing laps). There is a time clock on one end of the pool and they could use another on the other side. All and all, this is a great gym! Come here and bargain a monthly deal for your gym membership!

I only give this gym a 1 star due to their General Manager.
I will say that their equipment is bomb and that gets a 5 star from me.
Management had informed me on my last visit their that I could come back in and use my pass. I'm from Vegas and I travel to Tucson once or twice a month. I was going to join La Fitness but not after management not keeping their word & pushing a membership on me instead. I hold membership to several gyms so that's not my issue. 
The issue is someone word not being kept and since the gentleman that spoke these words is now in a management position. I find it hard to believe and trust future dealings with him & the club.
Business is business. But I believe in keeping your word as well.

I really love everything about this place. 

The new studio is so beautiful. Its still under a little bit of construction so be mindful. When I went into my first class through classpass I didn't really know what to expect. I used to dance in high school and did gymnastics so I was hoping for the best. There were women of all ages and all body types. There were about 10 people in the class. Everyone was given their own mat, ball, and a stretchy band. You also have your own section of the ballet bar. The class moves quickly and works parts of your body that you don't know existed. We were moving the entire time, but the hour flies by. 

Personally I loved the class. If you once danced, did gymnastics, or heck want to dance, this is the class for you. I didn't get that pretentious vibe that I get every time walking into Lithe. 

Prepare to have a girl crush on Jillian. Shes a great instructor!

I am so glad I found Allongee.  It's a great addition to my cardio and weight training.  The owner Jillian really cares and knows her stuff.  It's a great combo of dance, cardio, barre, etc.

Challenging and fun!  Thanks Allongee xo

This studio is bright and clean, and very convenient. Everyone who teaches here is helpful and professional. The classes are just what I've been looking for!!! Creative cardio, fast-paced, led by positive instructors who help keep you on track to make the most of your time here. There is such a variety of class options, too, so that you are not always doing the same workout, unless you choose to.

I hate to do this, but I feel its my duty and a matter of safety for other future clients to read this review. 
I work out 5 days a week with ClassPass. I have been practicing yoga regularly for 5 years, Barre for 2 years, and have a personal trainer. I work hard in my classes and I know proper form so as to avoid injury.
This studio does NOT care about your form, about whether you're misaligned, about whether you hurt yourself. The moves and motions we were doing were made up and not based in any sort of classic fitness moves. Was this class a Barre class? No. Was it an aerobics class? No. Was it a HIIT class? No. What was happening was a synthesis of random choreography that the instructor pulled out of thin air. I came out of the class with neck pain that lasted almost a week. We were jumping around, over utilizing bands attached to the Barre, and not ONE person received hands on adjustments in a class of 6 women. Our moves weren't in sync with the music, she kept changing the songs, at one point her phone rang over the speaker. I felt like I was in the twilight zone. The owner/instructor said that she is opening another studio, I hope that's not the case. She also commented on being hung over, which was unprofessional.
