It baffles me that this studio has such high ratings on Yelp. When I told fellow ClassPass goers that I took a class here they all had the same reaction: they tried it once and would never go back.

This is SUCH a shame because we have almost ZERO studios East of Broad street and I can walk to this place from my apartment in under 10 minutes. Please beware.
Great teachers, super sweet owner.  Class was fun.  The entrance is off an alley and you need to get buzzed in.  Don't forget your grippy socks!

An easy catch up for a novice barre newbie but challenging enough for an advanced nimble nymph, Allongée is a workout studio for all levels! When I used to have ClassPass (and back in the day when the studio was located on 2nd street in Old city), Allongée was my definite go-to for ultimate sweat and fun. The workouts are definitely intense, you sweat buckets, and I felt stronger (and more flexible) with every class I took. Allongée is owned by Jillian who is a rockstar. She's hardcore with her pretty ballerina past but she knows just how to push you and get your muscles burning. She's extremely knowledgeable about body mechanics which in turn means highly efficient and effective workouts to sculpt your body and get your cardio going. The studio was always clean, the music high energy, and the class vibe cool and welcoming. Class prices are pricey but nothing different from any other city studio class. With all my work schedule conflicts, continuing ClassPass didn't make sense financially but if I did I would definitely recommend anyone to try out Allongée!

I love this place! I've taken the Bey Body class with Jillian and Robin. They have different styles but the class is challenging with both of them in a way that pushes you to be your best. I'll definitely be checking more of the barre classes as my schedule allows.

I dropped in for a few classes here when I was in town for work. The facility is big and the trainers were very knowledgeable and encouraging. The first class I felt a little weird and almost nobody, except the trainers, introduced themselves to me. I come from a very close-knit box that has a super welcoming community. The second and third classes had more people who were welcoming and made me feel comfortable. Could just be because the box is so big that many members don't know one another? Either way the programming and staff was great!

I've been a member here for about 8 months and I can honestly say this is an amazing crossfit gym. It captures everything great about crossfit, community, health, awesome coaching, challenging workouts, great programming, and a supportive network. 

Naptown is also in the process of expanding its offerings and locations. I strongly recommend Naptown if you want to try Crossfit for the first time, get fit, or meet people if you're new new to the city. 

The community is one of a kind :)

I am no pinnacle of fitness, but I am one month in to my Crossfit membership at Naptown and it has been anything but boring! Every day is different. And I love it! Boredom kills my motivation. But getting to try something new almost every class has been both exciting and rewarding. 

Prior to signing up, I read a lot about the "Crossfit koolaid"... I even got warnings from friends who knew people who got 'sucked in.'  In my experience, it has not been all-consuming. In fact, it's been a really great outlet for making new friends, setting goals, and conquering challenges. 

Naptown gets a gold star for their intentional community. They really set up a collaborative environment for everyone (even well-fed curvy girls who can't lift their body-weight to save their lives). :) Gyms can be intimidating, but in my experience, I've been challenged and supported every step of the way. I rowed 5,000 meters on a Saturday morning at one session. Who does that?! It was a lot of fun!!!

They have a free beginners class on Thursday evening which everyone should try at least once. It's a great workout and everything is tailored to your specific needs. I was a ball of nerves in my first class... but when it turned out okay, I felt really good about myself and the new friends I had made. Chat with the owners, I even tried out a few regular classes before I started (paid for) my month-membership. There are coaches in every class who come around and help you do your best work.

Bonus Feature: I got super-sick in the middle of my first month membership and Naptown was kind enough to suspend my membership for the week I was out and extend it by one week. Baller.

I went for a weekend class while visiting a friend. Since it was my first time, it was free. Score!

The workout was pretty tough and I am definitely sore! It was neat - we worked as a team - and the instructor came and checked on us every so often. Most of the people in my team were Crossfit regulars, so they were good at helping me understand what was going on. I would absolutely go back - on a regular basis - if I could!

It is a little hard to find when you drive, because the sign is just tacked onto the building wall (nothing fancy).

Since we moved from San Francisco to Indy, my husband and I have been looking for a cross fit gym. Peter and Jared (owners and trainers) welcomed us with such warmth that we loved it from the first minute we walked in the door. They explained the routine without putting us down for previous activities we did (which is what happened at Cross Fit Broad Ripple). Hey, just the fact that we were exercising such be enough. :)
After the intro class (which is free, every Thursday at 6pm), we signed up for twice a week program. two months later, we increased to 3 times a week. All month to month, with no commitments. We just do it because we want to, not because we paid enrollment fees etc like in other gyms.
The class is never boring. But always intriguing. We don't bother reading online the WOD because we are afraid that it will intimidate us. In the end, we just go, try our hardest, and leave feeling we will live one extra day as we contributed to our well being.
One of the things that we love about going there is the fact that everyone tries to learn your name from day one. It feel we are amongst friends. PS: learn names fast otherwise you might have to do burps for each name you don't know in the class :)
The assistant coaches are also cool, and help you scale your exercises. 
The facilities are growing, and it feels good to allow a small business, owned by people with passion to grow and succeed. 

We will never go back to a regular gym. And we look forward to the next class - can you believe that?!
Big fan of this CrossFit gym. Programming fits all skill and fitness levels. Most importantly, great people and a fun community. Highly recommended.

I dropped in for a WOD here and was warmly welcomed. The facility was very big and well equipped. All of the members here were very welcoming and friendly which made the experience even better. The class was very well coached and monitored. I would happily return to this box next time I'm in town.

Great box. Loved the overall attitude. Coaches are awesome and very informative about correct form. Always giving feedback on how to improve. The box is well equipped. Will always be back when I'm in town again.

I have been here almost a year and am obsessed! The facility is perfect, the community is great, the workouts are challenging and I have seen myself growing stronger each month. The best though, are the coaches. The coaches are so supportive, so friendly, and by the little things they do you can tell this is more than a job for them and they really care about everyone at the gym. I don't know how it could get better.

CrossFit Naptown is a wonderful place to work on fitness goals.  The coaches are not only great athletes but excellent teachers.  They genuinely care about everyone's technique.  I'm always impressed at how quickly they learn everyone's names!  I was nervous about starting, but I've met so many friendly people who are encouraging and don't make me feel "lesser than" for being a beginner.  They offer a free intro class on Thursday night so you can get a feel for it.  I highly recommend!
Super crowded, staff are pretty good at being salesman. Don't believe that prices change daily and they will try to sell you a membership if you use a guest pass.

I like this gym. I have never had to wait on a machine while people sit around and talk. even during busy times. i will admit it had been 6 months since i walked in to a gym due to family issues and stuff. i felt like i was starting at the gym as a newbie.

I walked in and they had more tredmills and added extra room for the weight machines. it does not have the huge retail area the other gym i went had but for $30 cheaper than the previous place I deal the best i can. 

for roughly $16 a month, i get access to all the locations in the area.

Overall, if you just want to get in, get your stuff done, and then get out, it's great! Don't expect to strike up a convo with anyone. But, the machines are nice, they seem clean, and I haven't seen one out of order yet. 
However... They obviously want you to do the upgraded membership, don't walk in thinking you'll easily be able to purchase the $10 membership. The girl that signed us up (tall, dark hair, physically fit) literally rolled her eyes at us and her "I'm so nice and helpful" routine quickly ended when we turned her down for the upgraded membership. 
But, again, aside from her, we're definitely fans of this location.
This particular Club Fitness has terrible shower stalls: cramped and with ice-cold water.
Kind of a smaller gym and equipment is not maintained very well but it's hard to beat the price. Be careful of extra charges and plan on additional charges after canceling membership

Really disappointed in Club fitness with the letter that was sent out and then totally not a customer oriented business at the corporate office. In fact my experience was less than a 1 Star pretty much a negative if I could give that rating.

I hesitated at first to join this gym. However, there is NO contract and only $10/mo (you still have to pay one time fees). The gym is wonderful and clean. There are staffs constantly cleaning machines, windows, floor mats, etc. every time I'm there. I go to this gym about 5 to 6 times per week. I am loosing some weights and gaining muscle. It has been 9 months of wonderful experience of being healthy. I still walk outside @park when weather permit on top of the gym. The best time for me is in the morning when less people are there. It gets too crowded in the evening, There are personal trainers, aerobic classes and children care services at the gym.

I had a terrible experience with the customer service side of Club Fitness.  I was in St. Louis for 2 months this summer for my job, and I joined for those dates.  The gym stipulates when you join that should you like to cancel, you need to do so online and 30 days before you are charged again.  I knew when I would be leaving, so I put this in my calendar, and made sure to cancel on time.  I followed through with this and double-checked on my last day by going up to the counter, asking them to make sure my account was cancelled, and they said everything looked good.  

I got back to my home in Illinois, and have been charged every month since leaving.  I called customer service, completely confused as to why I have been charged.  They claim that they have no recollection of my cancellation online, and therefore will not reimburse me.  Additionally, I asked right then and there to cancel my account immediately, they said, "You must cancel online only, we can't do it over the phone."  Which probably means I will be charged again, since I need to give 30 days notice.  UNBELIEVABLE.  The confirmation email from my original cancellation no longer exists (why would it, because the gym confirmed it with me on my last day at the gym) so I have no proof that I cancelled.  It is their word against mine.  

I had a nice time working out at the gym, but I have NEVER had to deal with such bad customer service in my life.  I am out a lot of money, and it was never my fault.  I say to you: stay away!!!!

I travel for work and often need a decent gym to you keep up my fitness. I attempted to go here and check on a day or week pass. The old guy at the counter said he didn't know if they did that but told me to have a seat and the manager would talk to me. I sat around for 10 minutes while they were selling scam memberships and they never came back to assist me. Went to see Tom at Anytime Fitness and he was more than kind to accommodate my needs. Avoid this place

I'm still very happy with my experience at this location. The renovations and expansion are very nice, and most welcome!  All of the equipment is brand new, and well-maintained. The locker room is great, very clean. I am there in the morning, so it can get busy, but never too busy that I've had to wait for cardio or weight equipment. The trainers are all very knowledgeable and everyone is friendly. There is a smoothie bar now, as well as tanning and hydromassage.

Clean club.  Staff and trainers are very helpful.  Now that the "annex" has opened, there is always plenty of room for workouts.  The temperature is usually just right, and I've never had to wait for a machine.  I sometimes feel that the music for the classes is a tad loud, but that isn't a huge problem.

Pros:
Lots of cardio equipment and a decent amount of weight machines. 

Cons:
More often than not, there is no hot water for a shower. This is bad enough in the summer but now it's winter and this is unacceptable. It's been this way for the 6 months I've been a member. Not much hope of it getting fixed any time soon.

Equipment repair is not a priority. Things stay broken for quite a while.

Not much room in the free weight area.

I'm happy with this gym. Every employee I've interacted with has been friendly. Sometimes it gets a little crowded, but my schedule allows me to go during quieter times. Great for people looking for a cheap, easy to access gym.
Gym doesn't not take adequate covid safety measures. Despite them failing to provide a safe environment they make it near impossible to cancel membership.

Regarding this location in specific, it's dirty and they don't clean enough. This is a germ pool just screaming covid and the people there don't seem to care. LOL

Now regarding club fitness in general, scumbag company ran by thieves and absolute garbage human beings. GO TO ANY OTHER GYM.

The staff is very uninterested in customers. It seems if if they are always involved in conversation with each other, I only keep my membership because the location is convenient. I have been to the Arnold location and it is much nicer. Once when I was at the Arnold location the manager approached me to make sure I was enjoying my work out and to ask if I had any suggestions to make the gym better. I told him "transfer to South County. We need you!"

Horrible experience.  We signed a 1-year contract and within a few months they removed features that originally came with our package.  Once COVID -19 hit, we tried cancelling over the phone to play it safe but they wouldn't accept that method of cancelation.  We had to mail a certified letter, to which they replied via email that we have to call & pay ANOTHER month's worth to officially be done.  So we called the phone number they provided and the automated voice just says to email them then hangs up on you.  In the end, we were forced to go into the gym to cancel during the COVID-19 outbreak otherwise they were going to keep charging us.  Such unethical business practices.

My friend just joins the gym after FREE 2 weeks trial pass. He goes there every day to get back in shape and loose weights. This is a great way to start working out @the gym if you are not sure about it. You can get the pass from its web site. Check it out!

I've recently committed to working out here, and I guess I don't regret it.
It's not the nicest atmosphere to work out in, just an average looking gym. It gets PACKED in the evenings though, my god it's annoying. On the rare occasion I want to lift weights as opposed to cardio, sometimes it's literally impossible to do so for fear of my head being bashed in by someone's barbell.
Also, when I joined I had a free personal training session which kicked my ass but taught me almost nothing about working out by myself which was disappointing. Then he wanted me to commit to paying for sessions which I was not interested in, but he pushed and pushed regardless, eventually making me promise to call him to let him know either way despite me saying I wasn't interested. Guess someone had a job to do, ha.

This is a basic LA Fitness location - nothing special.  You'll find all the normal benefits and limitations of virtually any gym at this one, including often-crowded free-weight areas during the busier nights (Mondays and Tuesdays seem to be the busiest).  Lots of cardio machines are available, but there always seems to be a couple that are non-functional. 

Additionally, more times than not there are one or two urinals in the men's restroom that are not operating properly and covered up by clear plastic.  The showers seem clean enough for a public gym and locker rooms fairly sanitary.  There are a couple of lockers that are broken, however - and maintenance is taking their time getting it fixed.  

All in all, decent gym.  Nothing special, just a place to workout and lift weight.
since changing the music to musac and zumba to Latin heat with terrible fake music-------it toally sucks now

I like LA fitness but wish is there was a Lifetime Fitness here in AZ....any i been going to 1st & limberlost location for some times...but when i tried another location i found out this place is so trashy, garbage, unhealthy, and lots of freeks member looking for love....in tio of messed up managment....my advice try different location to see what im talking about
awesome place to work out and the people there are nice. the trainers are good and the gym is a younger croud.

I just joined this gym yesterday. I joined for the heated pool. The heater was broken and the GM didn't even inform me so I wouldn't return for the class that night. The place is filthy. The jacuzzi has a disgusting white foam and it's dirty. There are mats that are so uncomfortable to walk on. I went to the Oro Valley location tonight and I'm thankful I did. It's 10 miles out of my way but I will go to this location. It's twice the size and has much more equipment at this location.  It's clean and no mats exist. The handicapped shower stalls are great and big. I'll go to the Oro Valley location from now on. I'm highly disappointed with the first street location.

I don't check in as often as I'm here. But i do drive across town just to cone to this gym. La fitness over does them selves with cleaning their gyms witch is really nice for alot of reason. The stuff and trainers are always ready to help you out. I will say the class here are some of the best in town so come try them out if you have time to
I use to go to this gym and had to cancel once I moved too far away. Lots of machines and not that busy in the morning hours. Love the volleyball league and the heated pool

I play racquetball, and was looking to expand my play from my regular club.  From the start, it was clear that the emphasis at LA Fitness is sales, sales, and "can you give us your friends phone numbers".  The exercise equipment looks decent, caters to young flirtatious sorts.  Courts are clean, but don't seem regulation size for some reason.  I only joined for a month and am already dreading the scam cancellation process..which I wish I had known about prior to joining.

There are better clubs with better staff. .er...salesmen.  Skip this place.

A little expensive for what you get. As a Tucson resident it is around the same price to have access to the University of Arizona Student Recreation Center which offers more room, equipment, and options for fitness. However, the Rec is closed during winter, which makes it difficult and the parking by campus is horrible. If you can get a rate of $25 or less I would recommend this gym. Beware of the busy hours you will be waiting for machines, benches, cardio, basketball, etc. Very clean facility and most of the staff has been nice.

We go most week day mornings and love the spin classes!! Both Jessica and Diane are amazing instructors!! We also lift weight 2 times per week. The early mornings crowds are about the right size as we can usually get the equipment we want to use without waiting.  

If I was only scoring the spin classes I would give a 5 plus rating. There are opportunities with cleanliness and for the past two years there has been no improvement. Also we love coming in when Mike is at the front desk because he is friendly and welcoming. He is a positive start to our early morning workouts. When Mike isn't there, the person at the front desk doesn't even look up from her phone. Fortunately Mike is usually there with his smiling and caring attitude.

I recommend this gym as the benefits outweigh the problems.

I tried it out and the equipment and atmosphere were pretty good, and it wasn't too crowded (but not empty either). I'm sure it's a fine place to be a member if you can avoid the crowded times (I happened to go during a quiet time) and if you're OK with throwing away $100 on an initiation fee.

But I found the sales rep extremely unpleasant to talk to. Began talking down to me the second I said I wasn't interested in paying an absurd initiation fee, and started badmouthing other gyms. I took my business elsewhere, where the manager is a good, respectful guy.

Nice facility. Had a personal session with Kane and I have nothing but great things to say. He's motivating, energetic and creative with his workouts. I was dripping with sweat by the end! I'm positive that his clients see results when working with him consistently. 100% recommend!

You should not be paying more than $30/month for L.A. Fitness.  I pay $25 because I signed on with a friend.  If you are the type of person that would rather pay $25 a month to NOT work out, this may be the gym for you.  Yes, there are a lot of people working out here, but I have never had to wait to hop on a 'dreadmill' or any of the ellipticals.  Sometimes there is a 3 minute wait for the adductor and abductor machines, but that is not a big deal.  The other place that gets crowded is the mat area where people do core exercises with medicine balls, and you can stretch there or stare at yourself in mirror.  The pool is super clean, and there is a sauna and hot tub also.  

The staff is friendly and the restrooms are clean.  I had a cactus burr stuck in my finger one time and the staff treated me with rubbing alcohol and a band-aid.  This is definitely a gym to go to if you are just starting to get into shape or you want to cross-train instead of just running or riding outside (or the allergies or winter or heat get to you).  I am not super fit, and I feel comfortable here.  There are people of all shapes, sizes, and ages, but the average is a college student.  If you want a challenge, go to one of the classes - there are some with hyperactive, boot camp type instructors (spinning and boot camp).

I've been working out at this gym for a few months now. It is A-Ok. It's close to my home and convenient, price was right for my budget. Plenty of cardio machines to go around. No community feel, very corporate, but it is what it is, a giant fitness chain. The locker room area has always been clean in my experience, there is a sauna. Nothing feels special about this gym. Sometimes I'm greeted at the door, sometimes not. 

I usually work out between 5:30am and 6:30am. There are always plenty of machines. I've gone around 6pm on a weekday, busier, but still plenty of machines. I've also gone on an afternoon on a Sunday and still plenty of machines. I haven't started using their weights, those seem to be busy, but not packed. I can't really attest to how easy and quick it would be to get a full set of weights in. I think that is probably much easier early mornings. 

They offer free classes with your membership, I haven't gone to any, but the spinning and Zumba classes I've walked by seem to have plenty of space for new people to join. I'll update review if I start going. 

I've never been a member of a HUGE gym like this, so I don't have a lot to compare to. If a better option opens up for me at the right price point I wouldn't hesitate to cancel my membership here. Location is important for my work and life schedule, so for now LA Fitness wins. (Prestige Fitness is just down the right, but at a lot higher price point)

Extremely busy from 5-9 pm.  There are people all over the place, but there are still equipment openings, so I guess it is not packed completely.  I recommend the fitness classes.  The yoga at 8 pm on Mon and Wed is awesome - it is one of the more challenging types being Vinyasa, and there are around 80 people in there!  The spinning classes are some of the hardest classes I have taken - hilarious imagery though ("imagine that you are generating power for the whole city").  The boxing class is extremely intense sprinting and touching the ground a lot.

Gym is good sized lots of equipment. Needs more cardio machines, but the free weight section is perfect. As with any gym it gets packed during peak times. Got to time your sessions to not feel crowded. 
I went the personal trainer route to help me through the hurdle of losing weight and working out properly.  My trainer is fantastic. Ask for Billi she will kick you into shape.

This is a pretty good gym. It can be really packed at times and there maybe some waiting in line but what can you expect with many people wanting to workout. I just learned to go when it's less busy and that's usually in the morning or late at night. 

The machines are pretty well clean and there always a worker occasionally going around cleaning the machines and floors. The bathroom are kept up pretty well too. 

The people here are nice and friendly. Even some of the regulars who come are friendly and I've made a few new friends too. 

I would recommend this place if you have time to come during the morning or late nights for a full workout with out waiting for machines. There are many varieties of machines to use too!

With the addition of a full on separate free weight room its become even easier to get a workout in even when it gets crowded. Also with more room additional cardio machines are now available and couldn't be anymore happier with this place.

Favorite gym by far. Plenty of classes and a wide variety of equipment. Can get crowded and not a 24 hour gym but a great value none the less. Friendly and helpful staff.
Regular members are fairly helpful and friendly great place to make a friend for working out.  
overall great experience.

I think this gym is great, especially compared to the LA Fitness on the east side, which is totally falling apart.  Here, the equipment is in great shape or else there's a warning sign that it's under repair.  I've also found that equipment is super easy to adjust, whereas with the gym on the east side, everything was falling apart, which made it much harder.  My only complaint is that they should have leg machines with extra small settings!  Some of those machines don't work well for petite people.

Like others have said, the gym can get busy, which isn't such a big deal UNLESS you have to wait FOREVER for the leg press because the guy in front of you decides to do 10 million sets with nice, lonnnng breaks in between each one...grumble, grumble... Otherwise, I'm totally on board with LA Fitness!

To those who say this gym is dirty, I do not understand. I spend half the year in Santa Fe, where the best gym in town, looks like a ghetto comparatively. I travel back and forth, so usually pay by the month.

To those who say it's old, the machines are the best I've seen. Amazing amount of classes with overall really good instructors.

Agreed, the front desk is impersonal and not very friendly, but who cares about that!

Ruben helps me sign up each time and is always professional and very helpful.

If there s a better gym in town, it must be a secret.

I come to this gym strictly out of convenience. I usually don't have to wait for many things. Maybe a couple of dumbbells here and there but usually I can get through my workout pretty quickly. However, they don't have any freaking channels! They literally, no, literally, have FIVE channels and one is Nicktoons and it never plays any of the good cartoons (Hey Arnold, Ah! Real Monsters, etc). I mean sheesh.

You give me more TV channels, I'll give you more stars.

This gym has all the equipment & classes you need.  The equipment is clean & easy to use.  There are lots of treadmills, ellipticals, & stationary bicycles available with many flat screen tvs to watch while sweating calories away.

Hours are good, but I'd prefer a 24 hour gym.  

If you like racquetball, there are numerous courts!  There is also a basketball court that is usually free during the day.  In the evenings, there are usually people playing b-ball games.  

I do wish they had more types of classes.  LA Fitness in other cities have belly dancing, Yogabeat, Hip hop, & Cardio Jam classes that seem fun to try.

I was attending this gym in 2008. The equipment area is great. Great options of classes with a pool and spa. I went around 11 am so it was never really busy. Only problems is with cancellation as usual with all gym memberships.

The form that needs to be mailed needs to be printed out by them for some reason, I could not obtained it online, I might have missed the place to get it in 2008. They state that I should send it via certified mail, so it wont be "lost". This troubled me but whatever. That is what I did, followed their instructions.

I noticed I still got billed later on, last month was paid ahead of time so I should not be getting billed anymore. Yes I know about the time frame that the mail has to get into their hands and processing, I sent the cancellation form on the day of my new billing month to calm down any confusion.

I gave them a call and they state that they did not received this cancellation form. I remember that I received a noticed that the certified mail as arrived in their hands. This pretty much upset me. I state to them that I have the certified mail receipt proofing that they received it. They requested that I needed to give them the code on the paper so they can verify that they got it.

I gave it to them and magically, they have my cancellation form. It took like another few weeks before refunding money. The big thing that baffle me was that, how can they state that they don't have it when I got a confirmation back that they received it. And that they cannot look up documents by my id. So basically, this experience told me that they received your cancellation notice, and unless you complain, and have the confirmation id from certified mail, they can keep you in the loop of sending the form again and charge you for a few more months.

Since this review is about the center itself, I do believe this place is a decent place to work out at but I also believe that when people move on, their experience afterward matters just as much.

2 stars for being a jack ass

This was my next stop on my Tour de Gyms of Tucson and it was my favorite by far. From what I saw everything was very clean and the equipment was new. The front desk staff I interacted with was very friendly. Tons of parking available in the lot. 

I liked that the cardio equipment was upstairs and there seemed to be a good variety. It terms of quantity, I can see how this may be a problems during peak after work times. TONS of weights--both free and machines. Everything was spread out well so you weren't catching the sweat of your neighbor. There is also a pool, 4 racquetball ball courts, basketball court and 2 different group fitness rooms. 

Overall, this gym seemed to attract a much younger crowd than I am used to seeing in North Tucson. I went on a Sunday morning, so it wasn't too busy. I have no doubt that this gym, like all gyms, fills up after work. So plan your workout accordingly!

Everything is out dated, they are under new management monthly, locker rooms are disgusting, no one re racks weights, no Wi-Fi, no water fountain in the weights area, and the membership is way overpriced. Worst part is they are always busy mid day, and they close at 8 on the weekends.

This place is trash. The employees do not greet you or acknowledge you at the front desk. The facility is old and worn down. The locker rooms and bathrooms are never clean and just plain disgusting. They routinely work on areas of the gym during business hours and inconvenience members. There needs to be a change in management cuz whoever is running this place is running it into the ground

I've been a member since 2003. As other reviewers note, the gym is huge with lots of good equipment. I've also found it to be kept quite clean. There have definitely been ups and downs in service quality since I joined, some of which LA Fitness has finally moved to fix.

This location - consisting of two levels.  The first floor mainly consists of weights, various weight machines, swimming pool, jacuzzi, steam room, sauna, racquetball/basketball court. There's also a variety of classes throughout the week from kickboxing to yoga to zuma, you name it they just might have it or get it.

For the price I pay here, it is definitely worth it. I don't think I can find a deal like this at another gym with the same amenities that la fitness offers. 

The best motivation is seeing what you can look like with hard work. And trust me, there are some fit good looking people at this gym. =D

I have been a member for quite some time, although they have just remodel the locker always are dirty and smell gym.. duh, it is a gym.. BUT the new LA Fitness that was opened a while back on Golf Links does not have the same nasty smell.  My guess is the cleaning crew !!

Also, really.. there has been sand in the hot tub and pool for 3 weeks now.  When you ask a staff member they usually answer with the management is aware, we have filter issues etc.. REALLY just rent a siphon and get the sand out, I would be embarrassed if I were trying to sell a new member on this facility and it looks like a great big glob of POOH in the Hot Tub !!!

The reviews here are not a joke.  This place is old!  Most of the equipment is dated and some of the labels are missing on the weights.  Really?!?  While they are open later than most LA Fitness' in the Tucson area, I prefer to take the drive up to the LA Fitness in Marana since it's newer and better than this one.  Another thing that I did not like is that many of the treadmills are upstairs, right near the AC unit.  That wouldn't be an issue, except this place is freezing and running up there isn't fun.  While I like LA Fitness, make the drive to another one.

This is the best gym in the area but I cannot give it 5 stars. The "workers" sit behind the desk and joke around and horse play. The only time they work is when Romeo who is the owner, is there. It is a hang out for the crew that works there and their friends. The weights are hardly ever racked,  and there is no enforcement of any rules. I don't mind the chalk on the floor, it is a gym, there should be chalk but members spill water or whatever on the floor and it will stay there for hours ( it happened tonight and I said something to they young guys that spilled the drink and they just looked at me).
The upside is the amount of equipment and weights they have. They even have a room that you can "CrossFit" in with a Rogue pull up rig and bumpers, but they are not a CrossFit affiliate nor do they claim to be. 
If you don't mind a few too many punks and people that don't follow gym etiquette, this gym is pretty good. 
I worked out here for a year and I did not renew my contract.
Great facilities, friendly staff, and competitive prices. Much better than retro down the road they lock you in the contract and almost impossible to get out.

This is a nice gym with nice equipment and a very competitive monthly fee. I enjoy working out there and Romeo is always willing to give a good you spot when needed. Plenty of parking and easy to get to.
Best gym in the area. Great equipment, enjoyable classes, and staff is very friendly. Price isnt bad either. Much better than Retro down the road.

Being from California I needed a good gym to get my workout in. Luckily for me, I was fortunate enough to be nearby this gym.

For starters this place is extremely clean and well organized. When you walk in you're greeted by a friendly staff and make you feel like you're like one of the regulars. 

Secondly the layout is perfectly planned. There's multiple benches and squat racks so no wait regardless of what body part you're on. However that is not the best part! 

In the rear back room, there's a half cage for the bumper plate cross fitters. Quite honestly this place has a little bit of everything, so whatever your reasons for coming in to the gym, there's a place for you.

Great gym and great facilities. The staff is always friendly and willing to lend a helping hand. They have a wide breadth of equipment perfect for the serious competitor to the guy who just wants to get into shape. Inspiring place to workout at a great price.

If we could give zero starts we would! After cancelling our membership through the old management we continue to get harassed via email for our payment. No one wants to answer their phones here and when you try to leave a message the voicemail is full, this has been for the last month. We finally get in contact and think the issue is resolved but yet again they email and want "their money" Please find new management bc who ever it is here sucks.
I love Orangetheory Nickel Plate! Coaches are motivating and experienced. They want you to be successful and achieve your goals. The workouts are challenging and rewarding.

In the past, I have always enjoyed OTF.  I've checked out several locations in the Indy area when I was a member and always felt welcomed.  This location, however, I did NOT enjoy.  Bought a holiday package for several sessions that included a gift.  Signed up, told arrive 15 minutes prior for new-member intake (it had been over a year since I was a member), website said 15 minutes, email I received said 15 minutes.  

I show up on my 1st day ready to workout (drove 40 minutes btw) & I'm told at that door I was supposed to arrive 20 minutes early.  I explain that everything I had received from OTF had told me 15 minutes.  They refused to allow me to workout, said "I'm sorry" & asked if I could take a later class.  Uh NO.  Asked for my $$ back & then I was told I had to return my "unused gift" to receive my refund.  Drove back home, returned my gift & allegedly I should be getting a refund, according to the front desk gal, since the Manager Savannah was hiding in the side office & chose not to deal with me. 

Poor customer service, poor communication.  Do yourself a favor and check out the many other OTFs throughout the city, not this one.

Shout out to the OTF Nickel Plate District  Love your place . The trends are awesome. The monitors kept me motivated   Coach Landon was great, appreciated all the "alternate" suggestions when I wasn't quite there

I took my first OTF class this past Wednesday night! Maria is amazing and really took special care of me as a newbie! There is a lot going on, but I did not feel lost at all!! I loved the orange lights - they add an extra element of excitement to get you in the zone!!...Along with the energizing music!!

The workout itself was awesome!!! I am definitely feeling the soreness, but it is reinforcing a great workout! The row machine is sneaky! I definitely feel like my regular cardio helped me do well with the OTF class, but I think the row machine targeted muscles I must never use!! Ha!

I got a very gently used burn heart rate monitor off Marketplace the next day and am super excited to go back and use it!!

This studio is so beautiful! I love trying out different locations for OTF and this one is a favorite. 

The staff is super friendly and welcoming. The set up is a tiny but different from others but easy to navigate. Parking is easily found as well. You can park around the corner in the garage or in the parking lot across the street from the front doors. 

The coaches here are fantastic and super motivating! I would recommend checking out this studio!

I love that the classes here actually pushes me to work harder than I would ever be able to do, just hitting the gym on my own. Staff is very friendly and helpful, and the coaches do a great job of leading class, and making sure you understand the floor exercises and have proper form.

I absolutely love my Orange Theory Gym at Nickel Plate. I started going in September, as I've heard raving reviews about OTF in general for many years. I was always scared to go because I don't really consider myself "athletic" and working out around people always intimidated me. 

Well I got engaged, so eminent wedding photos was the push I needed to finally go! And I am so happy I did. No other work out plan has pushed me so hard and made me feel so strong. The team is so incredibly encouraging, and I've never felt too weak or too unaccomplished to be there. It's a welcoming place; they'll push you hard, but it's all in good spirit. 

I've been going three months now and I've seen a noticeable change in my strength (I actually have some muscles now?!) and in my confidence.  Plus it's made me a morning person, which I never thought possible before (I go to the 6:20am class). 

If you end up going, definitely try Coach Tony's class!! He has the BEST playlists.

I was a member here 8 years ago and rejoined within the last year. Most of the equipment hasn't been updated in that long. Free weight section is fine and they offer some decent classes (even though group x room is small). I have since transferred my membership to a different retro that is further away.

I have come to this place for quite a bit now. The front desk does a good job BUT... a few points that are easy to change are noticeable but nobody seems to care...
The showers are horrendous... hairs all over... and no doorknobs on some bathroom doors.
The machines are NOT wiped by people... so they smell and many of them are fixed with tape... please tell people to clean after they sweat or have someone clean at night.

The floor in the whole place is covered with stains and please don't do your pushups too low or you might get close to a few surprises. Can someone clean the place, fix broken weight machines and put air in the exercise room? I see these women a few times a week coming out of that room as if they had sat down in a sauna...I asked if it was a body combat class... there is no air was the answer.

When it comes to personal trainers... the companies that have worked there have not held one person for more than a month...they cannot do it.


Please get clean, you'll get more clients...

Julie

Compared to nearby LA Fitness much better value, cleaner, friendlier, better run, better maintained, lack of basketball means far less crowded and since i don't play anymore this is perfect for me....i recommend this gym.

An affordable alternative to many costly gyms. They boast a $20 a month promotion, although this only includes machines. Most of the people that come here are very fit and BUILT, so be prepared to feel the pressure!

They do also have classes you can add on on a daily basis like yoga or zumba. This will cost you only $1 extra, or if you're not a member $5, which is great since most gyms require you to be a member to take classes. 

They have the standard changing rooms, showers and bathroom. They do also have tanning here that you can add to your membership. And as most gyms they have a fun smoothie bar. Everyone at the front desk is always very friendly and courteous and I see plenty of people seem to make friends while at the gym too.

Not as friendly and functional as Fairless Hills, PA or Lawrenceville, NJ locations. Movie room had the curtain nailed to the ceiling so there is a constant glare from the main room on the screen and some of the auxiliary headphone jacks didn't work on the machines but the TVs function.  The counter person seemed to be annoyed that I asked a question and like she was doing me a favor by letting me use my paid membership.

Love this location.  I been going for about almost a year and I still like it.  Never dirty always clean and that's including machines and bathrooms.  Staff are also nice and helpful.  Same crowd most of the time.  What's nice is that is not overcrowded , except Monday evenings.  Usually more guys than girls but everyone mind their own business.  Is a nice group of people.

If all you need is a clean, open, vibrant gym with lots of machines, treadmills, and cardio equipment, then this place is solid.  Don't be discouraged by my low rating.

My low rating is based on personal disappointment with the limited free weights.  And I'm compelled to post this review for the benefit of others like me who have struggled to find the right gym in our area.  

CONS:  Just one squat rack.  And just two flat benches.  The ads I saw and the research I did led me to believe there'd be more.  Granted, at the time I went, I could have used the benches or the rack without having to wait.  But I doubt that would be the case on a weeknight or weekend.

PROS:  Despite my qualms above, free weight area is fairly spacious, and segregated enough from the machines and cardio, such that intermediate and advanced lifters can operate unimpeded and without scaring or irritating the other folk.

Awesome gym, really nice staff, rude owner!

They overcharged my credit card for 6 months after I canceled my membership and the owner refused to even meet me half way for a reimbursement.  His words exactly, "It ain't in our system, so we don't owe you nothing."  It's a shame because I really enjoyed this gym and I never had to wait for the clean and modern equipment.  With an attitude like that from the owner, I probably would discourage anyone from using this gym (i.e., why they get 2-stars).

This is the best gym in the planet. Marc who co owns this with other family members is fantastic, professional and keeps the place spotless. They make sure to say hello and goodbye when you leave and more importantly the gym has everything you need. They also have fantastic trainers like Nicole!! Sing up now!!!

Do not patronize this facility! I joined at another Snap location, which I would recommend. However, when I tried to use this location they informed me I was " not welcome to workout" there. I inquired as to the reason and they told me my contract does not allow me to use other locations other than where I joined. After speaking to a corporate representative, I was told that their claim was untrue. The owner of the Columbus Snap then reported me as being abusive and banned me. I was never abusive and implored corporate to review their surveillance video, as all Snaps are under surveillance. According to the corporate representative the owner at Columbus Snap stated they would not turn over the video for review because it was private property. FAIR WARNING... This specific location uses lies and manipulations as part part of their business practices. My recommendation is to give your business to a different Snap.

I absolutely love this gym! I have been a member to other gyms which include:

Retro fitness (Lumberton) which was a decent gym.

La Fitness (Mount Laurel) which I wasn't the biggest fan of. I just didn't like how big it was and the environment was one I personally didn't like for working out I didn't feel comfortable at this type of gym.

Snap fitness (Hainesport) was the worst experience I ever had at a gym let alone with anywhere I have ever been a customer to. The owner Adele and her husband (who owns the Medford location) are very awful with customer service. I do not recommend ANYONE to this location and if you have been to this horrible location and didn't like your experience I highly recommend the Columbus location.

Thankfully I gave Columbus a try before totally nicking Snap Fitness as a whole. It was the best decision I made. I love working out but was struggling to find a location that I was comfortable with and fit around my schedule. Also most importantly a gym that had enough equipment but not an overwhelming amount. This gym is what i've been looking for in a gym and more. The first day I went there I was a little skeptical because Adele (Hainesport owner) was such a witch and I didn't want to deal with another person like her. I won't forget how welcoming these three brothers were from that very moment when my husband and I walked in the door. I was instantly relieved and happy with my decision to go there. They welcomed me an apologized for what that other location did. I was told I could go to any Snap Fitness but Adele lied her pricing is based on HER GYM ONLY. However, Dennis, Stephen and Mark honored what I signed up for; given the circumstances. Every time I walk into Columbus they welcome me and at the end of my work out they always make sure to say bye have a good night! These guys know how to treat customers. They take great care of the gym and always have the AC on. I've had many great work outs at this location. Peter is the personal trainer here. I have not had sessions with him but he has went out of his way to talk to me he's such a nice, friendly, outgoing person. When I was pregnant he came over to me to ask what I was having and what his name was going to be. He even saw me trying grab a weight at an awkward position and went out of his way to help me by handing me my weights in-between his training session. I was so thankful for his help!! This has happened on several occasions with him helping me reach for a weight or bar that was a little high for me or too far away from my reach.

Snap Fitness Columbus gave me more motivation to want to work out which is the most important thing, finding a gym that motivates you to want to keep going not one that gives you an excuse not to go. I can't say enough what a great gym this is in every aspect. As a female I can say I am 100% comfortable here and my husband loves this gym too. Snap Fitness Columbus works for him and I which I can't say was the case for any gym prior to this one. I decided to finally write this review because even after my first visit, which was about 15 months ago, these men continue to be so kind and I want to express my gratitude. They put 100% into the gym. I hope people see this review and go to this location you will be happy and motivated! Sorry if any of this was repetitive or it dragged out but I did not want to miss out on anything and wanted to emphasize how great this gym truly is. I can honestly say I wouldn't be working out anymore if I didn't find this gym.

This is where I began my fitness journey. While not a large gym, this Snap has all there is to offer and top-quality equipment. This isn't the shabby, worn down equip you'll find at a Planet Fitness or a Gold's Gym. 

The staff is excellent and always puts the member first. Inside, the space is immaculate and ALWAYS clean. I've been a member for over two years and my membership was money well spent. 

I honestly have no complaints. This is the ideal gym for all ages and is nestled in a very nice community. You can be a beginner, elder, or a experienced bodybuilder and still have a lot to take away from this Snap Fitness. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a solid gym at a great value.

And I forgot mention, there's many classes too!

Awesome place! I drove to Boise from California and am a very competitive MMA fighter who's always looking to train around the world and this gym exceeded my expectations a very welcoming gym and encouraging as well I was very pleased with the training I got. I've been around the world training already in my career and will say that whether you're training competitively or just for fun this is a good stop

We brought our son to Combat Fitness so he could learn some striking and ju-jitsu. We were also hoping it will build his confidence in uncomfortable situations. Jesse and his crew have done a great job introducing my son to this great sport. I like forward to some amazing results 

Thanks for your time and efforts.

I started taking Jiu Jitsu at Combat Fitness as a way to exercise and start a new hobby. I set up a meeting to take a tour with Jesse Brock and he was very informative as to what I could expect. You can take a range of different classes from Jiu Jitsu to boxing to Muy Thai. There is also a modest free weight area if you wanted to get a lift in before or after training. The vibe isn't one of dominance or arrogance either. Everyone is there to learn, train, and have a good time. Jesse and all of the trainers are super nice and accommodating to everyone skill levels. I really enjoy the time I have spent at combat Fitness.

Been coming here for a couple weeks now and I got to say the People Are Awesome the gym is nice and overall a very welcoming experience it's real hard to not like this place I highly recommend that if you want to practice Brazilian Jiu Jitsu my only complaint is that they have one big mat that everyone trains on other than that I really the free weights also I came from the gym where you had to hang your own boxing bag and of course they have a cage to practice in. I really do look forward to Growing with this gym

I am disappointed in the operations of Combat Fitness. I had planned to be able to come in and work off some stress and anger over the months. Then I had life take over and I ended up having to buy a new car to be able to make it to work. I called Combat Fitness to see if they would stop charging me... they weren't genuine what so ever. They are continuing to take money from my account and they have put me in a bad position to the point I cannot pay my own rent. I don't recommend this to anyone who is living real life and sometimes can't afford $200 a month at some points.

Stopped in while traveling. Had a warm welcome from their front desk and coach. Accidentally took the wrong class. I had come in for advanced but ended up going with foundations. Wasn't a problem though because both coaches were super knowledgeable plus a great team vibe. If I'm in the area again I'll definitely stop in! Good workouts.

Can't beat the price I love it and the girls who watch my child while I work out do an amazing job. My little one is always excited to see them! They have everything you need. The staff is friendly. They greet you with a warm smiles right when you walk in the door. Non judgmental, there are all shapes and sizes all there to love a healthy lifestyle. The only down fall I would say is the women's room doesn't have a sauna like the other location. But if you sweat hard enough I guess you don't need it. Also, just added cycling classes. ‍

Crunch Fitness Bloomingdale provides state of the art equipment, clean facility, great classes and positive energy. I love going to workout whether classes or in the gym. Vanessa Gonzalez is my most favorite instructor I've ever had at any gym. She makes working out fun and positive for my soul. I enjoy working out in the gym area. The energy of the members is amazing and motivating.

You can't beat the price. Crunch is a bit out of my way but in my opinion a lot better than some of the other $10 gyms around. The machines are well kept and clean. Most seem pretty new. I like how large the space is, and it's needed. Holy cow does Crunch get busy at peak times.

They have a huge variety of machines, free weights, and cardio equipment. I wish they had more locations!
I have been going to this gym now for 6 months. Clean gym area and plenty of space. Also a super friendly staff!! The only reason I didn't go 5 stars is the lock room is need of a huge upgrade.

Favorite gym chain in the Tampa area that beats competitors with the $9.99 month rate (no pressure to upgrade to $20 unlimited location access). The Lithia Pinecrest/Bloomingdale location is large and has just about everything in terms of equipment for gyms of this size. They have an extensive area of cross fit/functional type equipment (weighted tires, climbing ropes etc) and a long row of squat racks. The cardio 3 level deck is more than adequate in treadmills even for the busiest hours. 

Why not 5 Stars? Pricing is excellent. Equipment has everything I can use. Their "No Judgements" brand is brilliant as they are about the only firm to seriously challenge the LA Fitness near monopoly. However it's still busy here and you may have to wait to get to the free weights. Yes that's about any gym now in the one size fits all, LA Fitness model driven industry, but still dampens the experience.

I have been a member for a couple years , u cant beat the price 20 bucks includes all the classes, tanning, massage ,sauna for men , Great hours of operation, lots of parking , childcare and u can bring a friend! Some of the cardio equipment is broken at times but besides that great value!

I haven't tried to cancel my membership but will be soon. I joined in Seminole and prefer that location to this one. Btw what is with all the Fox News bs by your treadmills ? I've asked numerous times to change at least one. All I get is this look.

You would think that this company would be considerate giving a current PANDEMIC but not these unprofessional people still charge you for a membership you can't even utilize like really that's bull and then then they scam you by still charging you which essentially puts you in collections for something that is out of your control not to mention the financial burden that so many people around the world are going through and not to mention aren't even back to work sorry but a gym membership is the least of my worries I have a family to take care of and this company failed to understand that and continued to charge me for a membership and refused to correct the issue and cancel my membership I will definitely be take this to the better business bureau.

The gym use to be a Lifestyle Family Fitness center.
Crunch has remodeled a bit but not much. I won a 3 month free membership, so I decided to try it out.  I do like the classes I have tried thus far.  The abomination class  (abs) is a great class that includes a lot of core work.  I also tried the Jillian Michael class which was an intense workout that was great strength and cardio.  They Yoga class was my favorite.  It is an hour long class that is focused on the poses and strength of holding the poses.   My  critique is that no one offered to show me how to use the machines or offer me any information about the gym.  What they have done is try to sell me a membership every time I come in and that is getting old.  Either you gave me a free 3 month membership in order for me to make a decision or you want a sale.  It seems like they want a sale and that does not sit well with me.  I've only been going for two weeks.  Give me a moment to make a decision for myself.

They only play Classic Rock in the morning which sucks! I've requested several times that they play a variety of music because of their diverse population to no avail. I'm May change my membership for this alone.

If I could give this a zero star I would. In March 2020 I decided to joint Crunch Fitness on Bloomingdale. Of everyone knows COVID happened shortly after. During the state wide shutdown I attempted to find a number to call crunch in order to cancel my membership because my wife is high risk. Of course there are no general contact number because the gym is franchised.  I tried contacting the gym during the closer and was unsuccessful. So, on Monday May 18, 2020 Gym's opened as well did crunch fitness. I called them at 0800 to cancel my account. They said in order to cancel I would have to go in person or send a certified letter.  So after work at 3pm I stopped by. I learned that as of that day everyone in crunch was charged $27 which was ok if I was going to use the gym. I talked to the AM and explained that I won't be using the gym at all because of my wife's status and asked if I could be refunded my money because of COVID. Their response was "no, we are not giving any refunds. If we gave you a refund we would have to give everyone a refund."  So I spoke to the GM. At this point I just wanted my account canceled. She wouldn't cancel my account because when you initially sign up there is a 90 day mandatory period. Fine my $27 takes me to my 90th day but I still wouldn't be using the gym. The GM said oh btw in ten days you're going to be charged approximately $45 for your annual fee.  Wait what? I explained that it's not that I don't want to use the gym it's that I can't again due to my wife's condition. GM then mentioned she may need to contact her manager and get a doctors not about my wife's condition. I've called everyday since to get an update from the GM and have been unsuccessful because the GM is always busy but won't return my calls even though I leave my information. Finally someone talked to me and relayed messages between the GM and I on the phone because the GM Kirstey won't take the call. I was told " Kirstey has already passed your information to her manager and he will get back with you. We no longer have access to your account and can't change the active status."  There was no guarantee that the annual charge wouldn't be charge to my account nor that I would get my $27 back and my account was still active. I will never join a gym again nor will I ever recommend crunch to anyone.

Update may 23, 2020- 
As of yesterday I noticed that crunch never charged my bank account the $27 like I was told (they weren't supposed to anyway because I only authorized my credit card to be charged). They did however, try to charge my credit card on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday even though I already told them in person on Monday I was canceling my account.

Can't beat a low gym bill every month but there is a hidden fee which defeats the purpose of a cheap monthly payment. The hours on the weekend kind of suck cause they are only open until 7pm. 
On the plus side, it is a very big and well kept gym and everyone is really nice there!

Was in yesterday 5 pieces of equipment had out of order signs. Went to use the leg press and it was broken. When I reported it to staff I was told.." yeah we know about it, but we are out of out of order signs."  The cardio theater is a wreck and hasn't worked right in a year and a half. The place is always a bit over crowded. The front desk staff is usually very nice. I have never been in that I wasn't at least greeted with a smile or told "good bye" when I left.  I've only encountered a few of the personal trainers... They don't seem friendly at all and one of them is actually kind of a jerk. If you like a good front desk staff... And that's all that matters for you it's a nice place. But if you actually want to work out I would not suggest it.


Update: went back today and some of the machines were being repaired. For the second time I tried the audio app that is supposed to work with the cardio theater. It completely earns the 1.5 star review. The sound quality is bad and the TVs do not align with the app.  After the review. I was contacted by the front desk manager... like I said before. Top notch front desk staff.
I don't always skip leg day but when i do, it's because the equipment is "taking a rest day." overall gym could be better.

I've been going here for a year and a half and I love it!!! Front desk is super friendly and have a variety of equipment so I get to change my workouts based on what I want to do such as cardio, lifting, etc. Only downside is that they don't have a variety of exercise bands compared to the other Crunch facilities I go to like the one in Tampa Palms. BUT One of the front desk associates let me borrow her own personal one which I really appreciated 

It tends to get reaalllllly busy during certain times mostly the evening and early morning. To the point where I actually have to schedule what workouts I do based on what time I go. but I say afternoon is the best if you have gymtimidation and want to workout in peace.

This place is shady as hell.  The owner, Jeffrey Young, has charged me repeatedly even though I NEVER signed up to become a member - I only did a one day trial.  I called the very next day after my trial and said I will not be becoming a member.  A month and a half later I am being charged non stop by the gym.  

This place is turning people into members without their consent!!!   And the owner takes no accountability for the unprofessional staff. 

The gym is disgusting. The stalls in the bathroom were lined with boogers and the guy mopping took his filthy broom and shoved the broom under my stall while I was using the bathroom!!!

Equipment is broken down and worn.  Nothing is updated and the entire gym smells like a fart.  

Do not go here!!!   Goto Anytime Fitness instead - professional people and nice facilities.

Gym was ok, until my kid started screaming when I mentioned the word "gym". The child care has 1-2 young girls who don't know what they're doing for about 20-30 kids at a time. My kid has never been so sick until we started coming to this gym. The childcare has a musty mold smell, just look at the carpet in the child care room. 
The manager brian is unprofessional and rude. He started yelling at me and my husband in the middle of the weight floor instead of pulling us aside and telling us our child is crying. He started telling us the policy is a kid crying 5-7 min and it's stressful for everyone involved to force our kid to cry for that long, he went on to tell us that he would never bring his 8 month old out at 5p because that's his child's  cranky time. And a bunch of bullshit before I got to ask him if my child was crying right now. Finally my husband grabbed my child out of the childcare and we left pissed off. I called back 10 min down the road to cancel the membership and Saul answered the phone. I said "'hi I was just in.." He cut me off saying "yea with the crying child hold on Brian was helping you". Wow, this gym was  horrible experience. Brian gets on the phone, I tell him it's best if we cancel membership because our child can't stop crying in there child care all of the sudden( first month I did 2 a days and he was completely fine playing in there. No issue) all of a sudden one day we started having issues and the girls had to get us almost every time we went. We stopped coming 2x a day and shortened our length to 20-40 min workouts. Nothing was working. Brian's response was " why didn't you cancel it before you left here?" I said " I wanted to make a rationed decision and not in the heat of the moment". He said well you're going to have to come back and sign a paper being you are 2 months in your membership and contract is until 3 months we won't charge you your last month but your fees for this month are in process so we can't stop it. Ok whatever, next morning I drive 10 miles to crunch just to sign this paper. I walk through the door and janell at the front desk tells me there's no paper to sign and her and Saul don't know why he told me to come sign a paper. So the outcome was I drove there for no reason, Brian never sent the email to corporate to close both my husbands & my account. I called up the next week janell sent an email the next week got charged again called janell up she sent corporate another email they refunded the money they took out. It's 2 months later and I'm getting charged randomly again. I would not recommend anyone to come here.

This is maybe the one and only crunch that is not as packed than the others where you're waiting in line for a machine. Pretty spacious, open concept. They have many squat bar stations, cardio area, and weight machine areas. However, every limited ab machines. This place has a sauna, massage chairs, and a very narrow tanning space. 
4/5 stars.

Predatory billing sums up this particular location.  They thrive of threatening emails and text.  The top manager lacks courage to meet you face to face.  Instead he relies on a staff to catch the brunt of complaints.   I closed my Acct in full mid November, but never received a confirmation from the quote "corporate office". I was told it could take weeks.  I just happened to check my online Acct, and was charged for December, even though I finalized closure of my Acct in November.  So instead of sending me a notification, they send my Acct to collections.  Again the management has no courage and only looks after revenue flow.  They are not customer based.  I feel sorry for those who can't afford an attorney to hold the owners accountable and after having their credit score destroyed.  So when they advertise they are they to help you meet your goals, you know it isn't true.  Check the BBB regarding the Bloomingdale location, not a single complaint was resolved.  Don't just read the 5 star reviews, drill down and read 1 star reviews.  I challenge who ever is the top leader at this location to meet me in person and discuss my account.  We can meet at your attorney's office or mine.

This gym is terrible. They have male employees in the women's locker/restrooms to "fix" things with no notice or signs up with women in there. When I complained to the manager he said "oh yeah, I knew he was in there." I told him no one else did. He said "it was a plumbing emergency sorry."  When I joined no one gave me a tour of the facility and I got the hard sell to buy the top tier membership. The "free" appointment with Michael the trainer was a joke. 20 minutes in to the appointment and he was trying to sell me a $1,000 personal training program with him. When I said no, he was done. There are never any "trainers" willing to show you how to use the equipment. I gave up after a month. Not worth the frustration. Cancelled my membership a month ago and they are still billing me. I am filing a complaint with the Florida Attorney General's office.

Was in yesterday 5 pieces of equipment had out of order signs. Went to use the leg press and it was broken. When I reported it to staff I was told.." yeah we know about it, but we are out of out of order signs."  The cardio theater is a wreck and hasn't worked right in a year and a half. The place is always a bit over crowded. The front desk staff is usually very nice. I have never been in that I wasn't at least greeted with a smile or told "good bye" when I left.  I've only encountered a few of the personal trainers... They don't seem friendly at all and one of them is actually kind of a jerk. If you like a good front desk staff... And that's all that matters for you it's a nice place. But if you actually want to work out I would not suggest it.

Just updating my review on this location. Still skipping leg day because no one can fix anything in this gym apparently. It's been one month going on two since my last post. Still can't get these legs to grow. Thanks Crunch Fitness!
Great Crunch location, has its flaws but beats any competitor gym within a 25 mile circumference

If I could give this a zero star I would. In March 2020 I decided to joint Crunch Fitness on Bloomingdale. Of everyone knows COVID happened shortly after. During the state wide shutdown I attempted to find a number to call crunch in order to cancel my membership because my wife is high risk. Of course there are no general contact number because the gym is franchised.  I tried contacting the gym during the closer and was unsuccessful.
